0.content: There are four interest classes at the school: dance, singing, Go, and painting. Three children, Xiao Yu, Xiao Ming, and Xiao Li, are preparing to sign up, and each can only enroll in one class, and they must choose different classes. How many different ways are there to sign up?

1.content: There are $$2$$ different English books, $$4$$ different Chinese books, and $$3$$ different math books on the bookshelf. Now, if you want to take out $$2$$ books, and they cannot be from the same subject, how many different ways are there to choose them?

29.content: Zhang, Wang, and Li are three workers who work as a lathe operator, a fitter, and an electrician in three factories: A, B, and C. ① Zhang is not in Factory A; ② Wang is not in Factory B; ③ The worker in Factory A is not a fitter; ④ The worker in Factory B is a lathe operator; ⑤ Wang is not an electrician. Then, what position does Zhang hold in which factory, what position does Wang hold in which factory, and what position does Li hold in which factory?

31.content: Xiao Ming, Xiao Qiang, and Xiao Hua participated in the Hua Cup competition. They are contestants from Luohu District, Futian District, and Nanshan District, and they won first, second, and third prizes respectively. Now it is known that: (1) Xiao Ming is not a contestant from Luohu District; (2) Xiao Qiang is not a contestant from Futian District; (3) The contestant from Luohu District did not win the first prize; (4) The contestant from Futian District won the second prize; (5) Xiao Qiang did not win the third prize. Based on the above information, which district is Xiao Hua from, and what prize did he win (fill in the Chinese characters for first, second, or third)?

32.content: Before the horse racing competition, five spectators predicted the rankings of five horses labeled $$A, B, C, D, E$$. Person A said: "$$B$$ is third, $$C$$ is fifth." Person B said: "$$E$$ is fourth, $$D$$ is fifth." Person C said: "$$A$$ is first, $$E$$ is fourth." Person D said: "$$C$$ is first, $$B$$ is second." Person E said: "$$A$$ is third, $$D$$ is fourth." As a result, each spectator guessed correctly only half of the time, what is the rank of horse $$C$$?

33.content: In a race, Little White Rabbit, Little Black Rabbit, Little Flower Rabbit, and Little Gray Rabbit participated. After the race, Little White Rabbit, Little Black Rabbit, and Little Flower Rabbit made the following statements, while Little Gray Rabbit did not say anything. Little White Rabbit: Little Flower Rabbit is in first place, I am in third place; Little Black Rabbit: I am in first place, Little Gray Rabbit is in fourth place; Little Flower Rabbit: Little Gray Rabbit is in second place, I am in third place. After the results were announced, it was found that they each only told half of the truth, and Little Flower Rabbit is in what place?

34.content: In a certain math competition, among three people A, B, and C, only one person won a prize. A said, "I won the prize." B said, "I didn't win the prize." C said, "A didn't win the prize." Only one of their statements is true. Who won the prize?

It is known that each of them guessed exactly half correct, so what place is A in?

71.content: A train has a total length of $$220$$ meters, with the front of the train measuring $$20$$ meters, and each of the remaining carriages measuring $$24$$ meters. It is also known that the distance between every two carriages is $$1$$ meter. How many carriages are there in total (including the front of the train)?

72.content: The little snail walks steadily from the front door to the $$11^{th}$$ tree, taking $$110$$ minutes. If this little snail walks for $$240$$ minutes, how many trees will it reach? (There are no trees at the front door)

73.content: There is a wall clock that strikes once every hour, striking the number of times corresponding to the hour. At six o'clock, it takes $$5$$ seconds to finish striking. How many seconds will it take to finish striking at twelve o'clock?

74.content: A train has $$13$$ carriages (including the locomotive as one carriage), the locomotive is $$10$$ meters long, each of the other carriages is $$12$$ meters long, and the gap between each carriage is $$1$$ meter. What is the total length of this train in meters?

75.content: On a green belt in the middle of the highway, workers plant a pine tree every $$3$$ meters, and a total of $$50$$ pine trees are planted. They also plan to plant a willow tree every $$1$$ meter between two adjacent pine trees. How many willow trees are needed?
75.kc: 两端都不植树类型问题(段数小于等于10)

76.content:
1) The distance between two buildings is $$40$$ meters. If a cedar tree is planted every $$4$$ meters, how many cedar trees can be planted in total? (The width of the trees is negligible)  
2) The school has a small path that is $$60$$ meters long, and there are plans to plant trees on both sides of the path. If a tree is planted every $$10$$ meters, including at both ends, how many trees need to be planted in total? (The width of the trees is negligible)

77.content:
1) The school is holding a Children's Day party, and there is a rope hanging a string of balloons from one end to the other, with a total of $$12$$ balloons. The distance between each pair of adjacent balloons is $$5$$ decimeters. What is the length of the rope in decimeters? (The width of the balloons is negligible.)

2) In front of the "Youth Activity Center," there is a straight road where trees are planted on one side (no trees are planted at the end near the entrance). A total of $$30$$ trees are planted, with a distance of $$5$$ meters between each pair of trees. What is the length of the road in meters? (The width of the trees is negligible.)

78.content: Xiao Fei wants to go to the $$8$$th floor of a building. He took $$60$$ seconds to walk from the $$1$$st floor to the $$4$$th floor. How many more seconds does he need to walk to the $$8$$th floor at the same speed?

79.content: Eddie wrote according to the pattern "spring, summer, autumn, winter, spring, summer, autumn, winter, ..." a total of $$23$$ characters. How many times did he write the character "spring"?

80.content: Eddie had some marbles. After giving Wei Er $$5$$ marbles, he bought $$10$$ more from the store, and then he had a total of $$30$$ marbles. How many marbles did Eddie originally have?

81.content: October 1, 2016, is a Saturday. What day of the week will it be in 20 days?

82.content: On the playground of a certain elementary school, colorful flags are arranged in the following order. There are a total of $$42$$ flags. How many red flags and how many yellow flags are there among these $$42$$ colorful flags?

83.content: A number multiplied by $$7$$ and added to $$5$$ results in $$54$$. What is the number?

84.content: A number, when divided by $$4$$, added $$4$$, multiplied by $$4$$, and then subtracted $$4$$, results in $$16$$. What is the number?

85.content: A barrel of oil was used half of its total amount the first time, then half of the remaining amount the second time, and there are $$12$$ kilograms left. How much did the barrel of oil weigh originally in kilograms?

86.content: The yard originally had a certain number of tons of coal. In the first transport, half of the original coal was taken out, in the second transport, $$150$$ tons were brought in, and in the third transport, $$50$$ tons were taken out. As a result, $$300$$ tons remain. How many tons of coal did the yard originally have?

87.content: A certain number, when added to $$3$$, then multiplied by $$3$$, divided by $$2$$, and finally subtracted by $$2$$, results in $$10$$. What is the original number?

88.content: The construction team needs to build a path. On the first day, they repaired more than half of the total length by $$6$$ meters. On the second day, they repaired less than half of the remaining length by $$2$$ meters. At this point, there are still $$6$$ meters left to repair. What is the total length of the path?

89.content: There are a total of $$27$$ birds on three trees. From the first tree, $$2$$ birds fly to the second tree, $$3$$ birds fly from the second tree to the third tree, and $$4$$ birds fly from the third tree to the first tree. At this point, there are the same number of birds on each tree. How many birds were originally on the first tree, the second tree, and the third tree?

90.content: Li Bai took a pot to buy wine, encountered the store and drank double, met the flower and drank eight ounces. After encountering the store and the flower, he drank all the wine in the pot. How much wine was originally in the pot?

91.content: There are three piles of apples: A, B, and C, totaling $$96$$ apples. In the first step, an amount of apples equal to the number in pile B is taken from pile A and added to pile B. In the second step, an amount of apples equal to the number in pile C is taken from pile B and added to pile C. In the third step, an amount of apples equal to the remaining number in pile A is taken from pile C and added back to pile A. At this point, the number of apples in all three piles is equal. How many apples were originally in pile A, pile B, and pile C?

92.content: A and B each have some glass balls. If A takes out the same number of glass balls as B has and gives them to B, and then B also takes out the same number of glass balls from what he currently has and gives them to A, at that time both of them have exactly $$20$$ glass balls. How many glass balls did A originally have?

93.content: Xiao Ming paid $$1$$ yuan to enter the first store, then spent half of the remaining money in the store, and paid another $$1$$ yuan when he left. After that, he paid $$1$$ yuan to enter the second store, spent half of the remaining money in that store, and paid another $$1$$ yuan when he left. He then entered the third store in the same way, and after leaving the third store, he only had $$1$$ yuan left. How much money did he have before entering the first store?

94.content: Viola made a total of $$200$$ flowers in $$10$$ minutes. How many flowers did she make per minute?

95.content: Jiajia found many Russian nesting dolls. Jiajia gave half of all the dolls to Wei'er, and then gave half of what was left to Eddie. At this point, Jiajia still has $$4$$ dolls left. Can you calculate how many Russian nesting dolls Jiajia initially found?

96.content: The math test scores are out, and Iron Mom asked Xiao Tie for his score. Xiao Tie said that if he subtracts $$20$$ from his score, multiplies it by $$2$$, divides by $$3$$, and then adds $$54$$, it equals $$100$$. What score did Xiao Tie actually get?

97.content: In the orchard, there is a peach tree. One day, $$2$$ little monkeys came to pick peaches to eat. The first monkey ate $$1$$ peach and picked half of the remaining peaches. Then the second monkey ate $$2$$ peaches and picked half of the remaining peaches. At this point, there were exactly $$14$$ peaches left on the tree. How many peaches were there originally on the tree?

98.content: Xiao Ming walked $$180$$ meters in $$3$$ minutes. At this speed, how far is it from his home to school if it takes him $$15$$ minutes?

99.content: Three cars are transporting coal simultaneously. In $$4$$ days, they transported $$480$$ tons. On average, how many tons does each car transport per day?

100.content: If $$5$$ people can repair $$700$$ meters of road in $$10$$ days, how many meters can $$10$$ people repair in $$3$$ days?

101.content: If $$4$$ people can repair $$400$$ meters of road in $$10$$ days, how many meters can $$10$$ people repair in $$3$$ days?

102.content: Aunt Wang has $$5$$ different styles of tops, $$7$$ different pairs of pants, and $$6$$ different pairs of shoes. How many different combinations can be formed by choosing one of each for each outing?

103.content: There are a total of $$22$$ candies. Chen Chen took some first, and Yuan Yuan had to take the rest. Yuan Yuan saw that Chen Chen took too many, so he snatched $$4$$ candies from Chen Chen; Yuan Yuan was unhappy, so Chen Chen had to give Yuan Yuan $$2$$ more candies. At this point, Yuan Yuan and Chen Chen have the same amount of candies. How many candies did Chen Chen take at first?

114.content: Among the three students, Xiao Hua, Xiao Li, and Xiao Lv, one person helped the sick Xiao Hong to redo the notes. When Xiao Hong asked who did this good deed, Xiao Hua said, "It was done by Xiao Li." Xiao Li said, "It wasn't me." Xiao Lv said, "It wasn't me either." In fact, two people are lying, and only one person is telling the truth. So, who helped Xiao Hong redo the notes?

115.content: Xiao Hong's mother's bike ride to the market took a distance of $$600$$ meters, and she used a total of $$3$$ minutes. What is Xiao Hong's mother's speed in meters per minute?

(2) Which first elementary school's grade donated the most?
(3) Which second elementary school's grade donated the least?
(4) How much did the first elementary school donate in total?

134.content: In the cage, there are chickens and rabbits. It is known that the number of chickens is twice the number of rabbits, and the total number of legs is $$120$$. How many rabbits and how many chickens are there?

135.content: In the zoo, ostriches and zebras live on the same piece of grassland, with a total of $$55$$ animals. The number of legs of the ostriches is $$2$$ times that of the zebras. How many zebras are there?

137.content: In the forest park, there are some chickens and rabbits. It is known that the number of rabbits is equal to the number of chickens, and they have a total of $$102$$ legs. How many chickens are there, and how many rabbits are there?

138.content: There are a total of $$15$$ chickens and rabbits in the same cage, and there are $$34$$ legs in total in the cage. How many chickens and how many rabbits are there in the cage?

139.content: In an office, there are $$7$$ people who love drinking tea, $$10$$ people who love drinking coffee, and $$3$$ people who love both tea and coffee. If everyone loves at least one of tea or coffee, how many people are there in total in the office?

140.content: There are a total of $$30$$ soldiers in the Navy SEALs. Each soldier is skilled in either shooting, hand-to-hand combat, or both. If there are $$12$$ soldiers skilled in shooting and $$23$$ skilled in hand-to-hand combat, how many soldiers are skilled in both?

141.content: Recently, a survey was conducted at a busy airport to understand where people usually love to travel. In the past year, $$20$$ people have been to Spain, $$15$$ people have been to France, and $$10$$ people have been to Germany. $$5$$ people have been to both Spain and France, $$3$$ people have been to both Spain and Germany, and $$2$$ people have been to both France and Germany. $$1$$ person has been to all three places. How many people were surveyed in total?

142.content: Xiao Wang is reading a $$200$$-page storybook. He reads $$30$$ pages each day. On what page should he start on the $$5$$th day?

143.content: The Youth Palace is enrolling students for the winter vacation. The calligraphy class has enrolled $$29$$ students, the art class has enrolled $$28$$ students, and the music class has enrolled $$27$$ students. 481.content: Please answer the following question: Class A and Class B have a total of $$105$$ books. The number of books in Class A is $$3$$ times more than Class B plus $$5$$. How many books does Class B have, and how many books does Class A have?

482.content: Class A has $$130$$ books, Class B has $$30$$ books. How many books did Class A give to Class B so that the number of books in Class A is $$10$$ more than twice the number of books in Class B?

483.content: The flower shop has a total of $$86$$ chrysanthemums, roses, and tulips, among which the number of chrysanthemums is twice that of roses, and the number of tulips is three times that of roses minus $$4$$. How many roses are there, how many chrysanthemums are there, and how many tulips are there?

484.content: Calculate the following problem: The monkey and the rooster share milk candies. The number of milk candies the rooster receives is three times that of the monkey plus three, and the rooster has 27 more milk candies than the monkey. What number of milk candies did the monkey receive, and what number did the rooster receive?

488.content: A said to B: "When my age is the same as your current age, you were only $$5$$ years old." B said to A: "When my age is the same as your current age, you will be $$50$$ years old." What are A's and B's current ages?

489.content: The baby whale said, "Mom, when I grow to your size, you will be $$31$$ years old!" Mom whale said, "When I was your size, you were only $$1$$ year old." What are the current ages of the baby whale and the mom whale?

How many students are there in total, and how many buses are there in total?

501.content: Weir has $$7$$ different tops, $$5$$ different pairs of pants, and $$2$$ different pairs of shoes in her closet. Before going to the dance, (1) how many different outfit combinations can she choose from these tops, pants, and shoes?

502.content: Weir has $$7$$ different tops, $$5$$ different pairs of pants, and $$2$$ different pairs of shoes in her wardrobe. If she also has $$3$$ hats and needs to choose suitable combinations from these hats, tops, pants, and shoes to attend the dance, how many different combinations can she create?

503.content: Viola has $$7$$ different tops, $$5$$ different pairs of pants, and $$2$$ different pairs of shoes in her wardrobe. If she also has $$3$$ hats, and she can choose to wear the hats or not, how many different outfit combinations does she have for attending the dance?

504.content: There are four running events in the sports meeting: $$50$$ meters, $$100$$ meters, $$200$$ meters, and $$400$$ meters. If each student can register for any of the four events, how many registration methods are there?

506.content: There are $$2$$ different English books, $$4$$ different Chinese books, and $$3$$ different math books on the bookshelf. Now, if you want to take out $$2$$ books, and they cannot be from the same subject, how many different ways are there to choose them?

507.content: A signal soldier has one red, one yellow, one blue, and one green signal flag. How many different signals can this signal soldier express in total?

539.content: It is defined that $$a$$※$$b$$ represents $$3$$ times $$a$$ minus $$2$$ times $$b$$, that is, $$a$$※$$b=3a-2b$$. For example, $$4$$※$$4=3\times 4-2\times 4=4$$; at the same time, $$a\triangle b$$ represents $$3$$ times $$a$$ plus $$2$$ times $$b$$, that is, $$a\triangle b=3a+2b$$. For example, $$1\triangle 4=3\times 1+2\times 4=11$$. (2) Calculate: What is $$4\triangle(3\triangle5)$$?

540.content: What is the result of calculating $$(8※7)△9$$?

541.content: The symbol “$$*$$” represents a new operation, for example: $$1*1=1$$, $$1*2=3$$, $$1*3=6$$, $$1*4=10$$, $$1*100=5050$$, $$100*2=201$$, $$\cdots\cdots$$. Based on the information above, deduce: (1) What is $$3*4$$?

543.content: There is an operator $$\Delta$$ that makes the following equations true: $$4\Delta 2=6$$, $$6\Delta 4=10$$, $$10\Delta 8=18$$. Based on this pattern, what is the value of $$25\Delta 48$$?

544.content:
Define the symbol “$$\Phi $$” to represent a new operation, such that: $$1\Phi 99=99$$, $$99\Phi 1=99$$, $$5\Phi 9=9$$, $$9\Phi 5=9$$, $$7\Phi 8=8$$, and $$7\Phi 9=9$$. Define the symbol “$$\Delta $$” to represent another new operation, such that: $$1\Delta 99=1$$, $$99\Delta 1=1$$, $$5\Delta 9=5$$, $$9\Delta 5=5$$, $$7\Delta 8=7$$, and $$7\Delta 9=7$$. 
Based on the above information, please calculate: $$\left( 3\Delta 4 \right)\times \left( 5\Phi 6 \right)+\left( 7\Phi 8 \right)\times \left( 9\Delta 10 \right)=$$.

545.kc: 整数除法巧算之类分配律

550.content: The odd numbers starting from $$1$$ are: $$1$$, $$3$$, $$5$$, $$7$$, $$\cdots$$. What is the $$100$$th odd number?

551.content: If each small square of a square board divided into $$16$$ small squares is filled with stones, and the first small square contains $$2$$ stones, the second small square contains $$4$$ stones, the third small square contains $$6$$ stones, the fourth small square contains $$8$$ stones, and so on, how many stones need to be placed in total to fill all $$16$$ small squares?

552.content: A theater has $$20$$ rows of seats, with each subsequent row having $$2$$ more seats than the previous row. The first row has $$32$$ seats. How many seats are there in total in this theater?

553.content: Given a sequence of numbers, starting from the second number, each number is $$3$$ more than the previous one, and the $$17$$th term is $$49$$. What is the first term of the sequence?

554.content: In an arithmetic sequence, the difference between two adjacent numbers is $$8$$, and the $$12$$th term is $$108$$. What is the $$7$$th term?

555.content: Eddie is reading a storybook. Starting from the next day, the number of pages he reads each day is $$4$$ pages more than the previous day. On the $$28$$th day, he read $$110$$ pages. How many pages did he read on the $$8$$th day?

556.content: In an arithmetic sequence, the first number is $$11$$ and the eleventh number is $$51$$. What is the difference between two adjacent numbers?

557.content: Given that the $$6$$th term and the $$10$$th term of an arithmetic sequence are $$38$$ and $$62$$ respectively, what is the difference between two adjacent terms?

558.content: The park set up many rows of flowers to celebrate the festival, with the number of flowers in each row forming an arithmetic sequence. The $$10$$th row has $$62$$ pots of flowers, and the $$25$$th row has $$152$$ pots of flowers. What is the difference in the number of pots of flowers between two adjacent rows?

559.content: There are $$9$$ boxes numbered from $$1$$ to $$9$$, containing a total of $$351$$ candies. It is known that each box has the same number of candies more than the previous box. If box $$1$$ contains $$11$$ candies, how many more candies does each subsequent box contain than the previous box?

560.content: In the World Cup audience area, a certain section of seats is arranged in a trapezoid. Starting from the $$2$$nd row, each row has a fixed number more seats than the previous row. It is known that the $$5$$th row has $$22$$ seats and the $$8$$th row has $$31$$ seats. What is the total number of spectators this area can accommodate if there are a total of $$11$$ rows of seats?

561.content: 1) There is an arithmetic sequence where the first number is $$100$$, the second number is $$120$$, what is the common difference? 2) There is an arithmetic sequence where the first number is $$100$$, the third number is $$120$$, what is the common difference?

562.content: Teacher Li makes candy every day. Starting from the $$2$$nd day, he makes $$7$$ more pieces than the previous day. On the $$11$$th day, he made $$72$$ pieces of candy. How many pieces did he make on the $$6$$th day?

563.content: In a sequence of numbers, starting from the $$2$$nd number, each number is $$4$$ more than the previous one. If the $$26$$th number is $$103$$, what is the $$1$$st number?

564.content: In an arithmetic sequence, the first number is $$15$$ and the seventh number is $$57$$. What is the difference between two adjacent numbers?

565.content:
1) A five-layer bookshelf holds a total of $$450$$ books. For any two adjacent layers, the upper layer has $$10$$ fewer books than the lower layer. How many books are on the top layer?  
2) The park set up $$7$$ rows of flowers to celebrate the holiday, with a total of $$420$$ pots. From front to back, each row has more flowers than the previous one, and the number of flowers in each row forms an arithmetic sequence. The $$7$$th row has $$90$$ pots of flowers. What is the difference in the number of pots of flowers between two adjacent rows?

566.content: There is a pile of uniformly thick logs stacked in a trapezoidal shape, with the same number of logs added for each lower layer. A total of $$8$$ layers were stacked, with $$21$$ logs in the $$4$$th layer and $$33$$ logs in the $$6$$th layer. How many logs are there in total in this pile?

575.content: Max Primary School is hosting the 20th Art Festival. During the opening ceremony, representative teams from each grade enter in order to perform. The first-grade students formed a total of three solid square formations for their performance. (1) Class 1 of the first grade is performing gymnastics, and the formation requirement is: 5 people standing in a row, with a total of 5 rows. How many students are participating in Class 1?

576.content: Max Primary School is holding the 20th Arts Festival. During the opening ceremony, the representative teams from each grade enter in order to perform. The first-grade students formed a total of three solid square formations for their performance. (2) Class 2 of the first grade is performing martial arts, and the formation requires: standing in one row with 12 people, with a total of 12 rows. How many people are participating in Class 2?

577.content: Max Primary School is holding its 20th Art Festival. During the opening ceremony, the representative teams from each grade enter and perform in order. The first-grade students formed three solid square formations to perform. Class 3 of the first grade performed a march, with a total of 121 participants, arranged in rows and columns in a square formation.

578.content: A solid square array has a total of $$81$$ people. If one row and one column are added, how many more people are needed?

579.content: The second-grade students are preparing to perform a choir. All the boys in class $$1$$ of the second grade who are participating in the choir have formed a solid square formation. Then $$17$$ girls joined, adding one row and one column to the outer layer, resulting in a larger solid square formation. How many boys in total from class $$1$$ of the second grade are participating in the choir?

580.content: The fourth grade is arranged into two solid square formations to perform a dance. (1) In Class 1 of the fourth grade, there are $$5$$ people on each side of the outer layer of the square formation. How many people are there in the outer layer in total?

581.content: In the fifth grade, Class 1 has a solid square formation, with a total of $$36$$ people in the outer layer. How many people are there in this square formation in total?

582.content: Sixth-grade students are arranged in a solid square formation, with $$5$$ people left over. If one row is added horizontally and vertically, forming a slightly larger solid square, then $$26$$ people are needed. (2) If $$26$$ more people are added, how many people will there be in the outer layer?

583.content: Students in the third grade of a certain school are arranged in a solid square formation, with $$10$$ people on each side of the outer layer. How many people are there in the entire square formation?

584.content: The students formed a square formation for a lineup. If one row and one column are removed, $$11$$ people are removed. How many people were originally in this square formation?

585.content: A group of students stands in a $$10 \times 10$$ square formation. How many people are there on each side of the outer layer?

586.content: All the students in the third grade lined up in a solid square formation. If they followed the original plan, there would be $$9$$ people left over. If the square formation increases by one row and one column, there would be $$16$$ people short. How many people are there in the third grade?

587.content: Students in the fourth grade of a certain school are arranged in a square formation, with $$40$$ people on the outermost layer. How many people are there on each side of the outer layer of the square formation? How many people are there in total in this square formation?

588.content: The fourth-grade class participated in the radio exercise competition, forming a solid square formation with $$8$$ students in each row and $$8$$ students in each column. How many students are there in total in the square formation?

589.content: During the arts festival at Max Primary School, the third-grade students formed a solid square formation to perform magic, with $$18$$ people on each side of the outer layer. How many people are there in the entire square formation?

590.content: At the arts festival of Max Primary School, the third-grade students formed a solid square formation to perform magic, with $$18$$ people on each side of the outermost layer. How many people are in the outermost layer?

592.content: During the arts festival at Mays Elementary School, the third-grade students formed a solid square formation to perform magic, with $$18$$ people on each side of the outermost layer. How many people are there in the outer three layers in total?

593.content: Using $$64$$ pots of flowers can form a two-layer hollow square. If you want to add another layer outside, how many more pots of flowers are needed?

594.content: Using $$72$$ pieces to form a two-layer hollow square matrix, if you want to add another layer inside, how many pieces do you need to add?

595.content: There are $$120$$ students in the third grade of elementary school. They are arranged in a three-layer hollow square formation. How many people are on each side of the outermost layer?

596.content: There are $$120$$ students in the third grade of elementary school. They are arranged in a three-layer hollow square formation. If, based on (3), one more layer is added inside to make it a five-layer hollow square formation, how many more individuals are needed?

597.content: There is a group of students arranged in a three-layer hollow square formation, with $$9$$ more people. If the hollow part is increased by two layers, there are $$15$$ fewer people. How many students are there?

598.content: (1) The school organized $$16$$ people to participate in the badminton competition. In pairs, they will compete in elimination matches to determine the champion. How many matches will be held in total?

599.content: In a city, a tennis tournament is held with $$32$$ participants. They will pair off for elimination matches to determine the top three. How many matches need to be held in total?

600.content: (1) Five teams $$A$$, $$B$$, $$C$$, $$D$$, and $$E$$ are playing a round-robin tournament, meaning each pair of teams plays one match. How many matches does each team need to play, and how many matches will there be in total?

601.content: There are $$8$$ teams participating in a single round-robin tournament, meaning each team has to play a match against every other team. How many matches does each of the $$5$$ teams need to play, and how many matches will be played in total?

602.content: A, B, C, D, E, and Eddie are six people participating in a round-robin tournament, and part of the competition has already taken place. It is known that A has played $$5$$ matches, B has played $$4$$ matches, C has played $$3$$ matches, D has played $$2$$ matches, and E has played $$1$$ match. How many matches has Eddie played?

603.content: Five teams $$A$$, $$B$$, $$C$$, $$D$$, and $$E$$ are playing a round-robin tournament (each pair of teams plays $$1$$ match). After a period of time, $$A$$ has played $$4$$ matches, $$B$$ has played $$2$$ matches, $$C$$ has played $$2$$ matches, and $$E$$ has played $$1$$ match. At this point, how many matches has $$D$$ played at most and at least?

604.content: In the class, four students are competing in a checkers tournament, with each pair of students playing one match. The winner of each match receives $$2$$ points, each player in a draw receives $$1$$ point, and the loser receives $$0$$ points. (1) What is the total score of the four students?

605.content: In a Chinese chess competition, there are three possible outcomes: winning earns $$2$$ points, a draw earns $$1$$ point, and losing earns $$0$$ points. Now six people are competing in a round-robin tournament. The scores of five of the players are known to be $$7$$, $$6$$, $$5$$, $$4$$, and $$3$$. What is the score of the last person?

606.content: Four soccer teams are playing a round-robin tournament, with each pair of teams playing one match. If the match ends in a tie, each team gets $$1$$ point; otherwise, the winning team gets $$3$$ points and the losing team gets $$0$$ points. (1) What is the minimum total score for the four teams, and what is the maximum total score?

607.content: Jack, Jimmy, Tom, and Sangi are dividing gold coins in front of the pirate ship. The four of them are dividing $$560$$ gold coins. Jack said, "I got $$22$$ coins less than Jimmy, $$30$$ coins more than Tom, and $$40$$ coins less than Sangi." How many coins did Sangi get?

608.content: Eddie and Weier came to the visitor rest area, and they found that there are a total of $$300$$ trees, including poplars, willows, and locust trees. The number of poplars is $$3$$ times that of willows, and the number of locust trees is $$2$$ times that of poplars. How many willows, poplars, and locust trees need to be planted in total?

609.content: There are three people: A, B, and C. A's age is $$3$$ years less than $$2$$ times B's age, B's age is $$2$$ times C's age, and the sum of their ages is $$102$$ years. What is A's age?

610.content: When two positive integers are divided, the quotient is $$6$$ and the remainder is $$5$$. The sum of the dividend, divisor, quotient, and remainder is $$233$$. What is the dividend, and what is the divisor?

611.content: Currently, there are $$129$$ pieces of clothing in Wei Er's clothing store. The number of men's clothing is $$2$$ times that of children's clothing, and the number of women's clothing is $$2$$ times that of men's clothing plus $$3$$ pieces. How many pieces of women's clothing are there?

612.content: The number of textbooks in version A of the Xueersi School is $$50$$ more than that in version B, and the number of textbooks in version A is $$3$$ times that in version B. How many books does each version A and version B have?

613.content: A strong man can carry $$20$$ books with one hand, while Xiao Bai can carry a total of $$10$$ books with both hands. They cooperate to move $$450$$ books from point A to point B. It is known that the number of times the strong man moved is $$2$$ times that of Xiao Bai. How many books did the strong man carry in total, and how many books did Xiao Bai carry? (Both the strong man and Xiao Bai use both hands to carry the books.)

614.content: Xiao Ming, Xiao Liang, and Xiao Gang went fishing. Counting the number of fish they caught, they found that the number of fish caught by Xiao Ming is $$4$$ times that of Xiao Liang, Xiao Liang caught $$5$$ fish less than Xiao Gang, and Xiao Gang caught $$7$$ fish less than Xiao Ming. How many fish did Xiao Ming catch?

615.content: On a certain day, Master Li produced a batch of parts, which he divided into two piles: A and B. If he takes out $$15$$ parts from pile A and puts them into pile B, the number of parts in both piles will be equal; if he takes out $$15$$ parts from pile B and puts them into pile A, the number of parts in pile A will be three times that in pile B. How many parts were originally in pile A, and how many parts did Master Li produce in total that day?
615.kc: 整数系数二元一次方程组解应用题

616.content: The number of green butterflies is $$5$$ times that of yellow butterflies, and the number of red butterflies is $$2$$ times that of yellow butterflies. The number of green butterflies is $$36$$ more than that of red butterflies. How many green butterflies are there?

617.content: When two numbers are divided, the quotient is $$4$$, and the sum of the dividend, divisor, and quotient is $$124$$. What is the dividend?

618.content: There are $$10$$ more monkeys than gorillas in the park, and the number of monkeys is $$2$$ times that of gorillas. How many monkeys are there?
618.kc: 已知两量之间倍数关系和两量之和，求两个量

619.content: Teacher Niu took $$37$$ students on a spring outing. During the break, Eddie asked, "Teacher Niu, how old are you this year?" Teacher Niu amusingly replied, "If you multiply my age by $$2$$, subtract $$16$$, then divide by $$2$$, and add $$8$$, the result is exactly the total number of people participating in today's activity." Children, do you know how old Teacher Niu is this year?

620.content: A bird pecks at millet. The first time it ate more than half of the millet by $$10$$ grains, the second time it ate less than half of the remaining millet by $$12$$ grains, the third time it ate $$14$$ grains, and finally there were $$15$$ grains of millet left. How many grains of millet were there originally?

621.content: A bundle of wire was first used half of its total length, then half of the remaining length was used in the second use, followed by using $$15$$ meters in the third use, and finally, $$7$$ meters were left. How many meters did the bundle of wire originally have?

622.content: At the top of the mountain, there is a peach tree. A monkey stole more than half of the total number of peaches plus $$2$$. At this time, there are $$6$$ peaches left. How many peaches were there originally on the tree?

623.content: Persons $$A$$, $$B$$, and $$C$$ each have a different number of bricks. $$A$$ takes out a portion of his bricks to give to $$B$$ and $$C$$, doubling the number of bricks for both; then $$B$$ also takes out a portion of his bricks to give to $$A$$ and $$C$$, doubling the number of bricks for both; next, $$C$$ takes out a portion of his bricks to give to $$A$$ and $$B$$, doubling the number of bricks for both. At this point, all three have $$48$$ bricks. How many bricks did $$A$$ originally have, how many did $$B$$ originally have, and how many did $$C$$ originally have?

624.content: When Eddie was doing the multiplication of a three-digit number by a one-digit number, he carelessly wrote the three-digit number as $$786$$ instead of $$789$$, resulting in an answer that was $$18$$ less than the correct answer. What is the one-digit number?
624.kc: 抄错数得出结果，求正确的

625.content: Three brothers divide $$24$$ oranges, and the number of oranges each receives is equal to their ages three years ago. If the youngest brother first shares half of his oranges equally with the eldest and the second brother, then the second brother shares half of his oranges equally with the youngest and the eldest, and finally, the eldest brother shares half of his oranges equally with the second and youngest brothers, at that point, each brother has the same number of oranges. What are the current ages of the eldest brother, the second brother, and the youngest brother?

626.content: There is a sequence of numbers arranged in the order of $$11428571142857114\ldots \ldots$$, with a total of $$100$$ digits. How many times does the digit $$8$$ appear?

627.content: There is a sequence of numbers arranged in the order of $$11428571142857114\ldots \ldots$$, with a total of $$100$$ digits. How many times does the digit $$1$$ appear?

628.content: There is a sequence of numbers arranged in the order of $$11428571142857114\ldots$$ with a total of $$100$$ digits. What is the sum of these numbers?

629.content: There are $$12$$ people in black clothes forming a circle to play the box-passing game, as shown in the figure. Starting from person $$1$$, if the box is passed $$100$$ times clockwise, which person's hands will the box be in?

630.content: There are $$12$$ people in black clothes sitting in a circle playing the game of passing a box. Starting from person $$1$$, if the box is passed counterclockwise $$100$$ times, which person will have the box?

631.content: Twelve people in black clothes are standing in a circle playing a game of passing a box. Starting from person number $$1$$, if they pass the box $$160$$ times clockwise and then $$80$$ times counterclockwise, which person should have the box at the end?

632.content: As shown in the figure, stretch out your left hand, and then start counting from your thumb. When you count to $$200$$, what number is it?

633.content: As shown in the picture, extend your left hand and start counting from your thumb. When you count to $$400$$, what number will you be on?

634.content: As shown in the figure, stretch out your left hand and start counting from your thumb. When you count to $$1007$$, what number will you reach?

635.content: October 1, 2018, was a Monday. Starting from this day, what day of the week is the 25th day?

636.content: December 1, 2018, is what day of the week?

637.content: What day of the week is October 1, 2019?

638.content: April 12, 2017, is a Wednesday, what day of the week is October 1, 2018?

639.content: In the year $$2016$$, there were $$52$$ Thursdays and $$53$$ Fridays. What day of the week is August $$1$$, $$2017$$?

640.content: The senior grade of Mais Primary School arrived at the expansion base, and the doctor is preparing to distribute mineral water to Class 1 of the third grade. If each group is given $$2$$ boxes, there will be $$20$$ boxes left over; if each group is given $$5$$ boxes, there will be $$2$$ boxes left over. How many groups are there in Class 1 of the third grade, and how many boxes did the doctor prepare?

641.content: Eddie is responsible for distributing bottled water to Class 3 of Year 3, and he has prepared a relatively small amount of bottled water. If he distributes $$4$$ boxes to each group, he will be short of $$2$$ boxes; if he distributes $$6$$ boxes to each group, he will be short of $$14$$ boxes. How many groups are there in Class 3 of Year 3, and how many boxes of bottled water did Eddie prepare?
641.kc: 盈亏基本类型盈亏问题

642.content: Class 2 of the fourth grade distributes mosquito repellent stickers. If each person receives $$4$$ stickers, there are $$28$$ stickers left over; if $$4$$ people each receive $$6$$ stickers, $$6$$ people each receive $$4$$ stickers, and the rest each receive $$5$$ stickers, then all the stickers are distributed exactly. How many people are there in Class 2 of the fourth grade, and how many mosquito repellent stickers are there in total?

643.content: The coach distributed some badminton shuttlecocks to the students. Each person received $$5$$ shuttlecocks, and there were still $$10$$ left over; if the number of people increased to $$3$$ times, and if they wanted to give each person $$2$$ shuttlecocks, they would still be short by $$8$$. How many badminton shuttlecocks did the coach prepare in total?

644.content: There are several red and white balls in a box. If you take out $$1$$ red ball and $$1$$ white ball each time, when there are no more red balls left, there are still $$50$$ white balls remaining; if you take away $$1$$ red ball and $$3$$ white balls each time, when there are no more white balls left, there are still $$50$$ red balls remaining. How many red balls are there in the box in total?
644.kc: 盈亏基本类型盈亏问题

645.content: The cafeteria uses a batch of kiwis and cantaloupes to make fruit platters. If every $$5$$ kiwis and $$3$$ cantaloupes are used to make one platter, there are $$4$$ kiwis left over and the cantaloupes are used up; if $$7$$ kiwis and $$3$$ cantaloupes are used to make one platter, there are $$12$$ cantaloupes left over and the kiwis are used up. How many kiwis and how many cantaloupes are there?
645.kc: 盈亏基本类型盈亏问题

646.content: Answer the following question: The distance between point $$A$$ and point $$B$$ is $$4800$$ meters. If person A walks $$60$$ meters per minute, how many minutes does it take for person A to walk from point $$A$$ to point $$B$$?

647.content: Answer the following question: Cities $$A$$ and $$B$$ are $$300$$ kilometers apart. A car was originally planned to travel from city $$A$$ to city $$B$$ in $$6$$ hours. How many kilometers should the car travel on average per hour?

648.content: Solve the following problem: A car travels $$150$$ kilometers in $$3$$ hours. At this speed, how many kilometers will it travel in $$10$$ hours?

649.content: Eddie and Weier set off from the base to visit Max Forest Park. The car's speed was $$80$$ kilometers per hour, and it took $$3$$ hours to reach the destination. If the car's speed increases by $$40$$ kilometers per hour on the way back, how many hours will it take to return to the base after leaving the forest park?

650.content: Eddie and Vera set off together from the base to go to Max Forest Park. The speed of the car on the way there was $$80$$ kilometers per hour, and it took $$3$$ hours to reach the destination. On the way back, it started to rain lightly, and the car drove for $$3$$ more hours than on the way there before returning to the base. What was the speed of the car on the way back in kilometers per hour?

651.content: Daming and Xiaobai live in the same building, and they climb the stairs at the same speed, taking the same amount of time to climb each floor. It takes them $$180$$ seconds to reach the $$6$$th floor. If they maintain the same speed, how many seconds does Xiaobai need to go from the $$1$$st floor to his home on the $$10$$th floor?

652.content: If $$5$$ workers can produce $$80$$ parts in $$2$$ hours, at this rate, how many parts can $$15$$ workers produce in $$6$$ hours?

653.content: Grandma Wang has $$5$$ cows, and in $$7$$ days, they produce $$630$$ kilograms of milk. Based on this calculation, how many kilograms of milk can $$8$$ cows produce in $$15$$ days?

654.content: In Huaguoshan, the little monkeys are eating peaches. If $$6$$ little monkeys eat $$180$$ peaches in $$3$$ days, how many peaches can $$6$$ little monkeys eat in $$5$$ days?

655.content: If $$6$$ little monkeys eat $$180$$ peaches in $$3$$ days on Flower Fruit Mountain, how many days will it take for $$10$$ little monkeys to eat $$200$$ peaches?

656.content: If $$9$$ people can complete $$12$$ pieces of work in $$6$$ days, at this rate, how many pieces of work can $$3$$ people complete in $$3$$ days? How many pieces of work can $$21$$ people complete in $$12$$ days?

657.content: The aquarium prepared $$230$$ kilograms of fish for the $$8$$ seals. In the first two days, the $$8$$ seals ate a total of $$80$$ kilograms of fish. After two days, $$2$$ of the seals were taken away. If each seal eats the same amount of fish each day, how many days can the remaining fish feed the seals that are left?

658.content: Eddie completed $$27$$ problems in $$3$$ hours. At this speed, how many problems can he complete in $$8$$ hours, and how many hours does it take to complete $$108$$ problems?

659.content: Xiao Ming reads a supplementary book, reading $$6$$ pages each day. After $$8$$ days, he has finished half of the book. If he then reads $$2$$ more pages each day, how many days in total will it take him to finish the book?

660.content: If $$2$$ machines produce $$80$$ tons of paper in $$20$$ minutes, how many tons of paper does $$1$$ machine produce in $$1$$ hour?

661.content: In a cage, there are a total of $$27$$ animals. It is known that the number of legs of the two types of animals is the same. How many chickens are there and how many rabbits are there?

662.content: There are a total of $$40$$ animals in the same cage. It is known that the number of chicken legs is twice the number of rabbit legs. How many chickens are there and how many rabbits are there?
662.kc: 用分组法解决基础鸡兔同笼

663.content: In a cage, there are a total of $$45$$ chickens and rabbits. The number of rabbit legs is $$60$$ more than the number of chicken legs. How many chickens are there and how many rabbits are there?
663.kc: 用分组法解决变形鸡兔同笼

664.content: A certain school used a total of $$16$$ buses for a spring outing (all fully seated). Each large bus seats $$60$$ people, and each small bus seats $$20$$ people. The large buses seat $$560$$ more people than the small buses. How many small buses are there?

665.content: In the zoo, there are a total of $$57$$ ostriches and zebras living in the same pasture. The number of legs of the ostriches is the same as that of the zebras. How many zebras are there, and how many ostriches are there?
665.kc: 用分组法解决变形鸡兔同笼

666.content: Lele Department Store entrusted a moving station to transport $$100$$ vases. Both parties agreed on a shipping fee of $$1$$ per vase, but if any vase is damaged, not only is the shipping fee not paid for that vase, but there is also a compensation of $$1$$ for each broken vase. As a result, the moving station received a total shipping fee of $$92$$. How many vases were broken during the transportation?

667.content:
1) In the cage, there are chickens and rabbits, with a total of $$90$$ heads, and the number of chicken legs is equal to the number of rabbit legs. How many chickens are there?  
2) In the zoo, there are $$55$$ ostriches and zebras living on the same grassland. The number of ostrich legs is twice that of zebra legs. How many zebras are there?
667.kc: 用分组法解决基础鸡兔同笼

668.content: 1) Chickens and rabbits are in the same cage, and there are the same number of chickens and rabbits, with a total of $$48$$ legs. How many chickens are there? 2) Chickens and rabbits are in the same cage, and the number of rabbits is three times the number of chickens, with a total of $$140$$ legs. How many chickens are there, and how many rabbits are there?

669.content:
1) Chickens and rabbits are in the same cage, with chickens being $$26$$ more than rabbits, and the total number of legs is $$274$$. How many chickens and how many rabbits are there? 

2) There are a total of $$50$$ large and small oil bottles. Each large bottle can hold $$4$$ kilograms of oil and each small bottle can hold $$2$$ kilograms of oil. The total amount of oil in the large bottles is $$20$$ kilograms more than in the small bottles (each oil bottle is full). How many large bottles and how many small bottles are there?

670.content: How many natural numbers between $$1$$ and $$60$$ are divisible by $$2$$ or $$3$$?

671.content: In a certain class, there are a total of $$46$$ people, $$12$$ people participated in the art group, $$23$$ people participated in the music group, and $$5$$ people participated in both groups. How many people did not participate in either the art group or the music group?

672.content: Three fund managers invested in several stocks. Manager Zhang bought $$66$$ stocks, Manager Wang bought $$40$$ stocks, and Manager Li bought $$23$$ stocks. There are $$17$$ stocks that both Manager Zhang and Manager Wang bought, $$13$$ stocks that both Manager Wang and Manager Li bought, $$9$$ stocks that both Manager Li and Manager Zhang bought, and $$6$$ stocks that all three managers bought. What is the total number of stocks bought by these three managers?

673.content: The Experimental Elementary School has a特色 in calligraphy and mathematical thinking training. There are a total of $$245$$ students in the fifth grade, among which the number of students participating in calligraphy training is $$82$$ more than the number of students participating in mathematical thinking training, with $$44$$ students participating in both calligraphy and mathematical thinking training, and $$63$$ students not participating in either. How many students in the fifth grade of the Experimental Elementary School are participating in mathematical thinking training?

674.content: At night, the rabbits are having a dance party, and there are $$2000$$ lit lamps, each controlled by a pull switch. They are numbered in order from $$1$$ to $$2000$$. First, pull the switch of the lamps numbered as multiples of $$2$$, then pull the switch of the lamps numbered as multiples of $$3$$, and finally pull the switch of the lamps numbered as multiples of $$5$$. After pulling the switches three times, how many lamps remain lit?

675.content: In a certain class, every student has registered to participate in the cup competition. Among them, there are $$12$$ people participating in the Hercules Cup, $$15$$ people in the Calabash Cup, and $$21$$ people in the Xueersi Cup. There are $$5$$ people participating only in both the Hercules Cup and the Calabash Cup, $$4$$ people only in both the Hercules Cup and the Xueersi Cup, $$7$$ people only in both the Xueersi Cup and the Calabash Cup, and $$2$$ people registered for all three cups. How many people are there in total in this class?

676.content: At the New Year party, a total of $$90$$ people participated in dancing, singing, and performing. If the number of people who only participated in dancing is $$3$$ times the number of people who only participated in singing; the number of people who only participated in performing is $$4$$ more than the number of people who participated in both performing and dancing but not singing; $$50$$ people did not participate in singing; $$10$$ people participated in both dancing and singing but did not participate in performing; and $$40$$ people participated in performing; then how many people participated in both performing and dancing but did not participate in singing?

677.content: Eddie and Weir are walking towards each other from two places that are $$42$$ kilometers apart. Eddie's speed is $$8$$ kilometers per hour, and Weir's speed is $$6$$ kilometers per hour. After how many hours will they meet?

678.content: On a straight road, Doctor and Da Kuan start from a distance of $$100$$ meters apart and walk towards each other at the same time. Da Kuan runs $$6$$ meters per second, and Doctor runs $$4$$ meters per second. After how many seconds do they meet?

679.content: Eddie and Vera drove towards each other from two cities that are $$480$$ kilometers apart. After $$4$$ hours, they met. Eddie's car travels at $$50$$ kilometers per hour, what is Vera's speed in kilometers per hour?

680.content: Doctor and Da Kuan agreed to start from home at the same time and walk towards each other. It is known that the distance between their homes is $$2000$$ meters, and they met after $$10$$ minutes. Doctor walks $$90$$ meters per minute, how many meters does Da Kuan walk per minute?

681.content: The distance between locations $$A$$ and $$B$$ is $$780$$ kilometers. The freight truck travels at $$56$$ kilometers per hour, and the passenger bus travels at $$74$$ kilometers per hour. If the freight truck and the passenger bus start from both locations at the same time and move towards each other, how many hours will it take for the two vehicles to be $$130$$ kilometers apart for the first time after they start?

682.content: The distance between locations $$A$$ and $$B$$ is $$780$$ kilometers. The truck travels at $$56$$ kilometers per hour, and the bus travels at $$74$$ kilometers per hour. The truck and the bus start from both locations at the same time and travel towards each other. Find: (2) How many hours are there between the first time they are $$130$$ kilometers apart and the second time they are $$130$$ kilometers apart?

683.content: Cars A and B start simultaneously from two places, A and B, which are $$280$$ kilometers apart, and travel towards each other. They meet after $$8$$ hours. After meeting, both cars continue to travel, and after another $$6$$ hours, car A arrives at location B. At that time, how many kilometers is car B from location A?

684.content: Cars A and B are traveling towards each other from two locations that are $$942$$ kilometers apart. Car A travels at $$45$$ kilometers per hour, and Car B travels at $$41$$ kilometers per hour. Car B departs $$2$$ hours earlier than Car A. After how many hours does Car A meet Car B?

685.content: The distance between point A and point B is $$480$$ kilometers. A car departs from point A at $$8$$ AM, traveling towards point B at a speed of $$40$$ kilometers per hour. After $$3$$ hours, another car departs from point B towards point A at a speed of $$50$$ kilometers per hour. At what time will the two cars meet on the way? (24-hour format)

686.content: The distance between point A and point B is $$200$$ kilometers. Wei Er's speed on the way there is $$10$$ kilometers/hour, and the speed on the way back is $$40$$ kilometers/hour. What is Wei Er's average speed for the round trip in kilometers/hour?

687.content: From $$A$$ to $$B$$ is $$12$$ kilometers downhill, from $$B$$ to $$C$$ is $$8$$ kilometers on flat ground, and from $$C$$ to $$D$$ is $$4$$ kilometers uphill. Xiao Zhang walks, with a downhill speed of $$6$$ kilometers/hour, a flat speed of $$4$$ kilometers/hour, and an uphill speed of $$2$$ kilometers/hour. What is Xiao Zhang's average speed in kilometers per hour from $$A$$ to $$D$$?

688.content: Wei Er and Eddie's homes are $$1170$$ meters apart. They both set off from home at the same time and walk towards each other on the same road. Wei Er walks $$60$$ meters per minute, and Eddie walks $$70$$ meters per minute. After how many minutes do they meet?

689.content: The distance between point A and point B is $$300$$ meters. If the speed going there is $$10$$ meters/minute and the speed returning is $$15$$ meters/minute, what is the average speed for the round trip in meters/minute?

690.content: Eddie and Vera started driving towards each other from cities $$A$$ and $$B$$ at the same time. Eddie's car travels $$56$$ kilometers per hour, and Vera's car travels $$43$$ kilometers per hour. After $$5$$ hours, they meet. What is the distance between the two cities?

691.content: A journey of $$600$$ kilometers, Xiaomei walks the first half of the distance at a speed of $$10$$ km/h and the second half at a speed of $$15$$ km/h. What is Xiaomei's average speed for the entire journey in km/h?

692.content: The distance between points $$A$$ and $$B$$ is $$780$$ kilometers. The truck travels at $$56$$ kilometers per hour, and the passenger bus travels at $$74$$ kilometers per hour. If both vehicles depart from point $$A$$ to point $$B$$ at the same time and return immediately after arriving at point $$B$$, how many hours will it take for the two vehicles to meet for the first time, and how far from point $$B$$ will they be when they meet?
692.kc: 同时同地出发折返相遇

693.content: Cars A and B are heading towards each other from two locations that are $$901$$ kilometers apart. Car A travels at $$45$$ kilometers per hour, and Car B travels at $$41$$ kilometers per hour. Car B departs one hour earlier than Car A. After how many hours does Car A meet Car B?

694.content: Professor Su Buqing is a famous mathematician in our country. One time, he met a well-known German mathematician on a tram, and this mathematician posed an interesting problem for him to solve. The problem is: "Two places are 50 kilometers apart, and two people, A and B, set off from both places at the same time, walking towards each other. A walks 3 kilometers per hour, and B walks 2 kilometers per hour. A has a dog that walks 5 kilometers per hour. The dog starts with A, turns around when it meets B, runs back to A when it meets A again, and continues this until A and B meet. How many kilometers has the dog walked in total?" Professor Su Buqing thought for a moment and told the German mathematician the correct answer before he got off the tram. Students, can you try to find out how many kilometers the dog walked in total?

695.content: There is a bridge that requires going uphill first, then walking a flat section, and finally going downhill. The total distance is $$18$$ kilometers, and the distances for uphill, flat road, and downhill are equal. When a person walks across the bridge, their speeds for uphill, flat road, and downhill are $$2$$ kilometers/hour, $$3$$ kilometers/hour, and $$6$$ kilometers/hour respectively. What is their average speed across the bridge in kilometers/hour?

696.content: In the figure, the length of side $$DC$$ of the parallelogram $$ABCD$$ is $$15$$ centimeters, and the height $$AE$$ on this side is $$6$$ centimeters. A line segment $$AF$$ divides this parallelogram into two parts, and the difference in their areas is $$18$$ square centimeters. What is the area of the trapezoid $$ABCF$$ in square centimeters?

697.content: As shown in the figure, the area of trapezoid $$ABCD$$ is $$50$$ square centimeters, the height $$AE$$ is $$5$$ centimeters long, and segment $$CD$$ is $$4$$ centimeters longer than $$AB$$. What are the lengths of $$AB$$ and $$CD$$ in centimeters?

698.content: What is the area of the rhombus in the figure in square centimeters? (Unit: centimeters)
698.kc: 任意四边形的一半模型

699.content: Eddie and Veer are racing. It is known that Eddie runs $$150$$ meters per minute, while Veer runs $$120$$ meters per minute. (2) They start at the same time, running in the same direction, with Veer in front and Eddie behind. After $$10$$ minutes, Eddie catches up to Veer. What was the original distance between them in meters?

700.content: Two airplanes, A and B, take off simultaneously from two airports that are $$160$$ kilometers apart, with B in front and A behind, flying in the same direction. If B flies at $$340$$ kilometers per hour and A flies at $$420$$ kilometers per hour, how many hours will it take for A to catch up to B?

701.content: A truck and a passenger car start from two places, A and B, which are $$360$$ kilometers apart, at the same time, moving in the same direction, with the truck in front and the passenger car behind. The truck travels at $$50$$ kilometers per hour and is caught up by the passenger car after $$9$$ hours. What is the speed of the passenger car in kilometers per hour?

702.content: A slow train travels from point A to point B at a speed of $$40$$ kilometers per hour. After traveling for $$5$$ hours, a fast train also departs from point A to point B at a speed of $$90$$ kilometers per hour. The fast train catches up with the slow train at the midpoint between points A and B. How far apart are points A and B?

703.content: Third grade students set off from school for a spring outing, walking $$72$$ meters per minute. After $$15$$ minutes, the school had an urgent matter to notify the students and sent Teacher Li on a bicycle, departing from the school at a speed of $$132$$ meters per minute to catch up with the students. How many minutes does Teacher Li need to catch up? If Teacher Li wants to catch up in $$9$$ minutes, how many meters per minute does he need to travel?

704.content: The distance between point A and point B is $$240$$ kilometers. A slow train departs from point A, traveling at $$60$$ kilometers per hour. At the same time, a fast train departs from point B, traveling at $$90$$ kilometers per hour. Both trains are moving in the same direction, with the fast train behind the slow train. After how many hours will the fast train catch up with the slow train?

705.content: Xiao Bai and Xiao Xin are racing, with Xiao Xin starting $$1200$$ meters ahead of Xiao Bai. They start at the same time and run in the same direction. It is known that Xiao Xin runs $$150$$ meters per minute. After $$10$$ minutes, Xiao Bai catches up to Xiao Xin. What is the speed of Xiao Bai in meters per minute?

706.content: The distance between points A and B is $$220$$ kilometers. Xiao Ming and Xiao Li start driving from points A and B at the same time, going in the same direction, with Xiao Ming in front and Xiao Li behind. It is known that Xiao Ming travels at $$50$$ kilometers per hour and Xiao Li at $$60$$ kilometers per hour. How long will it take for Xiao Li to catch up with Xiao Ming?

707.content: Two people, A and B, walk towards each other from two places at the same time. A walks $$5$$ kilometers per hour, while B walks $$4$$ kilometers per hour. When they meet, they are $$3$$ kilometers away from the midpoint. What is the distance between the two places?

708.content: Two people, A and B, ride bicycles simultaneously from point A to point B. A travels $$150$$ meters per minute, while B travels $$120$$ meters per minute. After A reaches point B, he immediately returns and meets B at point C. If point C is $$300$$ meters away from point B, what is the distance between points A and B in meters?
708.kc: 同时同地出发折返相遇

709.content: Eddie and Weir started simultaneously from two places that are $$1500$$ meters apart. If they walk towards each other, they meet in $$10$$ minutes; if they walk in the same direction, Eddie catches up with Weir in $$75$$ minutes. What are Eddie's and Weir's speeds in meters per minute?

710.content: Two places are $$900$$ kilometers apart. A needs $$15$$ days to cover the distance, while B needs $$12$$ days. Now A starts first and walks for $$2$$ days, then B goes to catch up with A. How many kilometers must B travel to catch up with A?

711.content: In a race of $$1000$$ meters between a turtle and a rabbit, the rabbit's speed is $$5$$ times that of the turtle. After they both start from the starting point at the same time, the turtle keeps running, while the rabbit runs to a certain point and starts sleeping. When the rabbit wakes up, the turtle has already taken the lead. The rabbit then chases after the turtle, but when the turtle reaches the finish line, the rabbit is still $$10$$ meters behind. How many meters did the turtle run during the rabbit's sleep?

712.content: After the exam results were released, the doctor held a test paper with $$98$$ points in one hand and a test paper with $$89$$ points in the other hand, and said: "If I multiply the number in my left hand by $$5$$, and the number in my right hand by $$4$$, and then add these two products together, the sum is an odd number." What score is on the test paper in the doctor's left hand?
712.kc: 奇数与偶数的加减规律

713.content: Write the integers $$2$$, $$3$$, and $$5$$ on the blackboard, then erase one and replace it with the sum of the other two. If you continue this process, can you eventually obtain $$100$$, $$144$$, and $$244$$? Please explain your reasoning.
713.kc: 奇数与偶数的加减规律

714.content: There are $$7$$ cups in the cabinet, all with their openings facing up. In the first turn, you flip $$1$$ cup, in the second turn, you flip $$2$$ cups, in the third turn, you flip $$3$$ cups, in the fourth turn, you flip $$4$$ cups, and so on, until the seventh turn where you flip $$7$$ cups. Is it possible to find a method to flip the cups so that after $$7$$ turns all the cups are facing down? If yes, please write out the method; if no, please explain why.

715.content: On the planet Max, there is a magical machine. If you put in $$1$$ gold coin, it will produce $$99$$ silver coins. If you put in $$1$$ silver coin, it will produce $$99$$ gold coins. Now, Eddie has brought a gold coin and hopes to have an equal number of gold coins and silver coins after several operations. Can Eddie achieve this? If so, please describe the method; if not, please explain the reason.

716.content: The New Year is over and school has started. Some students need to buy new uniforms. The teacher gave Wei Er a note that said, "The uniform fee is $$\overline{2\square 38}$$ yuan," where a drop of ink has obscured the number in the square. Eddie took a look and quickly figured out the number in the square. Smart kids, what is this number?

The time they take to fill water is $$1$$ minute, $$2$$ minutes, $$3$$ minutes, $$4$$ minutes, and $$5$$ minutes respectively. 752.content: As shown in the figure, there is a worker at points $$A$$, $$B$$, $$C$$, and $$D$$ on the workflow line. It is required to place a toolbox on the workflow line so that the sum of distances from the $$4$$ workers to the toolbox is minimized. Where should the toolbox be placed?

753.content: Eddie walks $$90$$ meters per minute, and Veer walks $$60$$ meters per minute. They both depart from points $$A$$ and $$B$$ at the same time. If they walk towards each other, they meet after $$10$$ minutes; if they walk in the same direction, how many minutes does it take for Eddie to catch up with Veer?

754.content: The small animals in the forest went out for an outing, forming a long line of $$40$$ meters and moving at a speed of $$3$$ meters per second. The little rabbit has to rush from the back of the line to the front and then immediately return to the back. The rabbit's speed is $$5$$ meters per second. How many seconds does it take for the rabbit to return to the back of the line?

755.content: A line of troops is $$600$$ meters long, moving at a speed of $$2$$ meters per second. A soldier needs to rush from the back to the front of the line and immediately return to the back. If he walks at $$3$$ meters per second, how many meters does he travel in total for the round trip?

756.content: Eddie and Weir are standing at points A and B, respectively, at either end of a straight road that is $$200$$ meters long, walking towards each other. Before Eddie starts, a dog runs at a speed of $$8$$ meters/second from point A towards Weir. After the dog has run for $$5$$ seconds, both Eddie and Weir start running to catch the dog at the same time (the paths of the two people and the dog are all straight lines), with both Weir and Eddie having a speed of $$12$$ meters/second. Question: Who will meet the dog first, Eddie or Weir?

757.content: Car A and Car B start from points A and B at the same time and drive towards each other, meeting after $$4$$ hours. Car A then continues for $$3$$ more hours to reach point B. Car A travels $$20$$ kilometers per hour more than Car B. How many kilometers apart are points A and B?

758.content: The Big Fat Sheep School organizes the little lambs to line up and walk for an outing. The total length of the line is $$630$$ meters, and the walking speed is $$60$$ meters per minute. The last lamb, Fei Yang Yang, rushes to the front of the line at a speed of $$150$$ meters per minute and then immediately returns to the end of the line, taking a total of how many minutes?

759.content: A fast train travels from Station A to Station B at $$65$$ kilometers per hour, and a slow train travels from Station B to Station A at $$60$$ kilometers per hour. When they meet, the fast train has traveled $$10$$ kilometers more than the slow train. What is the distance between Stations A and B in kilometers?

How many oranges did the teacher buy in total, and how many children are there in total?

Mei Yangyang put $$1$$ greeting card in each envelope, and ended up using all the envelopes, with $$50$$ greeting cards left; Fei Yangyang put $$3$$ greeting cards in each envelope, and ended up using all the greeting cards, with $$50$$ envelopes left. How many envelopes and greeting cards did they buy?

How many contestants are there, and how many bottles of water are there?

1485.content: The animal kingdom distributed some bananas to the animals.
