1488.content: The school organized students to go to a farm. If $4$ students live in each household, $7$ people will have no place to stay; if $5$ students live in each household, then the last two households will have exactly no students living in them. How many students are there in total?

1489.content: The zookeeper is preparing to distribute peaches to the monkeys in the zoo. If each monkey receives $$6$$ peaches, there are $$5$$ peaches short; if the only monkey king receives $$10$$ peaches and each of the remaining monkeys receives $$5$$ peaches, there are $$10$$ peaches left over. How many peaches are there in total?

1490.content: A porter carries $$1000$$ glass bottles, with a regulation fee of $$3$$ dimes for each bottle moved, but a penalty of $$5$$ dimes for each bottle broken. After completing the delivery, the porter received a total fee of $$260$$ yuan. How many glass bottles were accidentally broken during the transport?

1491.content: In a cage, the number of chickens is twice the number of rabbits. There are a total of $$104$$ legs. How many chickens are there, and how many rabbits are there?

1492.content: On an open field, there are a total of $$23$$ vehicles, including cars and tricycles. Each car has $$4$$ wheels, and each tricycle has $$3$$ wheels. If these vehicles have a total of $$75$$ wheels, how many tricycles are there?

1493.content: A book with $$327$$ pages, how many digits are used in its page numbers?

1494.content: When counting from $$1$$ to $$200$$, how many times does the digit "3" appear?

1495.content: In trapezoid $$ABCD$$, the length of the upper base $$DC$$ is $$6$$ centimeters, the length of the lower base $$AB$$ is $$9$$ centimeters, and the area of the trapezoid is $$45$$ square centimeters. What is the length of the height $$DE$$ in centimeters?

1496.content: The big monkey picked a bunch of peaches to share with a group of little monkeys. If two of the little monkeys each receive $$4$$ peaches and each of the remaining little monkeys receives $$2$$ peaches, then $$4$$ peaches are left over; if one little monkey receives $$6$$ peaches and each of the remaining little monkeys receives $$4$$ peaches, then there are $$12$$ peaches short. How many peaches did the big monkey pick in total, and how many little monkeys are there in the group?

1497.content: The school cultural festival opens on September 20 and ends on the evening of November 1. How many days did the cultural festival last in total?

1498.content: Xiao Hong's family raises some chickens. The number of yellow chickens is $$13$$ more than the number of black chickens and $$18$$ less than the number of white chickens. The number of white chickens is $$2$$ times the number of yellow chickens. How many chickens are there in total for white, yellow, and black?

1499.content: In a solid square matrix, there are $$10$$ pieces on each side of the outermost layer. How many pieces are there in the second layer from the outside?

1500.content: Brother and younger brother study at the same school. The brother walks $$65$$ meters per minute, and the younger brother walks $$40$$ meters per minute. One day, the younger brother walks for $$5$$ minutes first, and then the brother leaves home. When the younger brother arrives at school, the brother just catches up with him and also arrives at school. How far is their home from the school?

1501.content: Hua Hua went to the store and bought $$2$$ pencils, $$2$$ erasers, and several rulers, paying a total of $$55$$ yuan. Given that each ruler costs $$3$$ yuan, is the number of rulers Hua Hua bought odd or even?

1502.content: When Si Si left school, he saw that the lights in the classroom of Class 4 were still on, so he went to help turn them off. In his haste, he forgot how many times he pressed the switch, only confirming that the lights were off in the end. Which of the following numbers could not be the number of times he pressed the switch?

1503.content:
In the numbers below, how many can be evenly divided by $$2$$; how many can be evenly divided by $$5$$; how many can be evenly divided by $$4$$; and how many can be evenly divided by $$8$$?  
$$234$$  $$789$$  $$7756$$  $$8865$$  $$3728$$  $$8064$$

1504.content: Among the $$6$$ natural numbers: $$234$$, $$530$$, $$658$$, $$54367$$, $$90816$$, $$342125$$, (1) how many can be evenly divided by $$2$$, and how many can be evenly divided by $$5$$? (2) How many can be evenly divided by $$4$$, and how many can be evenly divided by $$25$$?

1505.content: Among the $$6$$ natural numbers: $$234$$, $$530$$, $$658$$, $$54367$$, $$90816$$, $$342125$$, how many can be divided by $$8$$? How many can be divided by $$125$$?

1506.content:
Among the following four-digit numbers, how many can be evenly divided by $$9$$?  
$$2304, 4389, 9801, 4728, 3205, 4090, 2358, 1108$$

1507.content: What are the appropriate digits to fill in the "$$\square$$" of the multiplication vertical format below so that the vertical format holds true, and what is the product?

1508.content: In the number puzzle in the figure below, what is the dividend?

1509.content: As shown in the figure, fill in the appropriate numbers in the box so that the long division is correct. What is the resulting quotient?

1514.kc: 整数加减巧算之位值原理

1515.content: Please circle three adjacent numbers in a horizontal row in the table so that the sum of the three numbers is $$60$$.

1516.content:
As shown in the figure, the natural numbers starting from $$7$$ are arranged according to a certain pattern. Please answer:
(1) In which row and column is $$72$$ located?
(2) What is the number in the $$4$$th row and $$22$$nd column?
1516.kc: 连续自然数长方形数表之已知位置求数

1517.content: There are $$5$$ cars at the gas station that need refueling, and their refueling times are $$6$$, $$2$$, $$8$$, $$9$$, and $$5$$ minutes. Since there is only one gas pump at the station, what is the minimum total time for the refueling and waiting of these five cars in minutes?

1518.content: Xiao Ming walks $$70$$ meters per minute, and Xiao Hong walks $$55$$ meters per minute. If they start from points $$A$$ and $$B$$ at the same time and walk towards each other, they will meet after $$6$$ minutes. If they walk in the same direction, after how many minutes will Xiao Ming catch up with Xiao Hong?

1519.content: How many hours after Car A departs do they meet?

1520.content: The distance between Point A and Point B is $$120$$ kilometers. Car $$A$$ departs from Point A and travels at a speed of $$20$$ kilometers per hour. At the same time, Car $$B$$ departs from Point B and travels at a speed of $$30$$ kilometers per hour. Both cars are traveling in the same direction, with Car $$B$$ behind Car $$A$$. After how many hours can Car $$B$$ catch up to Car $$A$$?

1521.content: The Big Fat Sheep School organizes the little lambs to line up and walk for an outing. The total length of the line is $$630$$ meters, and the walking speed is $$60$$ meters per minute. The last lamb, Fei Yang Yang, rushes to the front of the line at a speed of $$150$$ meters per minute and then immediately returns to the end of the line, taking a total of how many minutes?

1522.content: The distance between point A and point B is $$520$$ kilometers. A passenger train and a freight train start from both locations at the same time and meet after $$4$$ hours. The freight train travels at $$48$$ kilometers per hour. How many more kilometers did the passenger train travel than the freight train when they met?

1523.content: Which equation is equal to the answer of $$6 \times □ - 15 = 43$$?

1524.content: Find the value represented by the symbol below. $$5\times( \blacksquare+1) =29 -\blacksquare$$ What is $$ \blacksquare $$?

1525.content: What equation is equal to the answer of $$7a-6=43$$?

1526.content: If you subtract twice a certain number from $$42$$, the difference is $$24$$. What is the number?
1526.kc: 一元一次方程解应用题

1527.content: This year, the age difference between the father and son is $$25$$ years, and the father's age is $$6$$ times the son's age. How old is the father this year?

1528.content: The perimeter of a rectangle is $$60$$ centimeters, the length is $$23$$ centimeters, what is the width?

1529.content: The figure below is a $$6 \times 6$$ area with $$7$$ trees planted. Now, it is required to set up tents on the vacant land without planting trees, and the tents must be placed next to the trees. No two tents can occupy adjacent squares, and the number of tents in each row is indicated on the leftmost side, while the number of tents in each column is indicated on the top side. How many tents are there in total?

1530.content: Counting circles, also known as counting loops, involves connecting lines between adjacent grid points to form a unique loop where the lines connect end to end without crossing or interruption. The numbers in the grid indicate the number of lines drawn on its four edges, and the number of lines in the non-numbered areas is unlimited. The question is: Is there a line connecting the two points enclosed in the figure?

1531.content: Setting up a tent: The figure below shows a $$5 \times 5$$ area with $$5$$ trees. Now, it is required to set up tents on the unplanted space and the tents must be placed next to the trees. Any two tents cannot occupy adjacent squares, and the number of tents in each row is indicated on the rightmost side, while the number of tents in each column is indicated at the bottom. Is there a tent in the third row and third column? ( )

1532.content: In the figure, how many different ways can we connect to form the phrase "Welcome back to Macau"?

1533.content: There is one shortest route from $$A$$ to $$B$$.

1534.content: A spider is at vertex $$A$$ of a rectangular cuboid, which has a length of $$80$$ cm, a width of $$40$$ cm, and a height of $$80$$ cm. The spider can only crawl along the edges and cannot crawl on the same edge twice. What is the maximum distance the spider can crawl in centimeters?

1535.content: There are $$14$$ identical notebooks divided into $$3$$ piles with different quantities. How many different ways are there to divide them?
1535.kc: 加法拆数（不完全相同数）

1536.content: Decompose $$18$$ into the sum of three different non-zero natural numbers, but the three natural numbers can only be selected from $$1 \sim 9$$. How many different decomposition methods are there? Please list them all.

1537.content: If $10$ identical rulers are distributed among $3$ children, with each child receiving at least one ruler, how many different ways are there to distribute them?

1538.content: In the figure below, there are $$6$$ points and $$9$$ line segments. An ant starts from point $$A$$ and climbs to point $$C$$ along certain line segments. If during its journey, the same point or line segment can be passed through at most once, how many different ways can the ant climb?

1539.content: Answer the following questions: Fill in the blanks with appropriate numbers so that the vertical calculation in the figure is valid, what is the sum?

1540.content: Answer the following question: In the following equation, the same symbols represent the same numbers, and different symbols represent different numbers. Based on this equation, can you deduce what $$\square + \bigcirc + \triangle + \star =$$?

1541.content: Answer the following question: In the subtraction equation below, each shape represents a number, and different shapes represent different numbers. What does △ equal?

1542.content: As shown in the figure, the numbers in the blank spaces are all digits from $$3$$ to $$8$$ (can be reused), what is the sum of the numbers in these $$6$$ blank spaces?

1543.content: Ming Ming, Hong Hong, and Tian Tian have a total of $$60$$ apples. Ming Ming has $$3$$ times the amount of apples that Tian Tian has, and Hong Hong has $$2$$ times the amount of apples that Tian Tian has minus $$6$$. How many apples does Tian Tian have?

1544.content: Five years ago, Da Mao's age was equal to Er Mao's age seven years from now. The sum of Da Mao's age four years from now and Er Mao's age three years ago is $$35$$ years. What is Da Mao's age this year, and what is Er Mao's age this year?

1545.content: It is known that dad is $$6$$ years older than mom. Two years ago, the sum of dad and mom's ages was $$7$$ times the son's age. Three years later, the sum of dad and mom's ages will be $$5$$ times the son's age plus $$9$$ years. Next year, mom's age will be twice the son's age.

1546.content: The sum of the ages of the two brothers is $$30$$ years this year. When the older brother was as old as the younger brother is now, the younger brother's age was exactly half of the older brother's age at that time. How old is the older brother this year?
1546.kc: 年龄问题基本关系和差问题

1547.content: In the same plane, with $$200$$ straight lines, what is the maximum number of different intersection points?

1548.content: There is a class of students going boating. They calculated that if they add one boat, exactly $$4$$ people can sit in each boat; if they reduce one boat, exactly $$5$$ people can sit in each boat. Question: How many students are there in this class?
1548.kc: 盈亏基本类型盈亏问题

1549.content: In the figure, if we color the five parts $$ABCDE$$ with four different colors, and adjacent parts cannot be the same color while non-adjacent parts can be the same color, how many different coloring methods are there for this picture?

1550.content: Use $$5$$ different colors to color the shapes below, with the requirement that adjacent regions (two regions that share a common edge are considered adjacent) must be colored differently. If colors can be reused, how many different coloring methods are there?

1551.content: Weier went to the flower shop to buy flowers to decorate the living room. The flower shop has $$5$$ pots of yellow flowers, $$7$$ pots of red flowers, and $$6$$ pots of pink flowers. If Weier wants to choose $$2$$ pots of flowers of different colors, how many different selection methods does she have?

1552.content:
There are four running events in the sports meet: $$50$$ meters, $$100$$ meters, $$200$$ meters, and $$400$$ meters. It is stipulated that each participant can only participate in one of these events. Students A, B, C, and D have signed up for these four events. Please answer:
(1) If each student can choose any of the four events, how many registration methods are there in total?
(2) If the four students choose different events, how many registration methods are there in total?
1552.kc: 乘法原理里的其他类型

1553.content: There are $$5$$ buildings with heights ranging from $$2$$ to $$6$$ floors. The taller buildings will block the shorter ones. For example, looking from the left arrow, you can see only $$2$$ buildings (the $$3$$-floor and the $$6$$-floor buildings), while looking from the right arrow, you can see $$3$$ buildings (the $$4$$-floor, $$5$$-floor, and $$6$$-floor buildings). If you want to see $$1$$ building from the left and $$3$$ buildings from the right, what are the different possibilities?

1554.content: The English word for "数学" is "$$MATH$$". Using five colors: red, yellow, blue, green, and purple, to dye each letter a different color, how many different combinations can be created with these colors?

1555.content: How many different numbers can be formed using the digits $$2$$, $$4$$, $$6$$, and $$8$$ without repeating any digits?

1556.content: Xiao Hua takes a family photo with dad, mom, grandpa, and grandma. It is known that Xiao Hua cannot sit in the middle position. How many different arrangements are there?

1557.content: The Olympic venues implement waste classification. There are five garbage bins placed in order from left to right, labeled: batteries, plastic, waste paper, cans, and non-recyclable. Now, we are going to dye the five garbage bins one of three colors: red, green, or blue, with the requirement that adjacent bins must be different colors and the bin for recycling paper cannot be dyed red. How many coloring methods are there?

1558.content: Use $$5$$ different colors to color the shapes below, ensuring that adjacent regions (two regions sharing a common edge are called adjacent) are colored differently. If colors can be reused, how many different coloring methods are there?

1559.content: In the figure, there are four countries $$A$$, $$B$$, $$C$$, and $$D$$ on the map. If we use five colors to color the map, how many different coloring methods can be used so that adjacent countries do not have the same color?

1560.content: How many five-digit even numbers can be formed using the digits $$0$$, $$2$$, $$3$$, $$4$$, $$5$$, $$6$$, $$7$$, $$8$$, and $$9$$ without repeating any digits?
1560.kc: 有特殊要求的组数问题

1561.content: Dong Dong has $$9$$ cards, among which $$4$$ cards have the number $$2$$ written on them, $$2$$ cards have the number $$3$$ written on them, and $$3$$ cards have the number $$5$$ written on them. If we randomly take several cards from these cards and calculate the product of the numbers on the cards (we can take just $$1$$ card or all $$9$$ cards), how many different products can we obtain in total?

1562.content: If you choose $$2$$ books from different subjects out of $$15$$ different language books, $$20$$ different math books, and $$10$$ different foreign language books, how many different selections are there?

1565.content: The operation represented by $$\odot$$ is defined as follows: $$a \odot b = 8 \times a - b$$. Calculate: (1) What is $$\left( 4 \odot 2 \right) \odot 3$$? (2) If $$x \odot 7 = 65$$, what is $$x$$?

1568.kc: 整数除法巧算之类分配律

1570.content: Define $$a*b$$ as the average of all natural numbers with the same parity as $$a$$ between $$a$$ and $$b$$ (including $$a$$ and $$b$$). For example: $$7*14=(7+9+11+13)\div 4=10$$, $$18*10=(18+16+14+12+10)\div 5=14$$. What natural number should be placed in the box in the equation □$$*(19*99)=80$$ to make the equation hold true?

1572.content: It is defined that “$$\odot $$” represents the operation: $$a\odot b=3\times a+2\times b$$. Calculate: (1) What is $$4\odot 5$$? (2) What is $$4\odot 2\odot 3$$? (3) What is $$4\odot (2\odot 3)$$?

1573.kc: 整数除法巧算之类分配律

1575.content: During the holiday season, a total of $$666$$ colorful lights were installed on a $$6$$-story building. It is known that starting from the second floor, each floor has $$6$$ fewer lights than the one below. How many lights were installed on the top floor?

1576.content: There are five distinct non-zero natural numbers, the smallest of which is $$7$$. If one of them is decreased by $$20$$ and the other four are increased by $$5$$, the result will still be these five numbers. What is the sum of these five numbers?

1577.content: $$n \forall b$$ represents three times $$n$$ minus $$b$$. For example: $$1 \forall 2 = 1 \times 3 - 2 = 1$$, then what is $$10 \forall 6$$?

1578.kc: 整数除法巧算之提取公除数（普通型）

1579.content: In an arithmetic sequence: $$7$$, $$11$$, $$15$$, $$\ldots$$, what is the $$30$$th term?

1581.content: A train travels back and forth between Changsha and Wuhan, stopping at $$4$$ stations along the way. How many different tickets need to be prepared?
1581.kc: 乘法原理里的其他类型

1582.content: If the 4th term of an arithmetic sequence is $$31$$ and the 7th term is $$49$$, what is the 10th term?

1583.kc: 整数除法巧算之提取公除数（普通型）

1584.content: Using $$4$$ different colors of watercolor pens to color the letters "$$ABCD$$", with the requirement that different letters must be colored with different pens, how many different color combinations are possible?

1585.content: In an arithmetic sequence, if the first term is $$11$$ and the $$11$$th term is $$51$$, what is the common difference?

1586.content: There are four countries on the map: $$A$$, $$B$$, $$C$$, and $$D$$ (as shown in the figure). There are five colors: red, yellow, blue, green, and purple available to color the map, ensuring that adjacent countries have different colors. However, not every color must be used. How many coloring methods are there?

1589.content: There are five pulleys with diameters that form an arithmetic sequence. Given that the smallest and largest pulley diameters are $$120$$ mm and $$216$$ mm respectively, what is the diameter of the second pulley in mm, the diameter of the third pulley in mm, and the diameter of the fourth pulley in mm?

1590.content: In a kindergarten, $$378$$ children are forming several circles (one circle inside another) to play games. It is known that the innermost circle has $$22$$ people and the outermost circle has $$62$$ people. If the number of people differs equally between adjacent circles, what is the difference in the number of people between two adjacent circles?

1591.content: There is a pile of evenly thick logs arranged in a trapezoid shape. Starting from the top, each lower layer has one more log than the layer above it, with a total of $$28$$ layers, and the bottom layer has $$32$$ logs. How many logs are there in total?

1592.content: There is a piece of paper. The first time it is cut into $$7$$ pieces; the second time, one of the pieces from the first cut is randomly chosen and cut into $$7$$ pieces again; the third time, one piece from all the pieces obtained before is randomly chosen and cut into $$7$$ pieces, and this continues. After the $$10$$th cut, how many pieces of paper are there in total? Is it possible that after some cut, the total number of pieces of paper is exactly $$2019$$? (Fill in yes or no)

1593.content: A natural number can be expressed as the sum of $$5$$ consecutive natural numbers and also as the sum of $$7$$ consecutive natural numbers. What are the first $$3$$ natural numbers that meet the above conditions, listed in ascending order?

1594.content: If the 4th term of an arithmetic sequence is $$21$$ and the 6th term is $$33$$, what is the 8th term?

1595.content: What is the sum of all the multiples of $$3$$ between $$10$$ and $$90$$?

1597.content: For the number sequence $$4$$, $$7$$, $$10$$, $$13$$, $$16$$, $$19$$, $$\cdots$$, what is the $$10$$th number? Which term is $$49$$ in this sequence? What is the difference between the $$100$$th number and the $$50$$th number?

1598.content: Vera first wrote an arithmetic sequence on the blackboard. As soon as she finished, Eddie rushed to the podium and erased most of the numbers, leaving only the fourth number $$31$$ and the tenth number $$73$$. What is the difference between two adjacent numbers in this arithmetic sequence, and what is the first number?

1599.content: There is a sequence of $$13$$ numbers, each number is $$7$$ more than the previous one, and the $$13$$th number is $$125$$. What is the $$1$$st number?

1600.content: To celebrate the 16th anniversary of the school, Xueersi School organized a sports meeting. During the opening ceremony, the representative teams from each grade entered in turn to perform. The first-grade students formed a solid square formation to perform gymnastics, with $$18$$ people on each side of the outer layer. How many people are there in the entire square formation?

1601.content: After the sports meeting, all the students went to the gym to participate in the closing ceremony. The volunteers used beautiful flowers to congratulate the athletes and arranged a five-layer hollow square flower bed on the open space in front of the gym, using a total of $$240$$ pots of flowers. How many pots of flowers are there in the middle layer? How many pots of flowers are there in the outer layer? How many pots of flowers are there in the inner layer?

1602.content: There is a group of students arranged in a three-layer hollow square formation, with $$9$$ more people. If the hollow part increases by two layers, there will be $$15$$ fewer people. How many students are there?

1603.content: In order to prepare for the school's group dance competition, the third-grade students are lining up. If they form a hollow square matrix with $$3$$ layers, there are $$10$$ more people than needed. If an additional layer is added to the hollow part in the middle, there are $$6$$ fewer people than needed. How many students are participating in the rehearsal?

1604.content: If there is a hollow triangular formation with $$3$$ layers, and there are $$17$$ pieces on each side of the outer layer, how many pieces are there in total?

1605.content: In the fourth grade class, students participated in a radio exercise competition, forming a square formation with $$8$$ people in each row and $$8$$ people in each column. How many students are there in total in the square formation, and how many students are left if one row and one column are removed?

1606.content: As the new semester begins, the Young Pioneers holding flowers form a square formation around a float, with two layers on each side. The outer layer has $$13$$ people on each side. How many Young Pioneers are there around the float?

1607.content: A square wall is covered with red and green square tiles. Starting from the outermost layer, the first layer is red tiles, the second layer is green tiles, the third layer is red tiles, the fourth layer is green tiles, and so on. In total, $$400$$ tiles are used. How many tiles are there in total?

1608.content: The school is going to hold a gymnastics performance, arranged in a triangular formation with $$10$$ rows. (1) How many people are participating in the performance? (2) If the people in the outermost circle are given ribbons, how many people have ribbons?

1609.content: There are $$196$$ Go pieces arranged in a solid square matrix of $$14 \times 14$$. Player A and Player B take turns removing all the pieces from each layer starting from the outermost layer until all the pieces are taken. How many more pieces did Player A take than Player B?

1610.content: The students at Sunshine Primary School are arranged in a solid square formation on the playground. It is known that the outermost layer of the square is all boys, the next layer is all girls, then boys again, and so on, until the innermost layer. If the total number of boys is $$52$$ more than the total number of girls, what is the total number of students?

1611.content: A certain unit of soldiers is marching in a solid square formation. Another team with a total of $$31$$ people joins their formation, which exactly increases both the rows and columns by one. How many soldiers are there in total now?

1612.content: Eddie arranged some pieces into a two-layer hollow square matrix, and then he added $$28$$ more pieces, turning the shape into a three-layer hollow square matrix. What is the maximum number of pieces Eddie could have originally arranged, and what is the minimum number of pieces he could have arranged?

1613.content: Students in the fourth grade of Xiwang Primary School lined up in a solid square formation, with $$5$$ people remaining. If one row is added both horizontally and vertically to form a slightly larger solid square, then $$26$$ people are missing. How many students are there in the fourth grade of Xiwang Primary School?

1614.content: $$120$$ chess pieces are arranged in a three-layer hollow square formation, with each side of the innermost layer having how many chess pieces?

1615.content: Students in the fourth grade of a certain school are arranged in a square formation, with $$40$$ people in the outermost layer. How many people are there on each side of the outer layer of the square formation, and what is the total number of people in the square formation?

1616.content: In a certain barbershop, there is only one barber, but five customers arrived at the same time. Based on the hairstyles they want, they need $$10$$, $$12$$, $$15$$, $$20$$, and $$24$$ minutes respectively. How should they arrange their haircut order to minimize the total time spent waiting and getting their hair cut? What is the minimum time in minutes?

1617.content: There are two barbers in the barbershop, and $$6$$ customers have arrived at the same time. Depending on the hairstyles they want, they need $$8$$, $$10$$, $$12$$, $$15$$, $$20$$, and $$24$$ minutes respectively. How can we arrange their haircut order reasonably to minimize the total waiting time (including haircut time) for the $$6$$ people? What is the minimum time in minutes?

1618.content: There are $$8$$ people each holding a bucket, and they all go to the faucet to fetch water at the same time. It takes $$1$$ minute to fill the first person's bucket, $$2$$ minutes for the second person's bucket, and so on. (1) When there is only one faucet, how should these $$8$$ people be arranged to minimize their total fetching and waiting time? What is the minimum time in minutes?

1619.content: There are $$8$$ people each holding a bucket who go to the faucet to fill water at the same time. It takes $$1$$ minute to fill the first person's bucket, $$2$$ minutes to fill the second person's bucket, and so on. When there are two faucets, how can these $$8$$ people be arranged to fill water so that their total filling and waiting time is minimized? What is the minimum time in minutes?

1620.content: The Sunshine Tram Company maintenance station has $$7$$ trams that need repairs. If one worker takes $$12$$, $$17$$, $$8$$, $$18$$, $$23$$, $$30$$, and $$14$$ minutes to repair these $$7$$ trams respectively, and the loss for each tram for every minute of downtime is $$11$$ yuan, what is the minimum economic loss when $$3$$ workers with the same efficiency work individually and are reasonably arranged to minimize the loss?

1621.content: Answer the following questions: As shown in the figure, there are five residential buildings $$A$$, $$B$$, $$C$$, $$D$$, and $$E$$ on the street, each with the same number of residents. Where should the bus station be located to minimize the sum of the distances from the bus station to the residents of the five buildings?

1622.content: Solve the following problems: As shown in the figure, there are six residential buildings $$A$$, $$B$$, $$C$$, $$D$$, $$E$$, and $$F$$ on the street, with the same number of people in each building. Now, if a bus stop is to be set up, where should the stop be located to minimize the total distance residents have to travel to reach the stop?

1623.content: Answer the following questions: In the figure, there are five schools, $$A$$, $$B$$, $$C$$, $$D$$, and $$E$$, located on a road from west to east, with $$200$$, $$300$$, $$400$$, $$500$$, and $$600$$ people respectively. The distance between any two adjacent schools is $$100$$ meters. A bus station is to be built at the entrance of one of the schools to minimize the total distance all people must travel to reach the station. Where should the bus station be located?

1624.content: In the figure, there are five villages: $$A$$, $$B$$, $$C$$, $$D$$, and $$E$$. The numbers in the circles represent the number of students who need to go to school in each village, and the numbers on the roads represent the distance between the villages (unit: kilometers). Now, we need to choose one village to establish a primary school among the five villages. To minimize the total distance all students have to travel to school, where should the primary school be built?

1625.content: There is a water tower that needs to supply water to $$6$$ residential areas along a certain road (as shown in the figure, units: kilometers). There are two types of pipes to be installed: thick pipes that can supply water to all $$6$$ residential areas, and thin pipes that can only supply water to $$1$$ residential area. The cost of the thick pipe is $$7000$$ yuan per kilogram, and the cost of the thin pipe is $$2000$$ yuan per kilometer. How should this project be arranged to minimize costs, and what should the total cost be in yuan?

1626.content: Answer the questions as required. (1) Beijing and Shenzhen have $$10$$ and $$6$$ identical machines respectively, planning to send $$11$$ machines to Wuhan and $$5$$ machines to Xi'an. The shipping cost per machine is shown in the table. If the total shipping cost is minimized, what is the minimum shipping cost in yuan?

1627.content: Answer the questions as required. (2) Beijing and Shanghai have $$10$$ and $$6$$ identical machines, respectively, and plan to send $$11$$ machines to Wuhan and $$5$$ machines to Xi'an. The shipping cost for each machine is shown in the table. If the total shipping cost is minimized, what is the minimum shipping cost?

1628.content: Given that a pack of $$5$$ red pens costs $$61$$ yuan and blue pens cost $$70$$ yuan; a pack of $$3$$ red pens costs $$40$$ yuan and blue pens cost $$47$$ yuan; purchases must be made in packs. If at least $$47$$ red pens and $$47$$ blue pens are purchased, what is the minimum expenditure in yuan?
1628.kc: 优惠情况下的付钱方法

1629.content: There are ten villages located along a road starting from the county city (as shown in the figure, with the distance unit in kilometers). Water pipes need to be installed to supply tap water from the county city to each village. There are two types of pipes available: thick pipes can supply water to all villages, while thin pipes can only supply water to one village. The cost of the thick pipe is $$8000$$ yuan per kilometer, and the cost of the thin pipe is $$2000$$ yuan per kilometer. By appropriately combining and connecting the thick and thin pipes, the total project cost can be reduced. What do you think the most economical cost should be in yuan?

1630.content: On a highway, there is a warehouse every $$100$$ kilometers (as shown in the figure), with a total of $$5$$ warehouses. Warehouse number one has $$10$$ tons of goods, warehouse number two has $$20$$ tons of goods, and warehouse number five has $$40$$ tons of goods, while the other two warehouses are empty. Now, if we want to concentrate all the goods in one warehouse, and it costs $$1$$ yuan to transport each ton of goods for $$1$$ kilometer, what is the minimum transportation cost?

1631.content: There are eight lathes broken down in the workshop, with the repair times for the first to the eighth lathe being $$4$$, $$8$$, $$9$$, $$12$$, $$13$$, $$16$$, $$15$$, and $$14$$ minutes, respectively. There are two repair workers with the same efficiency, and the goal is to schedule the repairs so that the total time from the start of repairs to their completion is the shortest. What is this shortest time in minutes?

1632.content:
The South and North warehouses have $$30$$ tons and $$20$$ tons of goods respectively, and are preparing to transport $$15$$ tons to Warehouse A, $$25$$ tons to Warehouse B, and $$10$$ tons to Warehouse C. The transportation costs per ton are shown in the table below (unit: yuan). What is the minimum transportation cost in yuan? 

|     | A  | B  | C  |
|-----|----|----|----|
| South Warehouse | $$12$$ | $$5$$  | $$10$$ |
| North Warehouse | $$10$$ | $$6$$  | $$13$$ |

1633.content: As shown in the figure: The numbers marked on the left of each row and at the top of each column represent the number of consecutive black squares in that row or column. Can you mark all the black squares based on these numbers?

1634.content: As shown in the figure: The numbers marked on the left of each row and at the top of each column represent the number of continuous black squares in that row or column. Can you, kids, mark all the black squares based on these numbers?

1635.content: As shown in the figure: the numbers marked on the left of each row and above each column represent the number of consecutive black squares in that row or column. Can you, kids, mark all the black squares based on these numbers?

1636.content: As shown in the figure: The numbers marked on the left of each row and on the top of each column represent the number of consecutive black squares in that row or column. Can you, children, mark all the black squares based on these numbers?

1637.content: As shown in the figure: The numbers marked on the left side of each row and the top side of each column represent the number of consecutive black squares in that row or column. Can you mark all the black squares based on these numbers?

1638.content: If $$125$$ sheep are herded into $$6$$ sheep pens, how many sheep are there at least in the sheep pen with the most sheep?

1639.content: Some students went to borrow $$50$$ basketballs from the administrator. The administrator said: If you take them all at once, at least one person will have to take $$8$$ or more. What is the maximum number of students?

1640.content: In a deck of playing cards, there are a total of $$54$$ cards, including $$2$$ jokers, and there are $$13$$ cards each of the four suits: spades, hearts, clubs, and diamonds. How many cards must be drawn at a minimum to ensure that all four suits are drawn?

1641.content: In a deck of playing cards, there are a total of $$54$$ cards, including $$2$$ jokers, and there are $$13$$ cards each of the four suits: spades, hearts, clubs, and diamonds. How many cards must be drawn at a minimum to guarantee that there is at least one "pair" (two jokers count as a pair)?

1642.content: In a deck of playing cards, there are $$52$$ cards after removing the jokers, which include four suits: spades, hearts, clubs, and diamonds. Each suit has $$13$$ cards numbered from $$1$$ to $$13$$. How many cards must be drawn at a minimum to ensure that at least one spade is drawn?

1643.content: There are $$9$$ yellow socks, $$7$$ green socks, $$4$$ white socks, $$2$$ red socks, and $$1$$ black sock. If Eddie closes his eyes and feels the socks, how many socks does he need to touch at least to guarantee that he can make $$2$$ pairs of the same color?

1644.content: If $$17$$ apples are placed into $$3$$ drawers, how many apples must be in the drawer with the most apples at least?

1645.content: To distribute $$31$$ table tennis balls into $$5$$ boxes, with each box containing at least $$1$$ ball, how many balls are in the box with the most balls at a minimum?

1646.content: There are four different colors of cards in the box, with $$100$$, $$90$$, $$80$$, and $$70$$ cards respectively. You can exchange $$59$$ cards of the same color for one pencil case of the same color, $$46$$ cards of the same color for one notebook of the same color, and $$24$$ cards of the same color for one mechanical pencil of the same color. What is the maximum number of cards that can be taken out at once, while still being unable to guarantee that the taken cards can be exchanged for one of each type of stationery, with each being a different color?

1647.content: There are $$5$$ black balls, $$6$$ white balls, and $$7$$ red balls on the table. How many balls must you draw with your eyes closed to ensure that you get at least one of each color?

1648.content: If $$50$$ cows are driven into $$7$$ cow pens, how many cows are there at least in the pen with the most cows?

1649.content: Every day at noon, the class distributes $$25$$ apples. No matter how they are divided, there is always at least one person who receives $$3$$ apples. What is the maximum number of people in the class?

1650.content: In any group of $$40$$ people, at least how many of them belong to the same zodiac sign?

1651.content: The kindergarten aunt has $$72$$ candies. If she distributes them to a maximum number of children, how many children can she ensure receive at least $$3$$ candies each, no matter how they are distributed?

1652.content: All $$45$$ students in Class $$3$$ of the third grade were born in the same year. Which of the following statements is correct?

1653.content: Students have cards with the numbers $$1$$, $$2$$, and $$3$$, and there are many cards of each type. The teacher asks each student to take out two or three cards to form a two-digit or three-digit number. If at least three students form the same number, how many students must there be at minimum?

1654.content: A deck of playing cards has a total of $$54$$ cards, including spades, clubs, hearts, and diamonds, each with cards numbered from $$1$$ to $$13$$, and there are also $$2$$ jokers. How many cards must you draw to ensure that at least two of the drawn cards have the same rank and suit? (Assuming the jokers have no rank.)

1655.content: A signalman has many signal flags in red, yellow, and blue colors, and can take out one, two, or three flags to arrange them in a row to represent various signals. Therefore, among $$300$$ signals, how many signals must be exactly the same?

1656.content: In the pocket, there are some balls of the same size and shape: there are $$8$$ red balls, $$10$$ green balls, $$12$$ yellow balls, and $$15$$ white balls. How many balls must be taken at least to ensure that there are at least $$3$$ balls of one color, $$6$$ balls of another color, and $$9$$ balls of a third color?

1657.content: There are currently $$211$$ students and four different types of chocolates, with each type having more than $$633$$ pieces. Each student can take up to three chocolates, and they may also choose not to take any. If the students are grouped based on the types and quantities of chocolates they take, what is the minimum number of students in the largest group?

1658.content: As shown in the figure: the numbers marked on the left of each row and above each column represent the number of consecutive black squares in that row or column. Can you, children, mark all the black squares based on these numbers?

1659.content: As shown in the figure: the numbers marked on the left of each row and above each column represent the number of consecutive black squares in that row or column. Can you, children, use these numbers to mark all the black squares? The number "1" in the 10th row represents a black square in the 10th row at which position (from left to right)?

1660.content: As shown in the figure: The numbers marked on the left of each row and on the top of each column represent the number of consecutive black squares in that row or column. Can you mark all the black squares based on these numbers?

1666.content: As shown in the figure: The numbers marked on the left of each row and above each column represent the number of consecutive black squares in that row or column. Can you, children, mark all the black squares based on these numbers?

1667.content: To transport $$78$$ tons of goods from City A to City B, if a large truck with a capacity of $$5$$ tons is used for one trip, the cost is $$110$$ yuan, and if a small truck with a capacity of $$2$$ tons is used for one trip, the cost is $$50$$ yuan. If both large and small trucks can be rented simultaneously, what is the minimum cost for transportation?
1667.kc: 租船，租车，大车小车价钱最符合方案

1668.content: Village chief Zhao is gathering a meeting of village officials from villages A, B, C, and D, where each pair of adjacent villages is $$5$$ kilometers apart (as shown in the figure). The number of attendees from each village is as follows: village A has $$8$$ people, village B has $$5$$ people, village C has $$3$$ people, and village D has $$7$$ people. In which village should village chief Zhao hold the meeting to minimize the total distance traveled by all attendees? What is the answer?

1669.content: There are $$100$$ Young Pioneers participating in a radio gymnastics competition, arranged in a solid square formation. How many Young Pioneers are standing around the square?

1670.content: The fourth-grade students at Xinhua Primary School form a solid square formation, with $$9$$ extra people. If one row is added horizontally and one vertically, forming a larger solid square, there are $$24$$ people short. How many students are there in total in the fourth grade?

1671.content: During the gymnastics performance, the sixth-grade students formed a solid square formation (with an equal number of people in rows and columns). It is known that there are $$72$$ people in the outer layer, how many people are there in total in this formation?

1672.content: Aunt Wang wants to copy $$5$$ pages of documents, and both sides need to be copied. If the copier can only copy one side at a time and can hold a maximum of $$2$$ pages, what is the minimum number of times she needs to make copies to finish?

1673.content: Zhao, Sun, and Li arrived at the school clinic at the same time to receive treatment. Sun needs $$5$$ minutes for an injection; Li needs $$3$$ minutes for a bandage change; Zhao needs only $$1$$ minute for eye drops. There is only one doctor, Dr. Zhang, in the clinic. To minimize the total time the three students spend in the clinic, what is the minimum total time they will stay in minutes?

1674.content: There are $$120$$ students in the third grade of elementary school. They are arranged in a three-layer hollow square formation. If another layer is added inside, how many more people are needed?

1675.content: At the carnival, there are $$100$$ students who received lottery tickets numbered from $$1$$ to $$100$$. The rules for distributing prizes based on the ticket numbers are as follows: (1) For ticket numbers that are multiples of $$2$$, they receive $$2$$ pencils. (2) For ticket numbers that are multiples of $$3$$, they receive $$3$$ pencils. (3) For ticket numbers that are both multiples of $$2$$ and $$3$$, they can receive prizes repeatedly. (4) All other ticket numbers receive $$1$$ pencil. How many pencils in total were prepared for this activity at the carnival?

1676.content: There are $$30$$ coins numbered from $$1$$ to $$30$$ placed face up on the table. First, flip the coins that are multiples of $$3$$, then flip the coins that are multiples of $$4$$. In the end, how many coins are still face up?

1677.content: In a certain class, students are holding small flags in three colors: red, yellow, and blue. It is known that there are $$34$$ people holding red flags, $$26$$ people holding yellow flags, and $$18$$ people holding blue flags; there are $$9$$ people holding both red and yellow flags, $$4$$ people holding both yellow and blue flags, $$3$$ people holding both red and blue flags; and there is $$1$$ person holding flags of all three colors. How many people are there in total in this class?

1678.content: In a certain class, there are $$45$$ students, among which many participate in extracurricular interest groups. There are $$22$$ students in the music interest group, $$26$$ students in the art interest group, and $$6$$ students who do not participate in any interest group. How many students participate in both the music and art interest groups?

1679.content: The Experimental Primary School features calligraphy and mathematical thinking training. There are a total of $$245$$ fifth-grade students in the school, among which the number of students participating in calligraphy training is $$82$$ more than those participating in mathematical thinking training. There are $$44$$ students who participate in both calligraphy and mathematical thinking training, while $$63$$ students did not participate in either training. How many students in the fifth grade at the Experimental Primary School participated in mathematical thinking training?

1680.content: The school art troupe has a total of $$45$$ members, among which $$22$$ students can play the piano, $$27$$ students can play the violin, and the number of students who can do both is exactly $$3$$ times the number of students who can do neither. What is the minimum number of students who can do at least one of these?

1681.content: In the math interest group, there are a total of $$35$$ people who subscribe to publication $$A$$, $$21$$ people who subscribe to publication $$B$$, among which $$14$$ people subscribe to both, and only $$5$$ people do not subscribe to either. How many people are there in the math interest group in total?

1682.content: There are $$2006$$ lamps that are lit, each controlled by a switch, numbered in order from $$1$$, $$2$$, $$3$$, …, $$2006$$. Press the switch for the lamp numbered as a multiple of $$2$$; then press the switch for the lamp numbered as a multiple of $$3$$, and finally press the switch for the lamp numbered as a multiple of $$5$$. How many lamps remain lit after pressing the switches?

1683.content: A wooden stick that is $$180$$ centimeters long has a mark drawn every $$2$$ centimeters starting from the left end, then another mark every $$3$$ centimeters from the left end, then every $$5$$ centimeters, and finally every $$7$$ centimeters. If the stick is cut according to these marks, how many small pieces of wood can it be cut into?

1684.content: When numbering the pages of a book, a total of $$11$$ digits of "$$6$$" were used. How many pages does this book have?

1685.content: A page in the middle of a book was torn out, and the sum of the page numbers of the remaining pages is $$5027$$. What are the two page numbers on the torn page? (Fill in from smallest to largest)

1686.content: A dictionary has a total of $$400$$ pages. How many times does the digit “$$0$$” appear in the page numbers?

1687.content: A novel uses a total of $$127$$ digits for its page numbers. How many pages does this book have?

1688.content: A book has a total of $$200$$ pages. How many digits were used for the page numbers from $$1$$ to $$200$$?

1689.content: Arrange the natural numbers in ascending order without gaps to form a large number: $$123456789101112\cdots$$. Question: What is the digit at the $$200$$th position from the left?

1690.content: A book is numbered with page numbers using a total of $$81$$ instances of the digit "$$7$$". What is the minimum number of pages this book can have? What is the maximum number of pages? ( )

1691.content: In a round-robin tennis tournament with 8 players, the rule is that each pair of players must compete in one match. How many matches will be held in total?

1692.content: In a round-robin tennis tournament, a certain number of players played a total of $$45$$ matches. How many players participated?

1693.content: There are a total of $$32$$ national teams participating in the World Cup, referred to as the "top 32." Each group consists of $$4$$ national teams, and in a round-robin format, each team must and can only play one match against each of the other teams in their group. The top two teams from each group advance to the knockout stage; in the knockout stage, each pair of teams plays one match to determine the winner, leading to the quarter-finals, semi-finals, and ultimately determining the champion (first place), runner-up (second place), third place (third place), and fourth place (fourth place). (In the semi-finals, the two losing teams compete in a third and fourth place match, while the remaining knockout stage losers do not participate further.) With this information, calculate how many matches there are in total in the World Cup football tournament.

1694.content: A, B, C, D, E, and Eddie are six people participating in a round-robin tournament, and part of the competition has already taken place. It is known that A has played $$5$$ matches, B has played $$4$$ matches, C has played $$3$$ matches, D has played $$2$$ matches, and E has played $$1$$ match. How many matches has Eddie played?

1695.content: Four students in the class are competing in a checkers tournament, with each pair of students playing one game. The winner of each game gets $$2$$ points, each player in a draw gets $$1$$ point, and the loser gets $$0$$ points. (1) What is the total score of the four students?

1696.content: Five students, A, B, C, D, and E, are competing, and each pair of students must play one game. The winner of each game receives $$2$$ points, each player in a draw receives $$1$$ point, and the loser receives $$0$$ points. Given that students A, B, C, and E scored $$8$$ points, $$5$$ points, $$2$$ points, and $$2$$ points respectively, what is the score of student D?

1697.content: The average of three numbers is $$120$$. After adding another number, the average of the four numbers becomes $$150$$. What is the number that was added?

1698.content: Given that the average of the five natural numbers $$A$$, $$B$$, $$C$$, $$D$$, and $$E$$ is $$15$$, the average of $$A$$, $$B$$, and $$C$$ is $$13$$, and the average of $$C$$, $$D$$, and $$E$$ is $$17$$, what is the value of $$C$$?

1699.content: If $$20$$ apples are evenly distributed among Mingming and his $$4$$ friends, how many apples does each person get on average?

1700.content: Huan Huan walks to school from home every morning. If she walks at a speed of $$50$$ meters per minute, she will be $$5$$ minutes late. If she walks at a speed of $$70$$ meters per minute, she will arrive at school $$5$$ minutes early. What is the distance from Huan Huan's home to the school in meters?

1701.content: The Monkey King distributes peaches to the little monkeys. If each little monkey receives $$10$$ peaches, there are $$100$$ peaches left; if the total number of little monkeys doubles and each still receives $$10$$ peaches, there will be a shortage of $$200$$ peaches. How many peaches did the Monkey King prepare in total?
1701.kc: 盈亏基本类型盈亏问题

1702.content: In a certain school, there are $$100$$ students participating in a math competition, with an average score of $$63$$. The average score of the male participants is $$60$$, and the average score of the female participants is $$70$$. How many more male participants are there than female participants in the school?

1703.content: Class A has $$33$$ students, Class B has $$22$$ students. In an exam, the average score of Class A is $$80$$ points, and the total average score of Class A and Class B is $$82$$ points. What is the average score of Class B?

1704.content: Teacher Lele originally planned to select $$15$$ first prize winners and $$20$$ second prize winners. Now, the last $$5$$ people in the first prize category have been adjusted to the second prize category. As a result, the average score of the first prize winners increased by $$8$$ points, and the average score of the second prize winners increased by $$6$$ points. How many points was the original average score of the first prize winners higher than that of the second prize winners?

1705.content: Four teams are competing in a round-robin tournament. Each match awards $$3$$ points to the winner, $$1$$ point to each team in the event of a draw, and $$0$$ points to the loser. It is known that the team in first place has the fewest goal difference among the four teams and that not all matches ended in a draw. What is the score of the first place team? (Goal difference = number of goals scored - number of goals conceded; teams are ranked by goal difference when points are tied.)

1706.content: Six people are participating in a table tennis competition, where each pair plays one match. The winner gets $$2$$ points and the loser gets $$0$$ points. According to the results, both the second and fifth places are tied between two people. How many points did the first place get, and how many points did the fourth place get?

1707.content: In a chess round-robin tournament with $$5$$ players, each pair of players competes in one game. It is stipulated that a win earns $$2$$ points, a draw gives each player $$1$$ point, and a loss earns no points. Given that after the matches, $$4$$ players earned a total of $$16$$ points, how many points did the $$5$$th player earn?

1708.content: In the NBA playoffs, $$16$$ teams compete in a knockout tournament, and each pair of teams must play a "best of seven" series, where the first team to win four games advances. How many games must be played at a minimum to determine the champion, and what is the maximum number of games that could be played?

1709.content: In a single round-robin tournament, four people A, B, C, and D compete. A win earns $$3$$ points, a draw earns $$1$$ point, and a loss earns $$0$$ points. It is known that A, B, and C scored $$7$$, $$3$$, and $$2$$ points respectively, and B did not have any draws. How many points did D score?

1710.content: Four football teams are playing in a round-robin tournament. It is stipulated that a win earns $$3$$ points, a draw earns $$1$$ point, and a loss earns $$0$$ points. One team has not lost any matches but is ranked last, and there are no cases of all draws. Do you think this is possible? If possible, please provide an example; if not, please explain the reason.

1711.content: Five teams $$A$$, $$B$$, $$C$$, $$D$$, and $$E$$ participated in a single round-robin tournament. A win earns $$3$$ points, a loss earns $$0$$ points, and a draw earns each team $$1$$ point. After the matches, it was found that team $$A$$ had $$2$$ wins and $$2$$ losses, team $$B$$ had $$8$$ points, team $$C$$ had $$9$$ points, and $$E$$ won against $$D$$. What points did team $$D$$ earn, and what points did team $$E$$ earn?

1712.content: There are four soccer teams: $$A$$, $$B$$, $$C$$, and $$D$$, competing in a round-robin tournament. The rules are: winning a match earns $$2$$ points, a draw earns $$1$$ point, and losing earns $$0$$ points. After all matches are finished, teams $$A$$ and $$B$$ are tied for first place, team $$C$$ is in second place, and team $$D$$ is in third place. What is the maximum score that team $$C$$ can achieve?

1713.content: Badminton has always been a strong event in our country. In an international competition, our famous player Bao Chunlai reversed the match with Indonesian player Taufik with a score of $$2:1$$ (badminton is played to $$21$$ points). After calculation, both players scored a total of $$59$$ points over three games, and the point difference in each game did not exceed $$4$$ points (when a player scores $$21$$ points or more, winning by $$2$$ points is required). What were the scores in the three games (with Bao Chunlai's scores listed first)?

1714.content: In a round-robin table tennis tournament among four people, A, B, C, and D, three of them have the same number of wins (no ties). How many matches did the other person win?

1715.content: The squares of non-zero natural numbers are arranged in order from smallest to largest: $$14916253649\cdots \cdots$$. What is the digit in the $$100$$th position from the left?

1716.content: When numbering the pages of a book, a total of $$24$$ digits "$$8$$" were used, and the last page has a page number that contains "$$8$$". How many pages does this book have?

1717.content: A dictionary has a total of $$1755$$ pages, how many times does the digit $$0$$ appear in the page numbers?

1718.content: Mao Mao has a book, and a page (including two adjacent page numbers) was torn out by Dou Dou. Mao Mao added up all the remaining page numbers and got $$777$$. How many pages did Mao Mao's book originally have?

1719.content: The student dictionary used $$2925$$ digits for the page numbers. How many pages does this dictionary have?

1720.content: A page in the middle of a book was torn out, and the sum of the page numbers of the remaining pages is $$1133$$. What are the two page numbers on the torn page?

1721.content: A science fiction novel has a total of $$1320$$ pages. How many different digits are used in the page numbers of this novel?

1722.content: Arrange the numbers from $$1$$ to $$1000$$ in a large number without gaps in ascending order: $$1234567891011121314$$……$$9991000$$. How many times does the sequence "$$123$$" appear in this multi-digit number?

1723.content: In a math textbook, the number $$0$$ appears $$123$$ times. How many pages does this math textbook have at least?

1724.content: Three students went on a picnic and bought a total of eight buns for lunch, which they shared equally among the three of them. When buying the buns, A paid for five buns, and B paid for three buns. After eating, C calculated that he owed a total of $$2$$ yuan and $$4$$ jiao. How much should he give to A and B?

1725.content: If Xiao Ming walks $$40$$ meters per minute from home to school, he will be late by $$2$$ minutes; if he walks $$50$$ meters per minute, he will arrive $$4$$ minutes early. How many meters is it from Xiao Ming's home to school?
1725.kc: 盈亏基本类型盈亏问题

1726.content: There are $$35$$ numbers arranged in $$5$$ rows and $$7$$ columns. The averages of the $$7$$ columns are $$39$$, $$41$$, $$40$$, $$45$$, $$42$$, $$39$$, and $$41$$, and the averages of the first $$4$$ rows are $$42$$, $$39$$, $$44$$, and $$41$$. What is the average of the last row?

1727.content: The Xueersi School has prepared a prize exchange activity with Xueersi coins for students who achieve excellent results. If each outstanding student is given $$10$$ Xueersi coins, there will be $$1000$$ coins left. If the number of outstanding students is doubled (with each person still receiving the same number of coins), there will be a shortage of $$200$$ coins. How many Xueersi coins were prepared for distribution?

1728.content: In the original plan for the Xueersi Cup, there were supposed to be $$10$$ first prize winners and $$20$$ second prize winners. As a result, the average score of the second prize students increased by $$2$$ points, and the average score of the first prize students also increased by $$2$$ points. How many points was the average score of the first prize students originally higher than that of the second prize students?

What was the average score of the remaining $$40$$ students compared to the average score of all students in the exam?

1731.content: A clothing store is going to produce a batch of dresses. If they only make $$5$$ pieces a day, there will still be $$9$$ pieces unfinished when the scheduled time is up; but if they make $$3$$ more pieces each day, not only can they complete it on time, but they only need to make $$5$$ pieces on the last day. What is the scheduled time in days, and how many pieces are there in total?
1731.kc: 一元一次方程解应用题

How many rabbits do Xiao Bai Rabbit and Xiao Hui Rabbit have in total?
1732.kc: 一元一次方程解应用题

1733.content: Using a rope to measure the depth of a well. After folding the rope three times, the measurement is $$2$$ feet above the well opening; after folding the rope four times, the distance from the top of the rope to the well opening is still $$1$$ foot. What is the depth of the well in feet, and what is the length of the rope in feet? (The length at the bending point is negligible, and each fold is considered to be equal in length.)
1733.kc: 盈亏基本类型盈亏问题

1734.content: There is a pile of peaches. The first monkey takes half and puts back $$1$$; the second monkey takes half of the remaining and puts back $$1$$; the third monkey takes half of the remaining and puts back $$1$$, and so on. The $$2018$$th monkey takes half of the remaining and puts back $$1$$, and at this point, there are $$2$$ peaches left. How many peaches were there originally?

1735.content: The doctor allocates his monthly salary as follows: half of his salary is deposited in the bank, half of the remaining money minus $$300$$ yuan is used to pay the mortgage, then half of the remaining money plus $$300$$ yuan is used for dining expenses, and he is left with $$800$$ yuan. What is the doctor's monthly salary?

1736.content: A bird pecks at millet. The first time it ate more than half of the millet by $$10$$ grains, the second time it ate less than half of the remaining millet by $$12$$ grains, the third time it ate $$14$$ grains, and finally there were $$15$$ grains of millet left. How many grains of millet were there originally?

1737.content: There is a pile of chess pieces. After dividing it into three equal parts, one piece remains. If two parts and one piece are taken away, and the remaining chess pieces are divided into three equal parts again, one piece still remains. After taking away two parts and one piece again, and finally dividing the remaining chess pieces into three equal parts, one piece still remains. What is the minimum number of chess pieces originally?

1738.content: Classes A, B, and C have a total of $$144$$ students. First, the same number of students from class A is transferred to class B. Then, the same number of students from class B is transferred to class C. Next, the same number of students from class C is transferred back to class A, so that classes A, B, and C have the same number of students. Originally, class A had more students than class B.

1739.content: There are $$24$$ birds on three trees. If $$3$$ birds fly from the first tree to the second tree, and $$5$$ birds fly from the second tree to the third tree, and finally, the number of birds on each of the three trees is the same, how many birds were originally on the first, second, and third trees?

1740.content: There are three monkeys sharing a pile of peaches. The big monkey first took half of the pile minus $$1$$ peach; the second monkey took half of the remaining peaches plus $$1$$ peach; the little monkey received the remaining $$8$$ peaches, and all the peaches were distributed. How many peaches were there in the pile?

1741.content: A total of $$48$$ kilograms of water is divided into three bottles. The first time, a portion of water from bottle $$A$$ is poured into bottles $$B$$ and $$C$$, making the amount of water in bottles $$B$$ and $$C$$ double what they originally had. The second time, a portion of water from bottle $$B$$ is poured into bottles $$A$$ and $$C$$, also making the amount of water in bottles $$A$$ and $$C$$ double what they already had. The third time, a portion of water from bottle $$C$$ is poured into bottles $$A$$ and $$B$$, making the amount of water in bottles $$A$$ and $$B$$ double what they already had. After these three transfers, the three bottles contain the same amount of water. How many kilograms of water were originally in bottle $$A$$, bottle $$B$$, and bottle $$C$$?

1742.content: An old man said: "If you add $$14$$ to my age, divide by $$3$$, then subtract $$26$$, and finally multiply by $$25$$, it just happens to be $$100$$ years old." How old is the old man this year?

1743.content: Doctor asked Da Kuan to plant a row of trees on one side of the road. At first, Da Kuan planted $$5$$ poplar trees in a row, and then the doctor said, "You are planting it incorrectly; you need to plant in the order of $$3$$ willow trees, $$2$$ pine trees, $$1$$ poplar tree, then again $$3$$ willow trees, $$2$$ pine trees, $$1$$ poplar tree, and so on." After that, Da Kuan continued to plant according to this pattern. In the end, Da Kuan planted a total of $$200$$ trees. How many willow trees, pine trees, and poplar trees did Da Kuan plant?

1744.content: If September 29 of this year is Weier's 6th birthday and it is a Sunday, what day of the week was Weier born on?

1745.content: There are a total of $$50$$ oil bottles, large and small. Each large bottle can hold $$4$$ kilograms of oil, and each small bottle can hold $$2$$ kilograms. The large bottles hold a total of $$20$$ kilograms more than the small bottles (each bottle is full). How many large bottles are there, and how many small bottles are there?

If an article is not accepted, A loses a cost of $$200$$ yuan, and B loses a cost of $$300$$ yuan. Each person wrote $$10$$ articles, and a total of $$14$$ articles were published. When settled, A earned $$1000$$ yuan more than B. How many articles did A publish, and how many articles did B publish?

1749.content: In a pond, there are some turtles. Each of them sleeps for half a day during the daytime; some sleep in the morning, while others sleep in the afternoon. One day, a total of $$20$$ heads and $$60$$ legs were counted in the morning, and in the afternoon, a total of $$17$$ heads and $$40$$ legs were counted. How many turtles only retract their four legs into their shells while sleeping?

1750.content: In an ancient legend, there are four types of magical birds: the double-tailed bird (1 head, 2 tails), the triple-tailed bird (1 head, 3 tails), the six-tailed bird (1 head, 6 tails), and the eight-tailed bird (2 heads, 8 tails). One day, the four types of birds happened to gather together. A double-tailed bird said, "I found that the number of our type of birds is exactly 5 more than 2 times the number of eight-tailed birds." A triple-tailed bird said, "Our number is not much, only 2 more than half the number of six-tailed birds." It is known that the total number of tails of the four types of birds is 2 less than 4 times the total number of heads, and the total number of heads is 241 less than the total number of tails. How many triple-tailed birds are there?

1751.content: In a cage with chickens and rabbits, it is known that there are $$5$$ more chickens than rabbits, and the number of rabbit legs is $$24$$ more than the number of chicken legs. How many chickens are there, and how many rabbits are there?
