1824.content: One day, there was a power outage, and two candles of the same length were lit in the room. These two candles have different burn times: one lasts $$4$$ hours and the other lasts $$12$$ hours. When the power was restored and the candles were blown out, it was found that the length of one candle remaining was $$3$$ times the length of the other candle remaining. What was the duration of the power outage in hours?

1825.content: There are two areas in the reading corner, area $$A$$ and area $$B$$. The number of books in area $$A$$ is $$4$$ more than $$3$$ times the number of books in area $$B$$. If $$1$$ book is taken from area $$B$$ and placed into area $$A$$, then the number of books in area $$A$$ becomes $$5$$ times that of area $$B$$. How many books were originally in area $$A$$?

1826.content: There is a $$7 \times 7$$ square matrix as follows. According to the pattern, if the matrix is extended to a $$50 \times 50$$ square matrix, which letter will be in the bottom right corner? $$C$$ $$B$$ $$A$$ $$E$$ $$D$$ $$C$$ $$B$$ $$D$$ $$A$$ $$E$$ $$D$$ $$C$$ $$B$$ $$A$$ $$E$$ $$B$$ $$B$$ $$A$$ $$E$$ $$A$$ $$E$$ $$A$$ $$C$$ $$C$$ $$A$$ $$D$$ $$E$$ $$D$$ $$B$$ $$D$$ $$D$$ $$B$$ $$C$$ $$D$$ $$C$$ $$C$$ $$E$$ $$E$$ $$A$$ $$B$$ $$C$$ $$B$$ $$D$$ $$A$$ $$B$$ $$C$$ $$D$$ $$E$$ $$A$$

1827.content: Doctor and Eddie are making egg tarts together. The number made by Doctor is $$7$$ times that of Eddie. During afternoon tea, the two of them ate half of the egg tarts, and Eddie ate $$6$$ more than Doctor. If Eddie eats $$1$$ more, then the number he ate would be $$3$$ times what he made. How many egg tarts did Doctor eat?

1828.content: Chefs A and B are discussing the number of their signature dishes. Chef A says, "Four times the number of my signature dishes is still $$60$$ less than yours." Chef B replies, "Actually, twice the number of my signature dishes is $$540$$ more than yours." How many signature dishes do they have in total?

1829.content: After the exam results came out, the doctor held a test paper with $$98$$ points in one hand and a test paper with $$89$$ points in the other hand, and said: "If I multiply the number in my left hand by $$3$$, multiply the number in my right hand by $$2$$, and then add these two products, the sum is an odd number." Can you guess how many points are on the test paper in the doctor's left hand?
1829.kc: 奇数与偶数的加减规律

1830.content: Place the numbers $$1$$ to $$6$$ at the six vertices of a triangular prism, and then write the average of the two numbers at the vertices of each edge at the midpoint of that edge. If the three midpoints on the upper base ($$\triangle ABC$$) and the three midpoints on the lower base ($$\triangle DEF$$) all have integers written on them, then how many of the numbers written at the other three midpoints are not integers?

1831.content: Number sequence: $$1$$, $$1$$, $$6$$, $$21$$, $$81$$, $$306$$, …, starting from the third number, each number is equal to three times the sum of the previous two numbers. How many even numbers are there among the first $$2018$$ numbers in this sequence?

1832.content: Do two integers exist such that their sum is $$264$$ and their difference is $$57$$?

1833.content: If there are enough apples, pears, and oranges mixed together, and they are divided into $$9$$ piles, is there always a way to combine two piles such that the number of each type of fruit is even?

1834.content: There are $$400$$ pieces in a box, with $$200$$ black pieces and $$200$$ white pieces. We perform the following operation on these pieces: each time we take out $$2$$ pieces, if they are the same color, we put back $$1$$ black piece; if they are of different colors, we put back $$1$$ white piece. This operation effectively reduces the total number of pieces by $$1$$ each time. After $$399$$ operations, what color will the remaining piece be?

1835.content: There are $$5$$ coins on the table. In the first turn, $$1$$ coin is flipped, in the second turn, $$2$$ coins are flipped, in the third turn, $$3$$ coins are flipped, in the fourth turn, $$4$$ coins are flipped, and in the fifth turn, $$5$$ coins are flipped. Is it possible to find a method to flip the coins so that all the coins are flipped over in the end? If there are $$6$$ coins on the table and you flip them in a similar manner six times, is it possible to find a method to flip the coins so that all the coins are flipped over in the end?

1836.content: On an $$8 \times 8$$ chessboard, there are $$9$$ pieces placed in the lower left corner, forming a $$3 \times 3$$ square (as shown in the lower left image). Each piece can jump over an adjacent piece to an empty square, meaning it can perform a symmetrical motion around the adjacent piece. It can jump horizontally, vertically, or diagonally (for example, piece $$1$$ in the lower right image can jump to positions $$2$$, $$3$$, or $$4$$). The question is: can these pieces jump to the upper right corner of the chessboard and fill the upper right $$3 \times 3$$ square?

1837.content: As shown in the figure, starting from point $$0$$, a tree is planted every $$3$$ meters. If three small signs saying "Protect the Trees" are hung on three trees, then no matter how the signs are hung, there will be at least two signed trees that are an even distance apart (in meters). Please explain the reason.
1837.kc: 奇数与偶数的加减规律

1838.content: In a math exam, there are a total of $$20$$ questions. It is stipulated that answering a question correctly earns $$2$$ points, answering a question incorrectly deducts $$1$$ point, and unanswered questions do not count for points. After the exam, Xiao Ming scored a total of $$23$$ points. He wants to know how many questions he answered incorrectly, but he only remembers that the number of unanswered questions is an even number. Can you help Xiao Yuan calculate how many questions he answered incorrectly?

1839.content: The New Year is over and school has started. Some students need to buy new uniforms. Wei Er collected the uniform fees from $$9$$ classmates (each paying the same amount) and gave it to the teacher. The teacher gave Wei Er a note that said, "The uniform fee is $$\overline{2\square 38}$$ yuan," where a drop of ink has obscured the number in the square. Eddie took a look and quickly figured out the number in the square. Smart kids, what is this number?

1840.content: There are five digits: $$0$$, $$1$$, $$4$$, $$7$$, and $$9$$. Choose four digits to form a four-digit number. List the four-digit numbers that are divisible by $$3$$ in ascending order. What is the $$5$$th number?

1841.content: Given that the six-digit number $$\overline{20\square 279}$$ can be divided by $$11$$, what is the digit in the square?

1842.content: Change one digit in $$54679$$ so that this five-digit number is divisible by $$5$$. What is the maximum five-digit number after the change?

1843.content: If the four-digit number $$\overline{9a8a}$$ can be divided by $$3$$ and $$5$$ at the same time, what digit does $$a$$ represent?
1843.kc: 基础复合数字的整除特征

1844.content: Change one digit in $$3255$$ so that the four-digit number can be divisible by $$8$$. What is the modified four-digit number?

1845.content: We can use matchsticks to form the numbers $$0$$ to $$9$$. Which number uses the most matchsticks?

1846.content: How many different ways are there to divide $$8$$ identical peaches into $$3$$ piles?

1847.content: As shown in the figure, a little ant needs to start from the vertex $$A$$ of a triangular pyramid, and walk along the edges of the pyramid to visit $$4$$ vertices without repeating, and then return to vertex $$A$$. How many different paths does the little ant have?

1848.content: A and B are playing table tennis. Whoever wins two consecutive games first wins. If no one wins the first two games consecutively, whoever wins three games first wins, continuing until a winner is determined. How many possible outcomes are there?

1849.content: Xue Xue has some apples. After evenly distributing them to $$5$$ children, each child receives $$4$$ apples, and Xue Xue has $$2$$ apples left. How many apples did Xue Xue originally have?
1849.kc: 盈亏基本类型盈亏问题

1850.content: Pea is $$10$$ years old this year, Potato is $$20$$ years old this year. When the sum of their ages is $$60$$ years, how old will Pea be and how old will Potato be?
1850.kc: 年龄问题基本关系和差问题

1851.content: The brother said to the younger brother: "When I was your age, you were only $$5$$ years old." The younger brother replied: "When I am your age, you will be $$35$$ years old." How old is the younger brother this year?

1852.content: This year, Xue Xue is $$6$$ years old, and Dad is $$30$$ years old. In a few years, Dad's age will be $$4$$ times Xue Xue's age. How many years later will that be?

1853.content: On the same plane, a maximum of how many intersection points can be formed by $$13$$ lines?

1854.content: In the figure, there are a total of $$5$$ straight lines and $$7$$ intersection points. If only line $${{l}_{1}}$$ is removed, how many intersection points remain? If only line $${{l}_{2}}$$ is removed, how many intersection points remain? If only line $${{l}_{3}}$$ is removed, how many intersection points remain? If only line $${{l}_{4}}$$ is removed, how many intersection points remain? If only line $${{l}_{5}}$$ is removed, how many intersection points remain?

1855.content: In the figure, there are a total of $$4$$ straight lines and $$3$$ intersection points. How many straight lines can be removed without changing the intersection points?

1856.content: On the same plane, a maximum of how many intersection points can there be with $$30$$ straight lines?

1857.content: There is a city street map consisting of several rectangles, as shown in the figure. A police officer needs to start patrolling from point $$A$$, traveling through each road segment at least once before returning to point $$A$$. How many meters must he walk at a minimum?

1858.content: The diagram below is a floor plan of a park's roads, with the numbers indicating the lengths of the roads (unit: meters). Points $$A$$ and $$B$$ are the entrance and exit of the park, respectively. What is the shortest distance to walk through all the roads and then exit from the park?

1859.content: If $$12$$ candies are to be distributed among three children, with each child receiving at least $$2$$ candies and the amounts being different, how many ways are there to distribute them?

1860.content: Xinhua Primary School arranges $$4$$ extracurricular activities each week, which include sports, arts, and technology. If each type of activity must occur at least once in a week, and the same type of activity cannot be scheduled consecutively, how many different arrangements are there?

1861.content: As shown in the figure, starting from the starting point to the endpoint, you are required to collect a flag at each station, and you can only pass through each station once. How many different ways are there to walk?

1862.content: The sum of the digits in a three-digit number is $$6$$. How many such three-digit numbers are there?

1863.content: The natural numbers $$21$$, $$654$$, and $$7521$$ share a common characteristic: they each have at least two digits, and for any two adjacent digits, the left digit is greater than the right digit. We call these "descending numbers." How many "descending numbers" can be formed using the digits $$4$$, $$6$$, $$7$$, and $$9$$?

1864.content: How many different ways are there to place $$10$$ identical small balls into $$3$$ identical boxes (each box can contain no balls)?

1865.content: As shown in the figure, an ant starts from the vertex $$P$$ of a tetrahedron and moves along the edges to visit $$5$$ vertices without repeating any, then stops. How many different ways can the ant walk?

1866.content: The school distributes dormitories. If each dormitory accommodates $$8$$ people, there will be $$2$$ dormitories left over. If each dormitory accommodates $$6$$ people, there will be $$12$$ people without a place to stay. How many dormitories are there in total?
1866.kc: 盈亏基本类型盈亏问题

1867.content: The teacher took several students to eat ice cream. If each student is given a snow cone and a small cone that costs $$2$$ yuan, a total of $$15$$ yuan is lacking; if only a snow cone is bought for each student, $$5$$ yuan is lacking. How many students are there in total?

1868.content: Teacher Tang distributes candy to the students in the class. If one person receives $$12$$ pieces, the remaining students each receive $$10$$ pieces, and it is just enough to finish. If two people each receive $$5$$ pieces, the remaining students each receive $$12$$ pieces, and it is just enough to finish. How many students are there in the class? How many pieces of candy did Teacher Tang bring?

1869.content: The tailor received an order to sew buttons on a batch of jackets. If he sews $$5$$ pieces a day, he will finish $$2$$ days later than the scheduled time; if he sews $$9$$ pieces a day, he will finish $$2$$ days earlier. How many pieces are there in this batch of jackets?

1870.content: The teacher distributed apples and peaches to the children. The total number of apples bought is twice the number of peaches. After each child received $$5$$ peaches, there were $$15$$ peaches left; if each person received $$14$$ apples, then the total number of apples is short by $$30$$. How many peaches and apples did the teacher buy in total?
1870.kc: 盈亏基本类型盈亏问题

1871.content: The Young Pioneers went to arrange flower pots. If each person arranges $$5$$ pots, there are $$3$$ pots left unarranged; if $$2$$ people each arrange $$4$$ pots and the remaining people each arrange $$6$$ pots, all the pots are exactly used up. How many Young Pioneers participated in the flower pot arranging activity, and how many pots were arranged in total?
1871.kc: 盈亏基本类型盈亏问题

1872.content: Teacher Peach Heart took the children out for a spring outing and is responsible for allocating the accommodation rooms. It is known that: if each room accommodates $$3$$ people, there will be $$23$$ people left over; if each room accommodates $$5$$ people, there will be $$1$$ room left empty. How many rooms are there, and how many children are there?

1873.content: Mother Rabbit distributes carrots to the little rabbits. If each little rabbit gets $$2$$ carrots, there are $$8$$ carrots left, and if each little rabbit gets $$5$$ carrots, there are $$4$$ carrots short. How many little rabbits are there?
1873.kc: 盈亏基本类型盈亏问题

1874.content: What is the area of the shape in the figure in square meters?
1874.kc: 长方形和正方形面积公式

1875.content:
(1) The area of a rectangle is $$42$$ square meters, the length is $$7$$ meters, what is the width in meters?  
(2) The area of a square is $$144$$ square meters, what is the length of a side in meters?
1875.kc: 长方形和正方形面积公式

1876.content: As shown in the figure, a large rectangle is divided into four smaller rectangles, three of which have areas of $$4$$ square centimeters, $$6$$ square centimeters, and $$10$$ square centimeters, respectively. What is the area of the shaded part in square centimeters?

1877.content: Eddie's house has an $$“L”$$ shaped swimming pool, as shown in the figure below. He is preparing to buy some blue tiles to cover the bottom of the swimming pool (not considering the sides). How many square meters of tiles does Eddie need to buy?

1878.content: As shown in the figure, a square flowerbed with a side length of $$8$$ meters has $$4$$ paths that are $$1$$ meter wide (the shaded area in the figure). What is the area of the flowerbed (the unshaded area) in square meters?

1879.content: Below is a rectangular garden with an area of $$42$$ square meters. It is known that the width of this garden is $$6$$ meters. What is the length of this garden in meters?
1879.kc: 长方形和正方形面积公式

1880.content: As shown in the figure, a large rectangle is divided into $$9$$ smaller rectangles, among which the areas of the $$3$$ rectangles located at the corners are $$9$$, $$15$$, and $$12$$, respectively. What is the area of the $$4$$th rectangle at the corner?

1881.content: A rectangle is divided into four rectangles by two straight lines. Given the areas of three of the rectangles, what is the area of the rectangle at $$?$$ in square centimeters?

1882.content: In the figure below, there are $$2$$ paths, each with a width of $$1$$ meter, in a square vegetable garden. Given that the area of the shaded part is $$35$$ square meters, what is the area of the vegetable garden (the blank part) in square meters?

1883.content: There is a rectangular flower bed that is $$8$$ meters long and $$5$$ meters wide, with a $$1$$ meter wide path paved around it. What is the area of the path in square meters?

1884.content: Two company delegations are meeting together. Company A sent $$10$$ people and Company B sent $$12$$ people. Now, to hold the meeting, one minute-taker needs to be selected from each company, and one host needs to be selected from Company A. How many different ways can these selections be made?
1884.kc: 乘法原理里的其他类型

1885.content: The diagram below is a floor plan of a school playground. It is known that segment $$a=120$$ meters, $$b=130$$ meters, $$c=70$$ meters, $$d=60$$ meters, and $$l=250$$ meters. Teacher Wang runs around the school for $$3$$ laps every morning, how many meters does Teacher Wang run each day?

1886.content: The postman has $$3$$ roads from village $$A$$ to village $$B$$ and $$2$$ roads from village $$B$$ to village $$C$$. How many different ways can the postman travel from village $$A$$ to village $$C$$ via village $$B$$?

1887.content: In the figure, the side length of square $$ABCD$$ is $$6$$ centimeters. By drawing parallel lines on each side through any two non-overlapping points inside the square, the square can be divided into $$9$$ small rectangles. What is the sum of the perimeters of these $$9$$ small rectangles in centimeters?
1887.kc: 公式法长方形正方形周长

1888.content: How many three-digit even numbers with no repeated digits can be formed using the digits $$0$$, $$1$$, $$2$$, $$3$$, and $$4$$?

1889.content: There is a rectangular vegetable plot, as shown in the figure. The area of the vegetable plot is larger than the area of the radish plot by how many square meters?
1889.kc: 长方形和正方形面积公式

1890.content: In the figure below, a large rectangle is divided into $$4$$ smaller rectangles, three of which have areas of $$28\text{c}{{\text{m}}^{2}}$$, $$8\text{c}{{\text{m}}^{2}}$$, and $$42\text{c}{{\text{m}}^{2}}$$ respectively. What is the area represented by $$A$$ in $$\text{c}{{\text{m}}^{2}}$$?
1890.kc: 长方形和正方形面积公式

1891.content: In the figure below, the adjacent sides are perpendicular to each other. What is the perimeter of this shape?
1891.kc: 复合型不规则图形求周长

1892.content: Using $$4$$ different colored pens to write the words "I love math," with adjacent characters in different colors, how many different ways are there to write it?
1892.kc: 乘法原理里的其他类型

1893.content: A rectangular leisure square is being built in a community (as shown in the figure), with a perimeter of $$300$$ meters and a length of $$90$$ meters. It is known that the activity area is square, and the remaining area is for a fountain, with the area of the fountain being how many square meters?
1893.kc: 公式法长方形正方形周长

1894.content: There is a square flower bed with a side length of $$15$$ meters, surrounded by a $$2$$ meter wide path. What is the area of the path in square meters?

1895.kc: 整数除法巧算之类分配律

1896.content: It is defined that $$a \oplus b = (a + 2b) - (a + b)$$, where $$a$$ and $$b$$ are both natural numbers. What is $$\left( 1 \oplus 2 \right) + \left( 2 \oplus 3 \right) + \left( 3 \oplus 4 \right) + \left( 4 \oplus 5 \right)$$?

1897.content: Given that the first term of the arithmetic sequence is $$4$$ and the $$8$$th term is $$298$$, what is the common difference of this sequence?

1898.content: A certain theater has $$20$$ rows of seats, and each row has $$2$$ more seats than the previous row. The last row has $$70$$ seats. How many seats are there in total in this theater?

1899.content: As shown in the figure: The numbers on the left of each row and above each column represent the number of consecutive black squares in that row or column. Can you, children, mark all the black squares based on these numbers?

1900.content: As shown in the figure: The numbers marked on the left side of each row and the top side of each column represent the number of consecutive black squares in that row or column. Can you mark all the black squares based on these numbers?

1901.content: In a solid square formation, there are a total of $$56$$ people in the outermost layer. How many people are there on each side of the outer layer?

1902.content: In a hollow square matrix with $$3$$ layers, there are $$9$$ people on each side of the outer layer. How many people are there in total in this $$3$$-layer hollow square matrix?

1903.content: There are a total of $$200$$ people arranged in a hollow square formation with $$5$$ layers, where the outermost layer has people on each side. If we want to add an extra row and an extra column to the outermost layer, how many additional people will be needed?

1904.content: Xiao Ming arranged a solid square formation, using $$40$$ pieces on the outer layer. How many pieces were used in total?

1905.content: The third-grade students at a certain school are arranged in a square formation, with $$80$$ people on the outermost layer. How many people are there on each side of the outermost layer? How many students are there in total in the third grade?

1906.content: During military training, the students formed a hollow square formation consisting of $$204$$ people in three layers. How many people are there on each side of the outermost layer?

1907.content: In a solid square formation, if there are $$14$$ people on each side of the outermost layer, how many people are there in total in the square formation?

1908.content: The fourth grade has $$8$$ classes participating in a tug-of-war competition, requiring that each pair of classes compete once, and each class must compete $$...$$ times in total. How many matches will be held in total?

1909.content: An old man said: "If you add $$14$$ to my age, divide by $$3$$, then subtract $$26$$, and finally multiply by $$25$$, it just happens to be $$100$$ years old." How old is the old man this year?

1910.content: Viola and Eddie are practicing running on the playground. After a while, the distance Eddie ran is three times that of Viola plus an additional $$80$$ meters. How many meters did Viola run if Eddie ran $$280$$ meters more than Viola?

1911.content: In the third grade, there are $$7$$ classes participating in a soccer competition, and each pair of classes will compete against each other. The winner gets $$2$$ points, the loser gets $$0$$ points, and in the case of a draw, both get $$1$$ point. What is the total score of the $$7$$ classes?

1912.content: Xiwang Primary School's fourth grade organized a soccer competition, where teams were paired for a round-robin tournament. A total of $$45$$ matches were played. How many teams participated in the competition?

1913.content: There are $$9$$ students participating in the competition, and each pair of students has to compete in a match. How many matches will there be in total?

1914.content: Ming Ming, Hong Hong, and Tian Tian have a total of $$60$$ apples. Ming Ming has $$3$$ times the amount of apples that Tian Tian has, and Hong Hong has $$2$$ times the amount of apples that Tian Tian has minus $$6$$. How many apples does Tian Tian have?

1915.content: In Cong Cong's family, there are a total of $$88$$ chickens, ducks, and rabbits. The number of chickens is $$3$$ times the number of ducks, and the number of rabbits is $$4$$ times the number of ducks. How many rabbits does Cong Cong's family have?

1916.content: The store received a total of $$51$$ kilograms of grapes, strawberries, and bananas. The weight of the grapes is $$3$$ times the weight of the strawberries minus $$3$$ kilograms, and the weight of the bananas is $$2$$ times the weight of the grapes. How much do the grapes weigh in kilograms?

1917.content: A and B compare the number of points cards. If A gives $$20$$ cards to B, and then B takes $$30$$ cards from his current points cards to give to A, both will have exactly $$100$$ cards at that time. How many points cards did A originally have?

1918.content: During the New Year, Mom sent red envelopes with lucky money to the children on WeChat. Jia Jia was the first to take, taking half of the money in the envelope, Jian Jian took $$5$$ yuan as the second, and finally, Cheng Cheng took the remaining $$6$$ yuan. How much money did Mom send in total?

1919.content: There are $$48$$ books to be distributed among two groups of children. It is known that the second group has $$5$$ more people than the first group. If all the books are given to the first group, some children can each receive $$5$$ books, while others can each receive $$4$$ books; if all the books are given to the second group, some children can each receive $$4$$ books, while others can each receive $$3$$ books. How many people are there in total in both groups?
1919.kc: 已知两量之间倍数关系和两量之差，求两个量

1920.content: There are some milk candies and chocolate candies. If $$6$$ milk candies and $$4$$ chocolate candies are put in one bag, there are still $$4$$ milk candies left, and the chocolate candies are just enough. If $$8$$ milk candies and $$4$$ chocolate candies are put in one bag, the milk candies are just enough, and there are still $$8$$ chocolate candies left. How many milk candies are there and how many chocolate candies are there?

1921.content: The Monkey King led a group of monkeys to pick peaches. After finishing work in the afternoon, the Monkey King started distributing them. If each little monkey gets $$3$$ peaches, there will be $$10$$ left over. If each little monkey gets $$4$$ peaches, there will be $$1$$ little monkey who can only receive $$3$$ peaches. How many little monkeys are there in this group (not including the Monkey King)?

1922.content: If the students of a choir sit $$3$$ people on each bench, there are $$9$$ people left over. If they sit $$4$$ people on each bench, there is one extra bench. How many people are in the choir?

1923.content: The teacher is preparing to distribute candies to the students. If each person receives $$14$$ pieces, there will be $$19$$ pieces left; if the number of students doubles and each person receives $$9$$ pieces, there will be a shortage of $$17$$ pieces. How many pieces of candy does the teacher have in total?

1924.content: The kindergarten distributes a basket of apples to the children. If each child in the big class receives $$5$$ apples, there are $$6$$ apples left; if each child in the small class receives $$4$$ apples, there are $$4$$ apples remaining. It is known that there are $$2$$ fewer children in the big class than in the small class. How many apples are there in total in this basket?

1925.content: A worker needs to grind $$200$$ kilograms of flour. After grinding $$60$$ kilograms in $$3$$ hours, how many more hours will it take to grind the remaining flour?

1926.content: Grandpa hires several identical robots to help him cultivate a piece of land that is $$1800$$ square meters. After calculations, if he hires $$12$$ robots, it will take $$18$$ hours to finish cultivating all the land. If Grandpa hires $$24$$ robots to work for $$15$$ hours, how many square meters of land can be cultivated?

1927.content: In the "70th Anniversary of National Founding" knowledge quiz competition, answering a question correctly adds $$10$$ points, while answering incorrectly deducts $$5$$ points. Cong Cong answered a total of $$10$$ questions and ended up with $$85$$ points. How many questions did he answer correctly and how many did he answer incorrectly?

1928.content: In the figure, if $$AB$$ is $$8$$ centimeters long, $$AD$$ is $$5$$ centimeters long, and $$BE$$ is $$4$$ centimeters long, what is the area of the parallelogram in square centimeters?
1928.kc: 平行四边形的面积公式

1929.content: In the figure, quadrilateral $$ABCD$$ is a rhombus. Given that $$AC=20$$ and $$BD=11$$, what is the area of the rhombus?

1930.content: Master Wang processed $$60$$ parts in $$2$$ hours. Based on this calculation, how many parts can he process in a day if he works $$8$$ hours? If he needs to process $$360$$ parts, how many hours will it take?

1931.content: Xingxing and Yaoyao agreed to meet at the peach store between their two homes. Xingxing walks $$52$$ meters per minute, and Yaoyao walks $$44$$ meters per minute. After they both start at the same time and walk for $$12$$ minutes, they are still $$208$$ meters apart before they meet. Can you calculate the distance between Xingxing's and Yaoyao's homes in meters?

1932.kc: 连续自然数长方形数表之已知数求位置

If you move the cross frame up, down, left, or right, you can enclose another set of five numbers. The sum of these five numbers equals $$2015$$. What is the largest number among these five numbers?

2095.content: Five basketball teams are participating in a round-robin tournament, meaning each pair of teams plays one match against each other. The winner earns $$2$$ points, the loser earns $$0$$ points, and a draw earns $$1$$ point. It is known that all teams have different scores. The first-place team has never drawn; the second-place team has never lost; the fourth-place team has never won. How many matches ended in a draw in total?

2096.content: There are a total of $$32$$ national teams participating in the World Cup, referred to as the "32 strong." Among them, every $$4$$ national teams are grouped into $$1$$ group. In a single round-robin format, each national team must and can only play one match against each of the other national teams in its group. The top two teams from each group advance to the knockout stage; in the knockout stage, two teams play one match to determine the winner, resulting in the top $$8$$, $$4$$, and so on, until the champion (first place), runner-up (second place), third place (third place), and fourth place (fourth place) are determined. (In the semifinals, the two losing teams participate in the third and fourth place match, while the other knockout stage losers do not participate in further matches.) With this information, can you calculate the total number of matches in the World Cup?

2097.content: A total of $$128$$ children participated in the "10th I Can Eat the Most" competition, using an elimination format until a champion is decided. How many matches need to be arranged in total?

2098.content: In a round-robin tennis tournament with $$12$$ players, where each person competes against every other person once, how many matches will be held in total?

2099.content: In a round-robin chess tournament with eight people, it is stipulated that the winner gets $$2$$ points, the loser gets $$0$$ points, and each player in a draw earns $$1$$ point. After the competition ends, what is the total score of the eight players?

2100.content: Eddie and Weier arrived at the visitor rest area, and they found that there are a total of $$109$$ pots of chrysanthemums, camellias, and roses. The number of chrysanthemums is $$1$$ pot more than $$3$$ times the number of camellias, and the number of camellias is $$2$$ times the number of roses. How many more pots of chrysanthemums are there than roses?

2101.content: When two numbers are divided, the quotient is $$3$$ and the remainder is $$2$$. Given that the sum of the dividend, divisor, quotient, and remainder is $$115$$, what is the dividend and what is the divisor?

2102.content: Eddie has twice the amount of money that Ding Ding has plus $$1$$ yuan, and Wei Er has five times the amount of money that Ding Ding has minus $$11$$ yuan. Moreover, Wei Er has $$24$$ yuan more than Eddie. How much money did Eddie bring, how much did Ding Ding bring, and how much did Wei Er bring?

2103.content: A, B, and C are eating buns. A eats $$3$$ more than twice what B eats, and B eats twice what C eats. Together, they ate a total of $$73$$ buns. How many buns did A eat?

2104.content: Zhu Bajie leads Mai Dou, Peppa, Zhu Jianqiang, and other little pigs to play games, with a total of $$20$$ little pigs. Zhu Bajie divides the little pigs into three groups. The first group has $$4$$ fewer pigs than the sum of the other two groups, and the second group has $$2$$ more pigs than the third group. How many pigs are in the first group, how many pigs are in the second group, and how many pigs are in the third group? (Zhu Bajie is not a little pig.)

2105.content: Four students, A, B, C, and D, are dividing homework, with a total of $$60$$ books. A says, "I received the least homework, $$2$$ books less than B, $$2$$ books less than D, and $$4$$ books less than C." How many books did A receive, and how many books did C receive?

2106.content: There was a penny-pincher who always wanted to make his money grow. One day, he met an old man on a bridge, and the old man said to him, "If you walk across this bridge and come back, the money you have will double, but as a fee, you must give me $$32$$ copper coins for each round trip." The penny-pincher calculated that it was quite a good deal and agreed. He walked across the bridge and back, and his money indeed doubled. He happily gave the old man $$32$$ copper coins. After completing the third round trip, he gave the old man his last $$32$$ copper coins, leaving him with not a single coin left. The question is: How many copper coins did the penny-pincher originally have?

2107.content: The doctor allocates his monthly salary as follows: half of his salary is deposited in the bank, half of the remaining money minus $$300$$ yuan is used to pay the mortgage, then half of the remaining money plus $$300$$ yuan is used for dining expenses, and he is left with $$800$$ yuan. What is the doctor's monthly salary?

2108.content: There are three piles of apples: A, B, and C, totaling $$96$$ apples. In the first step, an amount of apples equal to the number in pile B is taken from pile A and added to pile B. In the second step, an amount of apples equal to the number in pile C is taken from pile B and added to pile C. In the third step, an amount of apples equal to the remaining number in pile A is taken from pile C and added back to pile A. At this point, the number of apples in all three piles is equal. How many apples were originally in pile A, pile B, and pile C?

2109.content: When Eddie was doing a subtraction problem, he mistakenly wrote the $$3$$ in the units place of the minuend as $$5$$, the $$6$$ in the tens place as $$0$$, and the $$7$$ in the hundreds place of the subtrahend as $$2$$. The difference obtained this way is $$1994$$. What should the correct difference be?

2110.content: While doing a subtraction problem, if the minuend's units digit $$4$$ is mistaken for $$8$$ and the tens digit $$8$$ is mistaken for $$4$$, the result is $$125$$. What should the correct result be?

2111.content: A group of ants is moving house. They originally had a pile of food. On the first day, they moved out more than half of the total amount by $$10$$ grams. On the second day, they moved out less than half of what was left by $$12$$ grams. As a result, there are still $$32$$ grams remaining in the nest. How many grams of food did the ants move out in total?

2112.content: The doctor asked Da Kuan to plant a row of trees on one side of the road. At first, Da Kuan planted $$5$$ poplar trees in a row, but then the doctor said, “This planting is wrong. You should plant in the order of $$3$$ willow trees, $$2$$ pine trees, $$1$$ poplar tree, then $$3$$ willow trees, $$2$$ pine trees, $$1$$ poplar tree, and so on.” After that, Da Kuan continued to plant according to this pattern. In the end, Da Kuan planted a total of $$200$$ trees. How many willow trees, pine trees, and poplar trees did Da Kuan plant?

2113.content: October 1, 2018, is a Monday. What day of the week will it be in 27 days?

2114.content: January 1, 2015, is Thursday. What day of the week is February 5, 2017?

2115.content: Doctor continues to distribute mineral water to Class 2 of Year 3. If each group receives $$4$$ boxes, there will be $$17$$ boxes left over; if each group receives $$7$$ boxes, there will be $$10$$ boxes short. How many groups are there in Class 2 of Year 3? How many boxes of mineral water did the doctor prepare?
2115.kc: 盈亏基本类型盈亏问题

2116.content: In the fourth grade class of Max Elementary School, if each person receives $$2$$ band-aids, there will be $$20$$ band-aids left after distribution. If each person receives $$3$$ band-aids, there will be $$10$$ people without band-aids. How many band-aids are there in total for the fourth grade class?
2116.kc: 盈亏基本类型盈亏问题

2117.content: The fifth grade is responsible for transporting fruit. If each person in Class One carries $$7$$ boxes, there are $$10$$ boxes left; if each person in Class Two carries $$8$$ boxes, there are $$2$$ boxes short. It is known that Class One has $$3$$ more people than Class Two. How many boxes of fruit are there in total, and how many people are there in Class One and Class Two?

2118.content: Weier is distributing chocolates. If each person receives $$12$$ pieces, there will be $$14$$ pieces left; if the number of students doubles and each person receives $$7$$ pieces, there will be a shortage of $$8$$ pieces. How many pieces of chocolate does Weier have in total?

2119.content: The florist is preparing to put some roses into vases. If there are $$6$$ roses in each vase, then the remaining roses can fill exactly $$3$$ more vases; if there are $$8$$ roses in each vase, there will be $$3$$ empty vases. How many roses are there in total?
2119.kc: 一元一次方程解应用题

2120.content: Daming and Xiaobai live in the same building, and they have the same speed climbing the stairs, taking the same amount of time to climb each floor. It takes $$180$$ seconds to reach the $$6$$th floor. If they maintain the same speed, and Daming takes $$3$$ minutes to get home, how many floors do they live on?

2121.content: If $$5$$ workers produce $$80$$ parts in $$2$$ hours, how many parts can $$4$$ workers produce in $$7$$ hours at the same rate?

2122.content: Grandma Wang's family raises $$5$$ cows, which produce $$630$$ kilograms of milk in $$7$$ days. Based on this calculation, how many kilograms of milk can $$10$$ cows produce in $$14$$ days?

2123.content: The figure shows a hollow square matrix composed of "funny" expressions. Draw another layer on the outside, which needs funny expressions, and add another layer on the outside, which also needs funny expressions.

2124.content: In a math exam, there are only $$20$$ questions. For each correct answer, you get $$5$$ points, and for each wrong answer or unanswered question, you lose $$3$$ points. Wei Er did not pass this time (the passing score is $$60$$), but she found that if she got one less question wrong, she would just pass. How many questions did she answer correctly?

2125.content: A restaurant has $$39$$ signature dishes. Eddie has eaten $$15$$ of them, and Veer has eaten $$9$$ of them. Furthermore, there are $$4$$ dishes that both have eaten. How many signature dishes have neither of them eaten?

2126.content: In the third grade, there are $$50$$ students going to the cafeteria for lunch. The cafeteria prepared a lot of dishes, with $$26$$ people choosing tomato scrambled eggs and $$21$$ people choosing braised pork. How many people chose neither of these two dishes? How many people chose both dishes?

2127.content: Class 3(1) has $$55$$ students participating in the sports meeting, and each person participates in at least one of the running or jumping rope competitions. It is known that $$36$$ people are participating in the running, and $$38$$ people are participating in the jumping rope. How many people only participate in jumping rope?

2128.content: In Class Three (Class 2), there are $$50$$ students. Some can ride a bicycle, some can swim, and there are $$35$$ students who can ride a bicycle. There are $$15$$ students who can do both. How many students can swim?

2129.content: In the natural numbers from $$1$$ to $$100$$: (1) How many multiples of $$2$$ are there?

2130.content: Among the natural numbers from $$1$$ to $$100$$, how many multiples of $$5$$ are there?

2131.content: How many natural numbers between $$1$$ and $$100$$ are multiples of both $$2$$ and $$5$$?

2132.content: Among the natural numbers from $$1$$ to $$100$$, how many are multiples of $$2$$ or multiples of $$5$$?

2133.content: Among the natural numbers from $$1$$ to $$100$$, how many numbers are not multiples of $$2$$ and also not multiples of $$5$$?

2134.content: In the natural numbers from $$1$$ to $$60$$: How many numbers are both multiples of $$3$$ and multiples of $$5$$?

2135.content: How many multiples of $$5$$ are there among the natural numbers from $$1$$ to $$60$$?

2136.content: Among the natural numbers from $$1$$ to $$60$$: (1) How many multiples of $$3$$ are there?

2137.content: In the natural numbers from $$1$$ to $$60$$, how many are multiples of $$3$$ or multiples of $$5$$?

2138.content: Among the natural numbers from $$1$$ to $$60$$, how many numbers are neither multiples of $$3$$ nor multiples of $$5$$?

2139.content: The school organized a chess competition, divided into three groups: Go, Chinese chess, and international chess. There are $$42$$ people participating in the Go competition, $$55$$ in the Chinese chess competition, and $$33$$ in the international chess competition. There are $$18$$ people who participated in both the Go and Chinese chess competitions, $$10$$ who participated in both the Go and international chess competitions, and $$9$$ who participated in both the Chinese chess and international chess competitions. Among them, $$5$$ people participated in all three chess competitions. How many people participated in the chess competition in total?

2140.content: At a company's annual meeting, there are performances. There are $$40$$ people performing square dance, $$60$$ people performing eye health exercises, and $$99$$ people performing public sleeping. There are $$15$$ people who participate in both square dance and eye health exercises; $$20$$ people who participate in both square dance and public sleeping; and $$24$$ people who participate in both eye health exercises and public sleeping. There are $$6$$ people who participate in all three performances. The people who do not perform are happily eating and drinking offstage. The company has a total of $$1024$$ employees. How many people are happily eating and drinking offstage?

2141.content: In a certain class, students have red, yellow, and blue flags in their hands, with each student having at least one type of flag. It is known that there are $$34$$ students with red flags, $$26$$ students with yellow flags, and $$18$$ students with blue flags. Among them, $$6$$ students have all three types of flags (red, yellow, and blue). There are $$9$$ students with only red and yellow flags, $$4$$ students with only yellow and blue flags, and $$3$$ students with only red and blue flags. How many students are there in total in this class?

2142.content: The Youth Palace is enrolling students for spring calligraphy, art, and music classes. The calligraphy class has enrolled $$29$$ students, the art class has enrolled $$28$$ students, and the music class has enrolled $$27$$ students. Among these students, there are $$13$$ who are enrolled in both calligraphy and art, $$12$$ who are enrolled in both calligraphy and music, $$11$$ who are enrolled in both art and music, and $$5$$ who are enrolled in all three subjects. How many students are there who only participate in one subject?

2143.content: The length of a towel is $$48$$ centimeters, and the width is $$20$$ centimeters. What is the area of this towel in square centimeters?

2144.content: Using parity analysis, is the result of $$34 + 51 + 422 \times 8$$ odd or even?

2145.content: As shown in the figure, there is a white rectangle inside the trapezoid, and the width of the rectangle is $$2$$ meters. What is the area of the gray shaded region in square meters?

2146.content: Xiao Ming's pocket money is exactly enough to buy $$4$$ erasers. If he uses this money to buy pencils, how many pencils can he buy?

2147.content: The following is a statistical chart of the production situation of Factory One and Factory Two of a bicycle. In May, the production volume of Factory One is how many thousand units more than the production volume of Factory Two in March?

2150.content: As shown in the figure, please fill in the appropriate numbers in the blanks in the figure to make the multiplication vertical format valid. The result of the multiplication is given.

2151.content: In the multiplication vertical format as shown in the figure, question_2151-image_0 represents different digits. The question is: what is the three-digit number represented by question_2151-image_1?

2152.content: The figure below shows an incomplete multiplication vertical format, what is the result of this calculation?

2153.content: The figure shows a partial multiplication column, and it is known that one of the digits in it is $$8$$. What is the result of this column?

2154.content: In the multiplication column shown in the figure, some digits are covered by triangular paper pieces. What is the result of the calculation?

2155.content: Complete the multiplication expression in the figure, and the sum of the two factors is what?

2156.content: The following figure shows a partial long division. What is the dividend in this calculation?

2157.content: As shown in the figure, fill in the appropriate number in the blank so that the long division is valid. What is the divisor?

2158.content: In the square $$\square$$, fill in the appropriate digit so that the three-digit number $$\overline{76\square}$$ is divisible by both $$2$$ and $$3$$. What are all possible three-digit numbers (fill in order from smallest to largest)?

2159.content: [School Knowledge] Experimental Primary School has two rectangular playgrounds with equal area. The length of the east playground is $$6$$ meters and the width is $$5$$ meters; the width of the west playground is $$2$$ meters, what is its length?

2160.content: The teacher assigned $$112$$ math problems to be completed in $$8$$ days. Qingqing does $$11$$ problems each day, how many problems are left?

2162.content: [Thinking Expansion] As shown in the figure, in the parallelogram $$ABCD$$, $$AE$$ is perpendicular to $$BC$$ at point $$E$$, and $$AF$$ is perpendicular to $$CD$$ at point $$F$$. Given that $$BC = 12$$ cm, $$AF = 8$$ cm, and $$CD = 6$$ cm, what is the length of segment $$AE$$ in centimeters?
2162.kc: 平行四边形的面积公式

2164.content: In the dessert shop, a Swiss roll costs $$7$$ yuan, and a box contains $$4$$ rolls. How much money is needed to buy $$16$$ boxes of Swiss rolls?

2165.content: 【Thinking Expansion】Points A and B are $$980$$ kilometers apart. A fire truck departs from point A and travels towards point B at a speed of $$40$$ kilometers per hour. Two hours later, a sedan departs from point B towards point A at a speed of $$60$$ kilometers per hour. After how many hours from the time the fire truck departs will the two vehicles meet on the way?

2167.content: In the school knowledge section, if Da Kuan wants to evenly distribute $$279$$ roses among $$9$$ teachers, how many roses will each teacher receive?

2168.content: In a certain barbershop, there is only one barber, but five customers arrived at the same time. Depending on the hairstyles they want, they need $$10$$, $$12$$, $$15$$, $$20$$, and $$24$$ minutes respectively. What is the minimum total time for the five customers' haircut and waiting time if their haircut order is arranged reasonably?

2169.content: There are $$8$$ people each holding a bucket and they go to the faucet to get water at the same time. It takes $$1$$ minute to fill the first person's bucket, $$2$$ minutes to fill the second person's bucket, and so on. (1) When there is only one faucet, how should these $$8$$ people arrange to get water so that their total time spent getting water and waiting is minimized? What is the minimum time in minutes?

2170.content: There are $$8$$ people each holding a bucket to fetch water at the faucet. It takes $$1$$ minute to fill the first person's bucket, $$2$$ minutes to fill the second person's bucket, and so on. (2) When there are two faucets, how should these $$8$$ people fetch water to minimize their total fetching and waiting time? What is the minimum time in minutes?

2171.content: (1) As shown in the figure, there are five residential buildings $$A$$, $$B$$, $$C$$, $$D$$, and $$E$$ on the street, each with the same number of residents. Where should the bus station be located to minimize the total distance for the residents of the five buildings to the station?

2172.content: In the figure, there are five schools on a road from west to east: School A with $$200$$ people, School B with $$300$$ people, School C with $$400$$ people, School D with $$500$$ people, and School E with $$600$$ people. The distance between any two adjacent schools is $$100$$ meters. A bus stop needs to be built in front of one of the schools to minimize the total distance all people have to travel to reach the bus stop. Where should the bus stop be located?

2173.content: On a highway, there is a warehouse every $$10$$ kilometers (as shown in the figure), with a total of $$5$$ warehouses. Warehouse $$A$$ has $$13$$ tons of goods, warehouse $$B$$ has $$23$$ tons of goods, warehouse $$C$$ has $$35$$ tons of goods, warehouse $$D$$ has $$30$$ tons of goods, and warehouse $$E$$ has $$37$$ tons of goods. Now, if we want to concentrate all the goods in one warehouse, and the transportation cost is $$2$$ yuan per ton per kilometer, which warehouse will minimize the total transportation cost, and what is the minimum cost?

2174.content: In a certain village, there are six sugarcane fields, and the yield of each field is shown in the figure below. Now, a sugar factory is to be built, where should the factory be located to minimize the total transportation cost?

2175.content: Beijing and Shenzhen have $$10$$ and $$6$$ identical machines respectively, and they plan to send $$11$$ machines to Wuhan and $$5$$ machines to Xi'an. The shipping cost for each machine is as shown in the table. How can the transportation be arranged to minimize the total shipping cost, and what is the minimum shipping cost in yuan?

2176.content: Beijing and Shanghai have $$10$$ and $$6$$ identical machines respectively, and plan to send $$11$$ machines to Wuhan and $$5$$ machines to Xi'an. The shipping cost for each machine is shown in the table. How can the transportation be arranged to minimize the total shipping cost, and what is the minimum shipping cost in yuan?

2177.content: There is only one barber in the barbershop, but five customers arrived at the same time. Depending on the hairstyles they want, they need $$8$$, $$10$$, $$13$$, $$15$$, and $$20$$ minutes respectively. How should their haircut order be arranged to minimize the total time spent for both haircutting and waiting? What is the minimum time?

2178.content: On a highway, there is a warehouse every $$10$$ kilometers, and there are a total of $$4$$ warehouses. The numbers in the figure represent the weight of goods stored in each warehouse (unit: tons). Now, all the goods need to be concentrated into one warehouse. If it costs $$1$$ yuan to transport $$1$$ ton of goods for $$1$$ kilometer, what is the minimum transportation cost in yuan?

2180.content: In the barbershop, there are two barbers, A and B, and six customers arrive at the same time. Based on the hairstyles they want, they need $$8$$, $$14$$, $$13$$, $$9$$, $$23$$, and $$28$$ minutes respectively. How should they be arranged in order to minimize the total time spent on haircuts and waiting? What is the minimum time in minutes?

2181.content: As shown in the figure, the consecutive natural numbers starting from $$1$$ are arranged according to the following pattern. What is the number in the $$100$$th row and $$6$$th column?
2181.kc: 连续自然数长方形数表之已知位置求数

2182.content:
As shown in the figure, the natural numbers starting from $$7$$ are arranged according to a certain pattern. Please answer:
(1) In which row and column is $$102$$ located?
(2) What is the number in the $$4$$th row and $$25$$th column?
2182.kc: 连续自然数长方形数表之已知数求位置

2183.content: In the figure, there are five households in a community: Zhang, Wang, Li, Sun, and Liu, each with equal distances between them. The government plans to establish a water station in the community to facilitate water access for residents. To minimize the total distance that the five households need to travel to the water station, which household should the water station be located next to?

2184.kc: 整数加减巧算之位值原理

2185.content: Natural numbers starting from $$1$$ are arranged according to the rules shown in the figure, and nine numbers are enclosed in a parallelogram. If the sum of the nine numbers is $$99$$, what is the largest number inside the frame?

2187.content: As shown in the figure, arrange the positive integers according to a rule and connect $$4$$ numbers with a triangle, which cannot be rotated, so that the sum of these four numbers equals $$91$$. What is the largest number among these four numbers?

2188.content: What is the value of the following expression? $$2018+182+1820+8201=$$
2188.kc: 整数加减巧算之位值原理

2189.content: Dan Jun bought $$24$$ eggs, and the number of eggs he bought is $$6$$ more than twice the number of eggs Dan Mei bought. How many eggs did Dan Mei buy?

2190.content: A certain advance team of the People's Liberation Army set off from the camp, moving towards a certain location at a speed of $$4$$ kilometers per hour. After $$7$$ hours, the troops had an urgent matter and sent a messenger on a motorcycle at a speed of $$18$$ kilometers per hour to make contact. How many hours later can the messenger catch up with the advance team?

2191.content: What is the value of $$a \times b \times c + d$$?

2192.content: The age difference between the father and son is $$27$$ years, and the father's age is $$10$$ times the son's age. How old will the child be in five years?

2193.content: The distance between points A and B is $$476$$ kilometers. A passenger train and a freight train start from both places at the same time and meet after $$4$$ hours. The freight train travels at $$52$$ kilometers per hour. How many more kilometers did the passenger train travel than the freight train when they met?

2194.content: If a triangle has all three sides with integer lengths, and two of the sides are $$7$$ and $$10$$, what is the minimum and maximum possible length of the third side?
2194.kc: 三角形三边关系（两边之和大于第三边）

2195.content: An isosceles triangle has two sides measuring $$5$$ cm and $$8$$ cm. What could be the length of the third side in cm, and what could be the perimeter of this triangle in cm? (Please fill in the answers in ascending order.)

2196.content: In an equilateral triangle, all three internal angles are equal. In the triangle shown in Figure $$1$$, what are the values of $$\angle A$$, $$\angle B$$, and $$\angle C$$ in degrees?

2197.content: In an isosceles triangle, if the base angles are $$80°$$, what is the value of the vertex angle in degrees?

2198.content: In an isosceles triangle, if the vertex angle is $$80°$$, what are the base angles?

2199.content: In an isosceles triangle, the two base angles are equal. In triangle $$2$$, which is an isosceles right triangle, what are the measures of $$\angle A$$, $$\angle B$$, and $$\angle C$$ in degrees?

2200.content: According to the requirements, answer the question. In the figure $$1$$, what is the value of $$\angle 1 + \angle 2 + \angle 3 + \angle 4 =$$ degrees?

2201.content: What is the sum of the interior angles of a heptagon in degrees?

2202.content: Using two pieces of wire of the same length, one forms a square and the other forms a rectangle. How does the perimeter of the square compare to the perimeter of the rectangle?

2203.content: What is the perimeter of the polygon in the figure in centimeters?

2205.content: If $$2$$ people can plant $$60$$ trees in $$3$$ hours, how many trees can $$1$$ person plant in $$1$$ hour?

2206.content: Four cats caught $$32$$ mice in four days, how many mice did eight cats catch in eight days?

2207.content: There is a set of numbers $$2$$, $$5$$, $$4$$, $$5$$, and $$A$$. To make their average equal to $$4$$, what is $$A$$?

2208.content: Xiao Ming decided to travel to Hong Kong, Macau, and Taiwan. He wants to visit these three places (without repetition). How many different touring sequences does he have?

2209.content: There are four people, $$A$$, $$B$$, $$C$$, and $$D$$, passing a ball to each other. Starting with the first pass from $$A$$, after $$3$$ passes, the ball returns to $$A$$. How many different passing methods are there?

2210.content: As shown in the figure, an ant starts from a vertex $$A$$ of a regular tetrahedron and must walk along the edges to visit all $$4$$ vertices before returning to vertex $$A$$. How many different paths can the ant take?

2211.content: When a coin is tossed once, the final face up can be either heads or tails. Please use a tree diagram to enumerate the different outcomes when a coin is tossed three times.
2211.kc: 有特殊要求的组数问题

2212.content: Xiao Ming has three types of fruits: apples, bananas, and oranges, and there are plenty of each type. He plans to eat one type of fruit each day for a total of $$4$$ days. It is known that Xiao Ming eats apples on the first day and does not eat the same type of fruit on two consecutive days. How many different ways are there for him to eat?

2213.content: In the figure below, there are $$6$$ points and $$8$$ line segments. A beetle starts from point $$A$$ and must crawl along certain line segments to reach point $$F$$ (it stops moving upon reaching point $$F$$). During its journey, it can only pass through the same point or line segment $$1$$ time. What is the maximum number of different ways the beetle can go?

2214.content: There is a pile of Go pieces, and Wei'er arranges them according to a certain pattern (see the figure below). A total of $$79$$ pieces are arranged, what color is the last piece? ●●●●●●○○○○○●●●●○○○○○……

2215.content: Four students form a circle to play a passing game. Starting from student number $$1$$, if the ball is passed $$46$$ times in a clockwise direction, which student will have the ball?

2216.content: Which of the following statements correctly describes the color of the 36th bead in the sequence of black and white beads arranged according to the following pattern: ●○○○○●○○○○●○○○○$$\cdots \cdots $$?

2217.content: There is a pile of Go pieces. Wei Er arranges them in the pattern of "four black and five white," as shown in the figure. A total of $$77$$ pieces are arranged. How many white pieces are there in total?

2218.content: There is a sequence of numbers arranged in the order of $$1$$, $$3$$, $$5$$, $$7$$, $$9$$, $$1$$, $$3$$, $$5$$, $$7$$, $$9$$, $$1$$, $$3$$, $$5$$, $$7$$, $$9$$, $$\cdots \cdots$$. A total of $$48$$ numbers appear. What is the sum of these $$48$$ numbers?

2219.content: Is it possible to distribute $$35$$ apples among $$3$$ children such that each child receives an even number of apples, even if they do not receive the same amount?

Thus we get: $$130$$, $$67$$, $$132$$, $$68$$... What is the $$2018$$th number in this sequence?

How many white pieces are there in total?

The household camera is very cheap, costing $$4600$$ yuan less than the professional camera. 2980.content: In the library, there are $$150$$ more science books than comic books, and the number of science books is $$30$$ less than $$4$$ times the number of comic books. How many science books are there, and how many comic books are there?

2982.content: In a certain year, October has five Wednesdays and four Thursdays. What day of the week is October 8th of that year?

2984.content: In the Gregorian calendar, each common year has $$365$$ days and each leap year has $$366$$ days. The year $$2012$$ is a leap year, and New Year's Day is on a Sunday. What is the next year when New Year's Day will also be on a Sunday?

2985.content: In a certain month, there are three Saturdays that are even numbers, and the $$18$$th of this month falls on which day of the week?

2986.content: October 1, 2019, is a Tuesday. What day of the week was October 1, 1949?

2987.content: There are $$7$$ stations between locations $$A$$ and $$B$$, and a train continuously travels back and forth between $$A$$ and $$B$$. It departs from $$A$$, travels to the next station each day, and after reaching $$B$$, it returns to station $$7$$ the next day, repeating this process. It is known that the train arrives at station $$4$$ for the $$4$$th time on Saturday. What day of the week will it arrive at station $$5$$ for the $$20$$th time?

2988.content: If April 13th is a Friday, how many days are there until the next 13th that is also a Friday?

The first week of school had no classes on Monday due to the opening ceremony, and classes started on Wednesday. What day of the week is the last math class held?

2990.content: In the year $$2018$$, there were $$53$$ Mondays. What day of the week is October $$1$$, $$2019$$?

2993.content: If the number A plus $$50$$ equals the number B, and if the number B plus $$350$$ equals three times the number A, what are the numbers A and B?

2994.content: Eddie and Dengdeng are practicing running on the playground. After a while, Eddie ran a distance that is more than three times that of Dengdeng by $$80$$ meters. If Dengdeng ran $$500$$ meters less than Eddie, how many meters did Dengdeng and Eddie run together?

2995.content: If New Year's Day in $$2013$$ was a Friday, what day of the week is New Year's Day in $$2017$$?

The other person said, "When my age was the same as your current age, you will be $$61$$ years old." What is the current age of the younger person among the two?

What are the ages of the grandfather, father, and grandson this year?

3042.content: The brother and sister have a total of $$67$$ picture books. The brother has $$13$$ more books than the sister. How many picture books does the brother have? How many picture books does the sister have?

If the two of them work together to move $$450$$ kilograms of wheat from point A to point B in the shortest time possible, and Achilles carries twice as many times as Socrates, how many kilograms of wheat did Achilles carry? How many kilograms of wheat did Socrates carry? (Both Achilles and Socrates carry items with both hands.)

How many books did class 2 donate? How many books did class 3 donate?

If they are divided into $$3$$ piles from least to most, with the number of black pieces in each pile being $$1$$, $$2$$, and $$3$$ times the number of white pieces in the corresponding pile, and the number of white pieces in the second pile being exactly $$2$$ times that of the first pile, while the number of white pieces in the third pile being exactly $$3$$ times that of the first pile, how many white pieces are there in total?

How many poplar trees are there, how many pine trees are there, and how many willow trees are there?

Counting them, it is found that the number of chickens is $$5$$ times the number of ducks, and the number of geese is $$2$$ times the number of chickens plus $$5$$. Given that there are a total of $$277$$ birds, how many geese are there?

For example: $$4$$ ※ $$4 = 3 \times 4 - 2 \times 4 = 4$$; at the same time, $$a$$ △ $$b$$ represents $$3$$ times $$a$$ plus $$2$$ times $$b$$, that is, $$a$$ △ $$b = 3a + 2b$$. For example, $$1$$ △ $$4 = 3 \times 1 + 2 \times 4 = 11$$. (1) Calculate: What is $$5$$ ※ $$4$$?

3170.content: Eddie collects candy wrappers, collecting $$4$$ on the first day, $$7$$ on the second day, $$10$$ on the third day, $$13$$ on the fourth day, and so on. On the last day, he collected $$61$$ wrappers. How many wrappers did he collect in total?

3171.content: In a given sequence where each term is $$6$$ more than the previous term, the $$10$$th term is $$62$$. What is the $$5$$th term?

3172.content: In the World Cup audience area, a certain section of seats is arranged in a trapezoid shape. Starting from the $$2$$nd row, each row has the same number of additional seats compared to the previous row. It is known that the $$5$$th row has $$22$$ seats and the $$8$$th row has $$31$$ seats. What is the number of seats in the $$1$$st row?

3173.content: In an arithmetic sequence, the difference between two adjacent numbers is $$7$$, and the $$12$$th term is $$107$$. What is the $$8$$th term?

3174.content: Zhu Bajie eats watermelon. Starting from the $$2$$nd day, he eats $$2$$ more than the previous day. On the $$20$$th day, he ate $$50$$ watermelons. How many did he eat on the $$1$$st day?

3175.content: Given that the $$3$$rd term and the $$7$$th term of an arithmetic sequence are $$14$$ and $$38$$ respectively, what is the common difference between two adjacent terms?

3176.content: The sugar monk travels to the West to obtain the manufacturing technique for Western candies. He eats candy every day, starting from the second day of his journey, and each day he eats $$5$$ more pieces than the previous day. On the $$30$$th day, he ate $$666$$ pieces of candy. How many pieces of candy did he eat on the $$1$$st day?

3177.content: In the fifth grade class $$2$$, the outer layer of the solid square array has a total of $$56$$ people. How many people are there in total in this square array?

3178.content: In the fifth grade, Class $$2$$ has a solid square formation with a total of $$56$$ people on the outer layer. How many people are there on each side of the outer layer of this square formation?

3179.content: During the arts festival at Max Elementary School, the third-grade students formed a solid square to perform magic, with $$18$$ people on each side of the outer layer. How many people are there on each side of the second layer when counting from the outside in?

3180.content: There is a group of students arranged in a hollow square formation, with $$10$$ people on each side of the outer layer, and a total of $$3$$ layers. How many students are there in total?

3181.content: In a group gymnastics performance, a solid square matrix of $$12$$ rows and $$12$$ columns is changed into a two-layer hollow square matrix. What is the number of people on each side of the innermost layer of the hollow square matrix?

3182.content: A group of students is arranged in a hollow square formation, with a total of $$52$$ people in the outer layer and $$28$$ people in the inner layer. How many students are there in total?

3183.content: In a Chinese chess competition, there are three possible outcomes: winning earns $$2$$ points, a draw earns $$1$$ point each, and losing earns $$0$$ points. Now, five people are playing a round-robin tournament. After all matches are completed, the scores of four people are $$6$$, $$5$$, $$4$$, and $$3$$ points respectively. What is the score of the fifth person?

3184.content: In the fourth grade, there are $$10$$ classes participating in a tug-of-war competition, requiring each pair of classes to compete once. Each class must compete in $$x$$ matches, how many matches will be held in total?

3185.content: In a single round-robin chess tournament with $$6$$ fourth-grade students, if a $$2-1-0$$ scoring system is used, what is the total score of all students after all matches are finished?

3186.content: There are $$26$$ bricks, and two brothers are competing to pick them up. The younger brother goes first and just finishes arranging the bricks when the older brother arrives. The older brother sees that the younger brother has taken too many, so he takes half of what the younger brother picked for himself. The younger brother feels capable and then takes half from the older brother. The older brother thinks he has taken too little, so the younger brother has to give him $$5$$ more bricks. In the end, the older brother has $$2$$ more bricks than the younger brother. How many bricks did the younger brother initially plan to pick?

3187.content: There are some glass beads in the bag. If half of them are taken out each time and then $$1$$ bead is put back, after repeating this process three times, there are $$4$$ beads left in the bag. How many glass beads were originally in the bag?

3188.content: Eddie helps the doctor plant flowers. For every $$2$$ red flowers, $$5$$ yellow flowers need to be planted in between. The first flower that Eddie planted is a red flower, and he planted a total of $$59$$ flowers. How many of them are yellow flowers?

3189.content: It is known that August 5, 2016, is a Friday. What day of the week is September 5, 2016?

3190.content: The little monk wrote a sequence of numbers on the ground: $$7$$, $$1$$, $$2$$, $$7$$, $$1$$, $$2$$, $$7$$, $$1$$, $$2$$, $$\cdots$$. What is the $$32$$nd number he wrote?

3191.content: The store clerk went to the bank to exchange coins, using $$100$$ one-hundred-yuan bills to exchange for a total of $$260$$ bills of twenty-yuan and fifty-yuan notes, with a certain number of twenty-yuan and a certain number of fifty-yuan notes. How many of each type of note are there?

3192.content: Workers transported $$250$$ green porcelain vases, with a transport fee of $$20$$ yuan for each vase delivered intact, and a compensation of $$100$$ yuan for each damaged vase. After delivering this batch of vases, the workers received a total of $$4400$$ yuan. How many vases were damaged?

3193.content: Eddie and Dengdeng are competing in a math problem-solving contest. They agreed that answering a question correctly earns $$10$$ points, while not answering or answering incorrectly deducts $$5$$ points. Each of them solved $$10$$ questions and together they scored a total of $$155$$ points. It is also known that Eddie scored $$15$$ points more than Dengdeng. How many questions did Dengdeng answer correctly?

It is known that these $$63$$ cats will definitely learn at least one of these skills. How many cats have only learned to climb trees?

By planning the route reasonably, what is the shortest total distance he can walk? (Unit: kilometers)

In this way, the three took turns yielding for a while. As a result, when the sun set, the old monk's jar had $$10$$ liters of water, the big monk had no water left, and the small monk's jar contained $$20$$ liters of water. What was the initial amount of water in the big monk's jar?

Finally, C woke up and divided the fish in the basket into $$3$$ equal parts, also finding $$1$$ fish left over. What is the minimum number of fish that the three of them caught?

3851.content: Xiao Bai and Xiao Hua encountered a magical bug that doubles in size every hour. If it can grow to $$20$$ centimeters in $$1$$ day, how many hours does it take for the bug to grow to $$5$$ centimeters?

3852.content: A and B each have some candies, with A having fewer candies than B. Each time, the person with more candies gives the person with fewer candies enough to double their amount; after $$2017$$ such operations, A has $$10$$ candies and B has $$8$$ candies. How many candies did A originally have, and how many candies did B originally have?

3853.content: Three brothers share $$24$$ oranges, and the number each person receives corresponds to their ages three years ago. If the youngest brother first divides half of his oranges equally between the oldest and the second brother, then the second brother divides half of his oranges equally between the youngest and oldest brother, and finally the oldest brother divides half of his oranges equally between the second and youngest brothers, at this point, each person's number of oranges is exactly the same. What are the current ages of the oldest, second, and youngest brothers?

3854.content: The construction team needs to build a path. On the first day, they built more than half of the total length by $$6$$ meters. On the second day, they built less than half of the remaining part by $$20$$ meters. On the third day, they built $$30$$ meters, and at that point, there were still $$14$$ meters left to be built. What is the total length of this path in meters?

3855.content: Four people, $$A$$, $$B$$, $$C$$, and $$D$$, have a total of $$64$$ bricks. $$A$$ takes out some bricks to give to $$B$$ and $$C$$, doubling their number of bricks; then $$B$$ takes out some bricks to give to $$C$$ and $$D$$, doubling their number of bricks; $$C$$ also takes out some bricks to give to $$D$$ and $$A$$, doubling their number of bricks; finally, $$D$$ takes out some bricks to give to $$A$$ and $$B$$, doubling their number of bricks as well. At this point, the number of bricks they each have is equal. How many bricks does $$A$$ have, how many bricks does $$B$$ have, how many bricks does $$C$$ have, and how many bricks does $$D$$ have?

3856.content: A bookshelf is divided into three layers: upper, middle, and lower, with a total of $$384$$ books. If the same number of books is taken from the upper layer and placed into the middle layer, then the same number of books is taken from the middle layer and placed into the lower layer, and finally, the same number of books is taken from the lower layer and placed into the upper layer, resulting in the same number of books in all three layers, how many books were originally in the upper layer, the middle layer, and the lower layer?

3857.content: There are a total of $$26$$ peaches. Xiao Yi took some first, and Xiao Er had to take the rest. Seeing that Xiao Yi took too many, Xiao Er stole half from Xiao Yi; Xiao Yi was unwilling, so he stole half from Xiao Er; Xiao Er was unhappy, and Xiao Yi had to give Xiao Er $$5$$ peaches. At this point, Xiao Er has $$2$$ more peaches than Xiao Yi. How many peaches did Xiao Yi initially take?

3858.content: A person discovered a magical path, and there is a small money box below. When he walks along the magical path, some money from the box flies onto him, doubling the amount of money he has. He is very happy; however, when he walks back from the magical path, the money on him flies back into the box, doubling the amount of money in the box. After walking back and forth $$3$$ times, both the money in the box and the money on him are $$64$$ one-yuan coins. How much money did the person originally have, and how much was in the box?

3859.content: The warehouse originally had a certain number of tons of coal. In the first shipment, half of the original coal was sent out. In the second shipment, $$450$$ tons were brought in. In the third shipment, half of the current coal plus $$50$$ tons was sent out. As a result, twice the remaining coal is $$1200$$ tons. How many tons of coal did the warehouse originally have?

3860.content: $$48$$ kilograms of water is divided into three bottles. The second time, some water from bottle $$B$$ is poured into bottles $$A$$ and $$C$$, also making the amount of water in bottles $$A$$ and $$C$$ double what they had. The third time, some water from bottle $$C$$ is poured into bottles $$A$$ and $$B$$, making the amount of water in bottles $$A$$ and $$B$$ double what they had. After these three transfers, the amounts of water in the three bottles are the same. How many kilograms of water were originally in bottle $$A$$, in bottle $$B$$, and in bottle $$C$$?

3983.content: After the science exhibition event, among the three children $$A$$, $$B$$, and $$C$$, one of them won the special prize. They gathered together to discuss who won the special prize. $$A$$ said, "It should be $$C$$." $$B$$ said, "$$A$$ is wrong." $$C$$ said, "I did not win the special prize." If only one of these three statements is correct, who is the student that won the special prize?

3984.content: Four little friends, Baobao, Xingxing, Qiangqiang, and Lele, were playing soccer in the yard. A loud noise startled Teacher Lu, who was reading. Teacher Lu looked up and found that a window pane had been broken. Teacher Lu came out and asked, "Who broke the glass?" Baobao said, "It was Xingxing who broke it accidentally." Xingxing said, "Lele broke it." Lele said, "Xingxing is lying." Qiangqiang said, "Anyway, it wasn't me who broke it." If only one child is telling the truth, who broke the glass?

3985.content: Four kids, Baby, Star, Qiang Qiang, and Lele, are playing soccer in the yard. A loud noise startled Teacher Lu, who was reading. When Teacher Lu looked up, he found that a window glass had been broken. Teacher Lu came out and asked, "Who broke the glass?" Baby said, "It was Star who broke it accidentally." Star said, "Lele broke it." Lele said, "Star is lying." Qiang Qiang said, "Anyway, I didn't break it." If only one child is telling the truth, who is that child?

3986.content: In a competition, five students $$A$$, $$B$$, $$C$$, $$D$$, and $$E$$ got the top five places (with no ties). The guesses about their rankings are as follows: $$A$$ said, "The second place is $$D$$, the third place is $$B$$." $$B$$ said, "The second place is $$C$$, the fourth place is $$E$$." $$C$$ said, "The first place is $$E$$, the fifth place is $$A$$." $$D$$ said, "The third place is $$C$$, the fourth place is $$A$$." $$E$$ said, "The second place is $$B$$, the fifth place is $$D$$." As a result, each person only guessed half correctly. Who is in second place?

3987.content: Zhao Ming, Qian Hong, and Sun Jie were admitted to Peking University, Tsinghua University, and Beijing Normal University. The classmates made the following guesses about which school each of them was admitted to: Classmate A guessed that Zhao Ming was admitted to Tsinghua University and Sun Jie was admitted to Beijing Normal University. Classmate B guessed that Zhao Ming was admitted to Beijing Normal University and Qian Hong was admitted to Tsinghua University. Classmate C guessed that Zhao Ming was admitted to Peking University and Sun Jie was admitted to Tsinghua University. As a result, each classmate was half correct in their guesses. Which university was Zhao Ming admitted to?

3988.content: Wang Wen, Zhang Bei, and Li Li are respectively skydiving, track and field, and swimming athletes. Now we know: (1) Zhang Bei has never been skydiving; (2) The skydiving athlete has already won two gold medals; (3) Li Li has not yet ranked first, and she was born in the same year as the track and field athlete. Based on the above information, what type of athlete is Li Li?

3990.content: Eddie, Weir, and Da Kuan went to participate in an event. The three of them are wearing hats and clothes in three different colors. 3993.content: In the race among the tiger, fox, and rabbit, after the race, the tiger said, "I am first." The fox said, "I am second." The rabbit said, "I am not first." Only one of them is lying. Who is in second place?
