4079.content: Teacher Niu took $$37$$ students on a spring outing. During a break, Eddie asked, "Teacher Niu, how old are you this year?" Teacher Niu amusingly replied, "If you multiply my age by $$2$$, subtract $$16$$, then divide by $$2$$, and add $$8$$, the result is exactly the total number of participants in today's activity." Kids, do you know how old Teacher Niu is this year?

4080.content: There is a money-loving person who always wants to make his money grow. One day, he met an old man on a bridge. The old man said to him: "If you walk across this bridge and come back, the money you have will double. However, as a reward, you have to give me $$32$$ copper coins for each round trip." The money-loving person calculated that it was quite a good deal and agreed. He walked across the bridge and came back, and indeed, his money doubled. He happily gave the old man $$32$$ copper coins. After completing the third round trip, he gave the last $$32$$ copper coins to the old man, leaving him with not a single coin. How many copper coins did the money-loving person originally have?

4081.content: The doctor spends more than $$300$$ yuan on meals, which is half of his monthly salary, and still has $$5500$$ yuan left. What is the doctor's monthly salary?

4082.content: There was a basket of eggs. During one lunch, half of the eggs minus $$2$$ were eaten, and there are $$12$$ left. How many eggs were originally in the basket?

4083.content: On the journey to the West, three disciples ate peaches from a tree. Zhu Bajie ate more than half of all the peaches plus $$2$$, Sun Wukong ate less than half of the remaining peaches by $$10$$, and Sha Shidi ate $$15$$ peaches. At this time, there were exactly $$9$$ peaches left on the tree. How many peaches were there originally on the tree?

4084.content: A little bird pecks at millet. The first time it ate half of the millet plus $$10$$ grains, the second time it ate half of the remaining millet minus $$12$$ grains, the third time it ate $$14$$ grains, and finally there were $$15$$ grains of millet left. How many grains of millet were there originally?

4085.content: There are a total of $$36$$ rabbits in $$3$$ cages. If $$8$$ rabbits are taken from the $$1$$st cage and put into the $$2$$nd cage, and then $$6$$ rabbits are taken from the $$2$$nd cage and put into the $$3$$rd cage, the number of rabbits in all $$3$$ cages will be the same. How many rabbits were originally in the $$1$$st cage?

4086.content: There are two baskets of apples, A and B, with different quantities. Some apples are taken from basket A and placed in basket B, doubling the number of apples in basket B. Then, some apples are taken from basket B and returned to basket A, also doubling the number of apples in basket A. At this point, both baskets contain $$48$$ apples. How many apples were originally in basket A?

4087.content: There are two piles of chess pieces, A and B, where pile A has more pieces than pile B. The pieces are moved as follows: first, take the same number of pieces from pile A as from pile B and add them to pile B; second, take the same number of pieces from pile B as from the remaining pieces in pile A and add them to pile A; third, take the same number of pieces from pile A as from the remaining pieces in pile B and add them to pile B. After these three moves, both piles A and B have exactly $$16$$ pieces. How many pieces were originally in pile B?

How many hours did both cars take from departure to meeting?

It is known that Person A walks $$50$$ meters per minute, and Person B takes $$18$$ minutes to cover the entire distance. After $$3$$ minutes of starting, they are still $$450$$ meters apart. How many more minutes will it take for Person A and Person B to meet?

4212.content: Professor Su Buqing is a famous mathematician in our country. Once, he encountered a well-known German mathematician on a tram, who posed an interesting problem for him to solve: "Two places are 50 kilometers apart, and two people, A and B, start from the two places at the same time and walk towards each other. A walks 3 kilometers per hour, while B walks 2 kilometers per hour. A has a dog that walks 5 kilometers per hour. The dog starts walking with A, turns around and walks back towards A when it meets B, and walks back towards B when it meets A, until the two people meet. How many kilometers did the dog walk in total?" After a moment of contemplation, Professor Su told the German mathematician the correct answer before getting off the tram. Students, can you also try to find out how many kilometers the dog walked in total?

4283.content: Please answer the following question: Mom bought some lychees and grapes, spending a total of $$63$$ yuan. It is known that the amount spent on lychees is $$2$$ times that of grapes plus $$3$$ yuan. How much money was spent on lychees?

4284.content: Please answer the following questions: Class A and Class B have a total of $$105$$ books. The number of books in Class A is $$15$$ less than $$3$$ times the number of books in Class B. How many books does Class A have, and how many books does Class B have?
4284.kc: 已知两量之间倍数关系和两量之和，求两个量

4285.content: Please answer the following question: This year, the combined ages of mom and Mai Dou is $$45$$ years, and it is known that mom's age is $$3$$ years less than $$5$$ times Mai Dou's age. What is mom's age this year?

4286.content: If there are $$410$$ kilograms of oil in Barrel A and $$190$$ kilograms of oil in Barrel B, how many kilograms of oil need to be poured from Barrel A into Barrel B so that the oil in Barrel A is twice the oil in Barrel B?
4286.kc: 已知两量之间倍数关系和两量之和，求两个量

4287.content: Class A has $$130$$ books, Class B has $$30$$ books. How many books did Class A give to Class B so that the number of books in Class A is $$10$$ more than twice the number of books in Class B?

4288.content: The two schools, A and B, have a total of $$295$$ students. After $$10$$ students transfer from school A and $$15$$ students transfer to school B, the number of students in school A is $$2$$ times that of school B. How many students were originally in school A and how many were in school B?

4289.content: There are a total of $$6$$ straight lines in the figure. If one straight line is removed, resulting in $$7$$ intersection points, which line is removed?

4290.content: (1) The perimeter of a square is $$36$$ centimeters, what is the length of one side in centimeters? (2) The perimeter of a rectangle is $$60$$ centimeters, the length is $$20$$ centimeters, what is the width in centimeters?

4291.content: Fill in the blank as required. (3) What is $$6+10+14+18+22+26+30$$?

4292.content: From the $$1$$st floor to the $$4$$th floor, there are a total of $$48$$ steps. If the number of steps between each two floors is the same, how many steps are there from the $$1$$st floor to the $$6$$th floor?

4293.content: The doctor wants to make a wooden stool. He first sawed a piece of wood into $$4$$ segments, taking $$12$$ minutes. How many minutes does it take to saw another piece of wood into $$8$$ segments? (Assuming the doctor spends the same amount of time for each cut.)

4294.content: The distance between points $$A$$ and $$B$$ is $$4800$$ meters. If person A walks at a speed of $$60$$ meters per minute, how many minutes does it take for person A to walk from point $$A$$ to point $$B$$?

4295.content: Cities $$A$$ and $$B$$ are $$300$$ kilometers apart. A car was originally planned to travel from city $$A$$ to city $$B$$ in $$6$$ hours. What should be the car's average speed in kilometers per hour?

4296.content: A car travels $$150$$ kilometers in $$3$$ hours. At this speed, how many kilometers will it travel in $$10$$ hours?

4297.content: Eddie and Weier set off from the base to visit Max Forest Park. The car's speed was $$80$$ kilometers per hour, and it took $$3$$ hours to reach the destination. If the car's speed increases by $$40$$ kilometers per hour on the way back, how many hours will it take to return to the base after leaving the forest park?

4298.content: Eddie and Vera set off together from the base to go to Max Forest Park. The speed of the car on the way there was $$80$$ kilometers per hour, and it took $$3$$ hours to reach the destination. On the way back, it started to rain lightly, and the car drove for $$3$$ more hours than on the way there before returning to the base. What was the speed of the car on the way back in kilometers per hour?

4299.content: Eddie went to the store and found the pricing of the products as follows. If Eddie wants to buy $$1$$ pencil, how much money does he need to spend?

4300.content: Eddie went to the store to shop and found the pricing of the products as follows. The store has just received a batch of ice pops, and Eddie noticed that there are $$5$$ ice pops in a box, which is too many. He plans to buy only $$2$$ ice pops. How much does he need to pay?

4301.content: Daming and Xiaobai live in the same building, and they climb the stairs at the same speed, taking the same amount of time to climb each floor. It takes them $$180$$ seconds to reach the $$6$$th floor. If they maintain the same speed, how many seconds does Xiaobai need to go from the $$1$$st floor to his home on the $$10$$th floor?

4302.content: Daming and Xiaobai live in the same building, and they have the same speed when climbing stairs, taking the same amount of time to climb each floor. It takes $$180$$ seconds to reach the $$6$$th floor. If they maintain the same speed, Daming takes $$3$$ minutes to get home. What floor do they live on?

4303.content: Doctor made $$3$$ robots to produce parts. They can produce $$60$$ parts in $$4$$ hours. At this rate, how many parts can $$5$$ robots produce in $$1$$ hour?

4304.content: Doctor manufactured $$3$$ robots to produce parts, and they can produce $$60$$ parts in $$4$$ hours. At this rate, how many parts can $$5$$ robots produce in $$3$$ hours?

4305.content: Grandma Wang's house raises $$5$$ cows, which produce $$630$$ kilograms of milk in $$7$$ days. Based on this calculation, how many kilograms of milk can $$8$$ cows produce in $$15$$ days?

4306.content: Grandma Wang has $$5$$ cows, and they produce $$630$$ kilograms of milk in $$7$$ days. Based on this calculation, how many kilograms of milk can $$10$$ cows produce in $$14$$ days?

4307.content: Little monkeys in Flower Fruit Mountain are eating peaches. If $$6$$ little monkeys eat $$180$$ peaches in $$3$$ days, how many peaches can $$5$$ little monkeys eat in $$5$$ days?

4308.content: If $$6$$ little monkeys eat $$180$$ peaches in $$3$$ days, how many days would it take for $$10$$ little monkeys to eat $$200$$ peaches?

4311.content: According to the statistics table, answer the following questions. In the first half of the year, what is the average monthly production of Factory A in units, and what is the average monthly production of Factory B in units?

4312.content: In a certain exam, there were a total of $$20$$ questions. Each correct answer earns $$5$$ points, while unanswered or incorrect answers incur a deduction of $$2$$ points. Eddie scored $$79$$ points; how many questions did he answer correctly?

4313.content: In a cage with chickens and rabbits, the number of rabbits is $$3$$ times the number of chickens, and there are a total of $$140$$ legs. How many chickens are there, and how many rabbits are there?

4314.content: If a book has a total of $$20$$ pages, how many digits were used for the page numbers from $$1$$ to $$20$$?

4315.content: If a book has a total of $$150$$ pages, how many digits are used in the page numbers from $$1$$ to $$150$$?

4316.content: A book is encoded using a total of $$225$$ digits; how many pages does this book have?

4317.content: A book has a total of $$400$$ pages. How many times is the digit “$$3$$” used in the page numbers from $$1$$ to $$400$$?

4318.content: A book has a total of $$360$$ pages. How many times is the digit "$$2$$" used in the page numbers from $$1$$ to $$360$$?

4319.content: There are $$63$$ cats participating in the cat training camp. After a period of training, $$15$$ learned to catch fish, $$12$$ learned to catch mice, $$9$$ learned to catch both mice and fish, $$6$$ learned to climb trees as well as catch mice, $$5$$ learned to climb trees and catch fish, and $$2$$ can do all three activities. Knowing that these $$63$$ cats will definitely master at least one of these skills, how many cats only learned to climb trees?

4320.content: In a certain class, every student signed up for a competition. Among them, there are $$12$$ people participating in the Hope Cup, $$15$$ people in the Qizhi Cup, and $$21$$ people in the Xueersi Cup. There are $$7$$ people participating in both the Hope Cup and the Qizhi Cup, $$6$$ people in both the Hope Cup and the Xueersi Cup, and $$9$$ people in both the Xueersi Cup and the Qizhi Cup. There are $$2$$ people who signed up for all three cups. How many students are there in total in this class?

4321.content: In a certain class, there are $$63$$ students holding small flags of red, yellow, and blue colors, with each student holding at least one kind of flag. It is known that there are $$34$$ students with red flags, $$26$$ students with yellow flags, and $$18$$ students with blue flags. Among them, there are $$9$$ students with both red and yellow flags, $$4$$ students with both yellow and blue flags, and $$3$$ students with both red and blue flags. How many students in this class have red, yellow, and blue flags?

4322.content: Eddie and Veer set off from school to the Shanghai Natural History Museum. Eddie runs $$400$$ meters first, and then Veer starts running along the same route to catch up with Eddie. Veer runs at an average speed of $$160$$ meters per minute, and after $$4$$ minutes, she catches up with Eddie on the way. What is Eddie's average speed in meters per minute?

4323.content: Vera and Eddie start walking toward each other from two locations at the same time. Vera walks $$50$$ meters per minute, and Eddie walks $$60$$ meters per minute. They meet at a point $$50$$ meters away from the midpoint between the two locations. What is the total distance between the two locations in meters?

4324.content: Weir ran for $$4$$ minutes at a speed of $$180$$ meters per minute. Eddie, who is chasing with a dog, has a speed of $$200$$ meters per minute, and the dog's speed is $$300$$ meters per minute. The dog runs back and forth between the two. When Eddie catches up to Weir, how many meters did the dog run?

4325.content: Find the value represented by the symbol below. $$36 - 2 \times \bullet = 48 - 4 \times \bullet$$. What is $$\bullet$$?

4326.content: What is the total number of shortest routes from the nursing home to the school if Eddie and Weier do not want to pass through the city center due to traffic?

4327.content: In the table below, please read out the 9 characters "We learn fun math." You are required to choose the 9 characters in a continuous manner (i.e., adjacent characters in the table must also be next to each other either horizontally or vertically). How many complete ways are there to read "We learn fun math"?

4328.content: Solve the equation: $$2x + 3x + 2 = 30 + 6x - 8x$$. What is the value of $$x$$?

4329.content: Solve the equation: $$13x + 8 = 14x + 2$$. What is the value of $$x$$?

4332.content: Solve the equation: $$28 = 3x + 12 - x$$, what is $$x$$?

4333.content: Xiao Tong has a way to get to school every day by passing through the youth palace to the museum, as shown in the figure. How many ways does Xiao Tong have to go to school?

4334.content: How many three-digit numbers can be formed using the digits $$1$$, $$3$$, $$4$$, $$6$$, and $$8$$ without repeating any digits?

4335.content: The postman delivers mail, and there are $$3$$ roads from village $$A$$ to village $$B$$ and $$5$$ roads from village $$B$$ to village $$C$$. How many different ways can the postman travel from village $$A$$ to village $$C$$ via village $$B$$?

4336.content: Eddie passes the basketball to his classmates. If each person gets $$3$$ balls, there are $$8$$ balls left. If each person gets $$2$$ balls, there is $$1$$ ball left. How many classmates does Eddie pass the balls to, and how many basketballs are there in total?

4337.content: Third-grade students walk from school to visit a factory at a speed of $$75$$ meters per minute. After $$24$$ minutes, due to an important matter, Zhang Bing is dispatched to ride a bicycle from school to catch up. If he rides at a speed of $$225$$ meters per minute, after how many minutes can he catch up with the students?

4338.content: The two locations are $$900$$ kilometers apart. A needs to walk for $$15$$ days, while B needs to walk for $$12$$ days. Now, A sets off first for $$2$$ days, and then B goes to catch up with A. When B catches up with A, how many kilometers has B traveled?

4339.content: Xiao Qiang walks $$70$$ meters per minute, and Xiao Ji walks $$60$$ meters per minute. If they both start at the same time and walk in the same direction, after $$3$$ minutes, Xiao Qiang catches up to Xiao Ji. What was the initial distance between them in meters?

4340.content: Person A and Person B set off from point A to point B at the same time. Person A travels at $$60$$ meters per minute, while Person B travels at $$90$$ meters per minute. After reaching point B, Person B immediately returns and meets Person A. At the time of their meeting, Person A is $$180$$ meters away from point B. How many minutes did it take from departure to meeting?
4340.kc: 同时同地出发折返相遇

4341.content: Eddie and Vera are at points A and B, which are $$100$$ meters apart. If they walk towards each other, they will meet in $$20$$ seconds; if they walk in the same direction with Vera in front, Eddie will catch up with Vera in $$100$$ seconds. What are the speeds of Eddie and Vera in meters per second?

4342.content: Elder brother and younger brother go to the library together from home. The elder brother walks $$60$$ meters per minute, and the younger brother walks $$45$$ meters per minute. One day, the younger brother starts walking first for $$8$$ minutes, and then the elder brother sets off from home. When the elder brother catches up to the younger brother, he has exactly walked half of the total distance. What is the total distance from home to the library in meters?

4343.content: $$\frac{5}{9}=\frac{45}{(\ \ \ \ )}=\frac{(\ \ \ \ )}{99}$$, what should be filled in the brackets above in order?

4344.content: Father, mother, grandpa, and Qiangqiang are $$146$$ years old in total this year. How many years later will their ages sum to $$170$$ years?

4345.content: This year, Xin Xin is $$6$$ years older than Peng Peng. Three years ago, their ages added up to $$48$$ years. How old is Xin Xin this year, and how old is Peng Peng?
4345.kc: 年龄问题基本关系和差问题

4348.content: Class 2 of Grade 3 formed a solid square formation, with $$36$$ people in the outer layer. (1) Circle around and divide the outer layer of the square formation into four equal parts. (2) How many people are there on each side of the outer layer?

4353.content: Eddie has $$5$$ reward cards, and Wei Er has $$10$$ reward cards. After Wei Er gives Eddie $$8$$ reward cards, how many reward cards do they have in total?

4355.content: A cleaning vehicle sweeps the streets, each section of the street is $$1$$ kilometer long. The cleaning vehicle starts from point $$A$$, travels through all the streets, and then returns to $$A$$. What is the shortest distance traveled in kilometers?

4356.content: As shown in the figure, there is an ant at each vertex $$A$$ and $$B$$ of the hexahedron, and they are racing to see who can crawl along all the edges and reach the endpoint $$C$$ first. If their crawling speeds are the same, which ant will win?

4357.content: Where can the entrances and exits be set in the road plan of the park to allow visitors to walk through each road without repetition?

4358.content: The street where the mailman delivers letters is shown in the figure, with each small segment of the street being $$1$$ kilometer long. If the mailman starts from the post office and must walk through all the streets, what is the minimum distance the mailman needs to walk in kilometers?

4359.content: The following is a floor plan of an exhibition hall. Can a visitor pass through each door without repeating? If so, please provide a solution; if not, please explain the reason. (The starting point does not have to be outside the exhibition hall.)

4360.content: The traffic system of a certain city consists of several intersections (the intersection points of the line segments in the figure) and streets (the line segments in the figure). Each street connects two intersections. All streets are two-way, and each street has a length value (marked on the corresponding line segment in the figure). A mailman delivers newspapers and letters, starting from the post office, passing through every street he is responsible for, and finally returning to the post office (each street can be passed through more than once). What is the shortest total length he can walk? (Unit: meters)

4361.content: The diagram below shows a street map of a block in a certain city, where a mail carrier needs to deliver letters. The numbers on the map represent the lengths of each street in kilometers. Starting from the post office, he needs to traverse all the streets and finally return to the post office. Can you design the most reasonable delivery route for him that allows him to pass every street while minimizing the total distance traveled? What is the shortest route in kilometers?

4362.content: In Figure ①, each small square has a side length of $$8$$ meters. From point $$A$$ to point $$B$$, if you are not allowed to travel the same path (you can pass through the same point but cannot go through the same line segment), what is the maximum distance you can travel in meters?

4363.content: As shown in the figure, there are two islands at the confluence of two rivers, and there are seven bridges connecting these two islands and the riverbanks. The question is: Can a walker traverse all seven bridges without repeating any?

4364.content: In the figure below, how many strokes are needed to draw each shape at a minimum? Figure 1: ; Figure 2: ; Figure 3: ; Figure 4: .

4365.content: The figure shows a schematic diagram of a museum. Can visitors find a route to tour the museum where each door is passed through exactly once?

4366.content: The diagram shows the floor plan of a restaurant with five small halls. There are doors connecting adjacent halls, and there is an entrance. Can you enter from the entrance and pass through all the doors without repeating any? If yes, please indicate the route. If no, which door should be closed to make it possible?

4367.content: In the cafeteria, there are $$94$$ kilograms of flour and $$138$$ kilograms of rice. If $$9$$ kilograms of both flour and rice are used each day, after how many days will the remaining rice be three times the amount of flour?
4367.kc: 已知两量之间倍数关系和两量之差，求两个量

4368.content: A school plans to plant a total of $$200$$ poplar, willow, and locust trees. After planting $$10$$ willow trees, $$5$$ locust trees are temporarily delivered. At this point, the remaining number of the three types of trees is exactly equal. How many of each type of tree was originally planned to be planted?

4369.content: A, B, and C have a total of $$109$$ yuan. When the amount of money A has is divided by the amount of money B has, and the amount of money B has is divided by the amount of money C has, the quotient is $$2$$ and the remainder is $$1$$. How much money does A have, how much money does B have, and how much money does C have?

4370.content: A certain school plans to plant a total of $$240$$ trees, including poplar trees, willow trees, and locust trees. It is known that the number of poplar trees is $$3$$ times that of willow trees plus $$8$$, and the number of locust trees is $$2$$ times that of poplar trees minus $$14$$. How many poplar trees, willow trees, and locust trees were originally planned to be planted?

4371.content: The school's fruit shop received a total of $$40$$ kilograms of apples and pears, with apples being $$2$$ bags more than pears. Each bag of apples and pears weighs $$5$$ kilograms. How many bags of apples and how many bags of pears did the fruit shop receive?

4372.content: If warehouse A gives warehouse B $$300$$ kilograms of rice, then they will have the same amount of rice; if both warehouses A and B sell $$200$$ kilograms of rice, then the amount of rice left in warehouse A is $$3$$ times the amount left in warehouse B. How many kilograms of rice did they originally have in total?

4373.content: Reservoir A has $$4.3$$ billion cubic meters of water, and Reservoir B has $$3.7$$ billion cubic meters of water. How many billion cubic meters of water need to be transferred from Reservoir A to Reservoir B so that the water in Reservoir B is twice that of Reservoir A?

4374.content: There are two layers of bookshelves with a total of $$216$$ books. After taking away $$42$$ books from the first layer, the number of books on the second layer is twice that of the first layer plus $$6$$ more. How many books are there in the second layer?

4375.content: How many candies does Jia Jia have, and how many does Jian Jian have?

4376.content: Xiao Yue and Dong Dong are playing a game. For each round played, the loser must give the winner $$1$$ game piece. At the beginning, Xiao Yue has $$18$$ game pieces, and Dong Dong has $$22$$. After playing several rounds, Dong Dong has not won any rounds, and Xiao Yue has more game pieces than Dong Dong by $$10$$. How many rounds did they play?

4377.content: The $$5$$ boxes of apples and $$5$$ boxes of grapes weigh a total of $$75$$ kilograms, and each box of apples weighs $$2$$ times the weight of each box of grapes. How much does each box of apples weigh in kilograms, and how much does each box of grapes weigh in kilograms?

4378.content: In a certain school, the third grade has $$154$$ fewer students than the fourth grade. If $$46$$ students transfer from the fourth grade to the third grade, then the number of students in the fourth grade becomes $$3$$ times that of the third grade. How many students are there in the third grade and how many in the fourth grade?

4379.content: There are several black and white pieces, totaling $$140$$ pieces, divided into $$5$$ piles. The number of black pieces in each pile is $$1$$, $$2$$, $$3$$, $$4$$, and $$5$$ times the number of white pieces, respectively. The number of white pieces in the second pile is $$2$$ times that of the first pile, the number in the third pile is $$3$$ times that of the first pile, the number in the fourth pile is $$4$$ times that of the first pile, and the number in the fifth pile is $$5$$ times that of the first pile. How many white pieces are there in total?

4380.content: In the Asian Cup final, the number of Chinese journalists is $$3$$ times the number of foreign journalists. After the match, $$180$$ Chinese journalists left, and $$40$$ foreign journalists left. The remaining number of Chinese and foreign journalists is equal. How many Chinese journalists were there originally, and how many foreign journalists were there?

4381.content: The weights of the two baskets of apples, A and B, are equal. Now, if $$12$$ kilograms of apples are taken from basket A and placed into basket B, the weight of apples in basket B will be $$2$$ kilograms less than three times the weight of apples in basket A. What was the original weight of the apples in the two baskets?

4382.content: A and B have a total of $$58$$ comic books. After A gives B $$5$$ books, B has $$4$$ books fewer than A. How many comic books did A originally have?

4383.content: Pool A has $$260$$ cubic meters of water, Pool B has $$120$$ cubic meters of water. If the water from Pool A flows into Pool B at a rate of $$4$$ cubic meters per minute, after how many minutes will the water in Pool B be $$4$$ times that in Pool A?

4384.content: When my brother turns $$30$$ years old, the younger brother said: "When I grow to my brother's current age, the sum of my brother's age at that time and my current age will equal dad's age this year." What is dad's age this year?

4385.content: The older brother said to the younger brother: "When I am the same age as you, you will be $$2$$ years old." The younger brother said to the older brother: "When I am the same age as you, you will already be $$17$$ years old." How old is the older brother this year, and how old is the younger brother this year?

4386.content: In a family of three, two years ago, the sum of their ages was $$66$$ years. The mother and father are the same age. This year, the mother's age is $$4$$ times the child's age. What is the father's age this year?

4387.content: Pea is $$10$$ years old this year, Potato is $$23$$ years old this year. When the sum of their ages is $$63$$ years, how old is Pea and how old is Potato?
4387.kc: 年龄问题基本关系和差问题

4388.content: This year, Xiao Ming is $$15$$ years old, and his father is $$45$$ years old. How old was Xiao Ming when his father's age was $$4$$ times Xiao Ming's age?

4389.content: The old tree, the big tree, and the small tree are chatting. The old tree says: "For every day the small tree grows, the big tree grows for that many weeks; for every month the small tree grows, I grow for that many years. Together we are a total of $$1000$$ years old." How old is the old tree this year, how old is the big tree this year, and how old is the small tree this year?

4390.content: The older brother said to the younger brother: "When you grow up to my age, I will have just obtained my doctorate; when I was your age, you had just started kindergarten." It is known that the sum of the current ages of the older brother and the younger brother is $$32$$ years, and the age at which the older brother obtained his doctorate is $$7$$ times the age at which the younger brother started kindergarten. What is the age at which the older brother obtained his doctorate?

4391.content: The sum of the ages of the father and his two sons is $$84$$ years. In $$12$$ years, the father's age will be equal to the sum of the ages of the two sons. How old is the father now?

4392.content: Xiao Ming is $$8$$ years old this year, and his mother is $$44$$ years old. When Xiao Ming was how many years old, was his mother's age exactly $$4$$ times Xiao Ming's age?

4393.content: The sum of the ages of A, B, and C is $$145$$ years. When C's age is half of B's age, A is $$25$$ years old. What is C's current age?

4394.content: In a family of three, the father is $$3$$ years older than the mother. The current total age of the family is $$80$$ years, and ten years ago, the total age was $$51$$ years. How old is the father this year?
4394.kc: 年龄问题基本关系和差问题

4395.content: Twelve years ago, the father's age was eleven times the daughter's age; this year, the father's age is three times the daughter's age. What will be the father's age in a few years when it is twice the daughter's age?

4396.content: This year, the brother's age is $$3$$ times that of the younger brother. In $$24$$ years, the brother's age will be $$16$$ years less than twice the younger brother's age. What is the brother's age this year, and what is the younger brother's age this year?

4397.content: This year is $$2020$$, the sum of the parents' ages is $$72$$ years, and the sum of the siblings' ages is $$18$$ years. By the year $$2022$$, the father's age will be $$4$$ times the younger brother's age, and the mother's age will be $$3$$ times the older sister's age. When the father's age is $$2$$ times the older sister's age, what year will it be?

4398.content: When A is the same size as B, A's age is $$3$$ times that of B; when B reaches A's current age, A is $$2$$ times that of B minus $$15$$ years. What is A's current age, and what is B's current age?

4399.content: In the figure, any two adjacent sides of the polygon are perpendicular to each other. What is the perimeter of the polygon shown in the figure (unit: centimeters)?

4400.content: There is a rectangular piece of paper that is $$12$$ cm long and $$8$$ cm wide. If you cut it $$3$$ times (as shown in the figure), what is the total perimeter of these $$6$$ rectangles in centimeters?

4401.content: As shown in the figure, a large rectangle is divided into $$9$$ smaller rectangles. The perimeters of some of the smaller rectangles are marked on the figure, what is the perimeter of the shaded smaller rectangle?

4404.content: In the figure, the shaded area is a square. What is the perimeter of the largest rectangle in the figure (unit: decimeters)?

4405.content: Four identical rectangles, each with a width of $$2$$ centimeters, are combined to form a larger rectangle. What is the perimeter of the larger rectangle in centimeters?

4406.content: Eight identical rectangles with a width of $$2$$ centimeters form a larger rectangle. What is the perimeter of the larger rectangle in centimeters?

4407.content: A rectangular cardboard measuring $$8$$ decimeters in length and $$4$$ decimeters in width is combined with two square cardboards each with a side length of $$4$$ decimeters to form a square. What is the perimeter of the formed square in decimeters?

4408.content: A square has a perimeter of $$20$$ centimeters. If a square with a perimeter of $$8$$ centimeters is cut from one side, what is the perimeter of the remaining shape? List all possible results from smallest to largest: centimeters, centimeters.

4409.content: The figure below is a side view of a machine part. Each of the shortest line segments in the figure is $$5$$ centimeters long, and the height of this part is $$30$$ centimeters. What is the perimeter of the side of this part in centimeters?
4409.kc: 楼梯型不规则图形求周长

4410.content: As shown in the figure, the lengths of two adjacent sides of a square are each increased by $$3$$ centimeters, and the area increases by $$81$$ square centimeters. What is the perimeter of the original square in centimeters?

4411.content: As shown in the figure, the lengths of two adjacent sides of a square each decreased by $$2$$ centimeters, and the area decreased by $$36$$ square centimeters. What is the area of the original square in square centimeters?
4411.kc: 边长改变后长方形面积的计算

4412.content:
(1) The area of a rectangle is $$336$$ square meters, the width is $$14$$ meters, what is the length in meters?  
(2) The area of a square is $$144$$ square meters, what is the length of a side in meters?
4412.kc: 长方形和正方形面积公式

4413.content: In the figure, $$9$$ small rectangles are combined to form a large rectangle, among which the rectangle numbered $$1$$ is also a square. The areas of the rectangles numbered $$1$$, $$2$$, $$3$$, $$4$$, and $$5$$ are $$4$$ square centimeters, $$8$$ square centimeters, $$12$$ square centimeters, $$16$$ square centimeters, and $$20$$ square centimeters, respectively. What is the area of the rectangle numbered $$6$$ in square centimeters?
4413.kc: 公式法求长方形正方形面积

4414.content: There is a square swimming pool surrounded by a walkway that is $$1$$ meter wide. The area of the walkway is $$24$$ square meters. What is the area of the swimming pool (the blank part) in square meters?
4414.kc: 长方形和正方形面积公式

4415.content: There is a vegetable field that is $$12$$ meters long and $$5$$ meters wide, with several paths that are $$1$$ meter wide left in the middle. What is the area of the vegetable field in square meters?

4416.content: What is the area of the shape in the figure in square meters?
4416.kc: 长方形和正方形面积公式

4417.content: The length and width of a rectangle are each increased by $$2$$ centimeters, and the area increases by $$40$$ square centimeters. What is the perimeter of the original rectangle in centimeters?

4418.content: A rectangular piece of paper is $$7$$ centimeters long and $$5$$ centimeters wide. If the top right corner is folded down and then the bottom left corner is folded up, as shown in the figure, what is the area of the uncovered shaded part in square centimeters?

4419.content: In a square, there is a smaller square whose four vertices touch the larger square (as shown in the figure). If the difference in the perimeters of the two squares is $$16$$ centimeters and the difference in their areas is $$96$$ square centimeters, what is the area of the smaller square in square centimeters?
4419.kc: 长方形和正方形面积公式

4420.content: The number in the figure represents the length of the corresponding line segments (unit: centimeters), what is the area of the figure in square centimeters?

4421.content: Each edge in the figure is perpendicular to its adjacent edges, and the length of each edge is $$2$$ centimeters. What is the area of this shape in square centimeters?

4422.content: As shown in the figure, there are four overlapping squares with side lengths of $$5$$, $$7$$, $$9$$, and $$11$$. What is the difference in area between the gray area and the black area?

4423.content: Four small rectangles, each with a length of $$6$$ cm and a width of $$2$$ cm, form a large rectangle. Draw all the arrangements and find the area of the large rectangle in square centimeters.

4424.content: The figure below is a square formed by squares A and D, and rectangles B and C. Squares A and D each have a side length measured in whole centimeters, and the sum of the areas of squares A and D is $$100$$ square centimeters. What is the sum of the areas of rectangles B and C in square centimeters?
4424.kc: 长方形和正方形面积公式

4425.content: As shown in the figure, several paths are set up on a square lawn with a side length of $$24$$ meters. The width of the paths is indicated on the diagram (unit: meters), what is the actual area of the lawn in square meters?

4426.content: If mom buys a basket of oranges to share with the whole family, and if two people each get $$4$$ oranges, the others each get $$2$$ oranges, then there are $$6$$ oranges left over; if one person gets $$6$$ oranges and the others each get $$4$$ oranges, then there is a shortage of $$12$$ oranges. How many oranges did mom buy, and how many people are in the family?

4427.content: There are $$5$$ different roads from point A to point B. On the first day, Eddie goes from point A to point B and then returns to point A; on the second day, he goes from point A to point B again and then returns to point A. If Eddie does not take the same road he used to go from point A to point B when returning to point A, how many different routes does Eddie have for his round trips between points A and B over these two days?

4428.content: The snack shop needs to make $$3$$ pancakes. Each pancake must be cooked on both sides for $$1$$ minute. Now there are $$2$$ stoves, and each stove can only cook one side of a pancake at a time. What is the minimum time required to cook all the pancakes?

4429.content: Beijing and Luoyang have $$9$$ and $$12$$ identical machines, respectively, and plan to send $$13$$ machines to Hangzhou and $$8$$ machines to Xi'an. According to the table, what is the minimum total shipping cost in yuan?

4430.content: On a road, there is a warehouse every $$10$$ kilometers, with a total of $$8$$ warehouses. The numbers in the figure represent the weight of the goods stored in each warehouse (unit: tons), among which $$C$$ and $$G$$ are empty warehouses. Now, all the goods need to be concentrated in one warehouse. If it costs $$1$$ yuan to transport $$1$$ ton of goods for $$1$$ kilometer, what is the minimum transportation cost in yuan?

4431.content: Beijing and Shanghai have $$10$$ and $$6$$ identical machines respectively, and they plan to send $$5$$ machines to Wuhan and $$11$$ machines to Xi'an. The shipping cost for each machine is shown in the table. How can the machines be transported to minimize the total shipping cost? What is the minimum total shipping cost in yuan?

4432.content: In a workshop, there are $$3$$ milling machines, $$3$$ lathes, and $$1$$ automatic machine, producing a product made up of two parts, A and B. Each milling machine produces $$10$$ part A or $$20$$ part B per day; each lathe produces $$20$$ part A or $$30$$ part B per day; and each automatic machine produces $$30$$ part A or $$80$$ part B per day. How should the production tasks of these machines be arranged to obtain the maximum number of complete products? What is the maximum number of complete products that can be produced in one day?

4433.content: In a small grocery store, there is a salesperson selling goods, and at the same time, five customers $$A$$, $$B$$, $$C$$, $$D$$, and $$E$$ arrive. Customer $$A$$ takes $$2$$ minutes to buy candy; customer $$B$$ takes $$6$$ minutes to buy rice; customer $$C$$ takes $$4$$ minutes to buy cigarettes and beer; customer $$D$$ takes $$3$$ minutes to buy fruit; customer $$E$$ takes $$5$$ minutes to buy vegetables. How should the salesperson arrange the order of the five people so that the total waiting time for the five customers is minimized? What is this minimum time in minutes? (Only the waiting time for each person is counted, not the time spent buying things.)

4434.content: Workers A, B, and C plan to produce $$7$$ parts on $$3$$ machines with the same efficiency. The times to produce each part are $$4$$, $$5$$, $$6$$, $$6$$, $$8$$, $$9$$, and $$9$$ minutes. If all three start working at the same time, what is the minimum time in minutes required to produce the $$7$$ parts?

4435.content:
Grain storage A and B need to transport rice to supermarkets A and B. It is known that storage A can supply $$100$$ tons of rice, and storage B can supply $$80$$ tons. Supermarket A requires $$70$$ tons of rice, and supermarket B requires $$110$$ tons of rice. The distances and transportation costs are as follows: 

|         | Distance (km) | Cost (yuan/ton·km) |
|---------|----------------|---------------------|
|         |               | Storage A | Storage B |
| Supermarket A | $$20$$            | $$12$$         | $$12$$         |
| Supermarket B | $$25$$            | $$10$$         | $$8$$          |

How many tons of rice should each storage send to supermarkets A and B to minimize the total transportation cost? What is the total transportation cost in yuan?

4436.content: Where should the wheat field be located for the best yield, given there are six plots of wheat with the yields shown in the figure?

4437.content: There are $$89$$ children, and the teacher wants to give each one a red pen and a blue pen. In the store, each type of pen comes in packs of $$5$$ or $$3$$, and they cannot be sold individually. A pack of $$5$$ red pens costs $$59$$ yuan, and a pack of blue pens costs $$67$$ yuan; a pack of $$3$$ red pens costs $$38$$ yuan, and a pack of blue pens costs $$47$$ yuan. What is the minimum amount of money the teacher has to spend to buy the pens?

4438.content: In the pocket, there are some balls of the same size and shape: there are $$8$$ red balls, $$12$$ yellow balls, and $$15$$ white balls. How many balls must be taken to ensure that there are at least $$3$$ balls of one color and at least $$7$$ balls of another color?

4439.content: The warehouse originally had a certain number of tons of coal. In the first transport, half of the original coal was taken out. In the second transport, $$450$$ tons were brought in. In the third transport, half of the current coal was taken out again, plus $$50$$ tons. As a result, twice the remaining coal is $$1200$$ tons. How many tons of coal did the warehouse originally have?

4440.content: A, B, C, and D have a total of $$64$$ bricks. A gives some bricks to B and C, so that their number of bricks doubles; then B gives some bricks to C and D, causing their number of bricks to double; C also gives some bricks to D and A, making their number of bricks double; finally, D gives some bricks to A and B, so that their number of bricks also doubles, and at this point, the number of bricks they each have is equal. How many bricks did A originally have, how many bricks did B originally have, how many bricks did C originally have, and how many bricks did D originally have?

4441.content: Teacher Niu took $$37$$ students on a spring outing. During the break, Eddie asked, “Teacher Niu, how old are you this year?” Teacher Niu amusingly replied, “If you multiply my age by $$2$$, subtract $$16$$, then divide by $$2$$, and add $$8$$, the result is exactly the total number of people participating in today’s activity.” How old is Teacher Niu this year?

4442.content: Three people, A, B, and C, went fishing together. They put the fish they caught into a basket and then lay down to rest, eventually falling asleep. A woke up first and divided the fish in the basket into $$3$$ equal parts, finding that there was $$1$$ fish left over. He threw the extra fish back into the river and took one part of the fish home. B then woke up and divided the remaining fish in the basket into $$3$$ equal parts, also finding $$1$$ fish left over. He threw that extra fish back into the river and took one part of the fish home. Finally, C woke up and divided the fish in the basket into $$3$$ equal parts, also finding $$1$$ fish left over. What is the minimum number of fish that the three of them caught?

4443.content: On a string, there are $$7$$ white beads and $$4$$ black beads threaded in that order, and this pattern is repeated. If a total of $$120$$ beads have been threaded from the beginning, how many more white beads are there than black beads among these $$120$$ beads?

4444.content: On July 1, 1997, our country regained sovereignty over Hong Kong, and that day was exactly Tuesday. What day of the week will it be on July 1, 2019, for the 22nd anniversary celebration?

4445.content: If November 1, 2018 is a Thursday, what day of the week is December 31 of that year?

4446.content: What is the unit digit of the result of $$\underbrace{2\times 2\times \cdots \times 2}_{20 \text{ twos}} - 1$$?

4447.content: In a cage, there are a total of $$3$$ heads and $$10$$ legs. How many chickens are there?

4448.content: In a circle, $$12$$ students are playing the handkerchief passing game, as shown in the figure. Starting from student $$1$$, if the handkerchief is passed $$200$$ times counterclockwise, which student's hands should the handkerchief be in?

4449.content: If June 1, 2016 is a Wednesday, then what day of the week is June 1, 2013?

4450.content: Xiao Tong's birthday is June 27. June 1 of this year is a Saturday. What day of the week is Xiao Tong's birthday?

4451.content: Lele Department Store entrusted a transportation station to deliver $$100$$ vases. Both parties agreed on a shipping fee of $$10$$ per vase, but if any are damaged, not only is there no shipping fee for each broken one, but they also have to compensate $$10$$ for each one broken. As a result, the transportation station received a total shipping fee of $$920$$. How many vases were broken during the transportation process?

4452.content: Originally, there were $$62$$ legs in total between chickens and rabbits. Now, if all the chickens become rabbits and all the rabbits become chickens, there are now $$88$$ legs in total. How many chickens were there originally?

4453.content: The store clerk went to the bank to exchange coins, using $$80$$ one-hundred-yuan bills to exchange for a total of $$220$$ twenty-yuan and fifty-yuan bills, how many twenty-yuan bills are there?

4454.content: In a math exam, there are only $$10$$ questions. If you answer a question correctly, you get $$10$$ points; if you answer incorrectly or leave it blank, you lose $$3$$ points. Wei Er did not pass this time, but she found that if she had one fewer mistake, she would score $$61$$ points. How many questions did she answer correctly?

4455.content: There is a square in the figure.

4456.content: A sequence has the first term as $$\frac{1}{2}$$, the second term as $$\frac{1}{6}$$, the third term as $$\frac{1}{12}$$, the fourth term as $$\frac{1}{20}$$, and so on. What is the $$n$$-th term?

4457.content: If you draw $$6$$ straight lines on paper, what is the maximum number of regions that the paper can be divided into?

4458.content: If you draw $$14$$ straight lines on paper, what is the maximum number of intersection points that can be formed?

4459.content: The two diagonals of quadrilateral $$ABCD$$ are perpendicular to each other. Given that $$AC=10$$ and $$BD=7$$, what is the area of quadrilateral $$ABCD$$?
4459.kc: 两条对角线垂直的四边形的面积求法

4460.content: Given that the area of parallelogram $$ABCD$$ is $$60$$ square centimeters, and $$CD = 10$$ centimeters, what is the length of $$AE$$ in centimeters?
4460.kc: 平行四边形的面积公式

4461.content: What is the area of the trapezoid as shown in the figure?

4462.content: There is a sequence of numbers: $$3$$, $$3$$, $$9$$, $$7$$, $$3$$, … Starting from the $$3$$rd number, each number is the unit digit of the product of the previous two numbers. What is the $$2014$$th number in this sequence?

4463.content:
Observe the following sequence of numbers (the pattern is shown in the box), please calculate how many numbers are in this sequence. 
$$1$$, $$2$$, $$4$$, $$7$$, $$8$$, $$10$$, $$13$$, $$14$$, $$16$$, $$19$$, …, $$100$$

4464.content: Can all $$7$$ cups have their openings facing down after several flips if it is allowed to flip $$4$$ cups at a time?

4465.content: In the figure, three cups A, B, and C of the same size are arranged in order on the table. Cup A is full of water, while cups B and C are empty. If all the water is poured into an adjacent (left or right) empty cup, after $$55$$ pours, which cup has water?

4466.content: The little monkey turned off the lights before going out. When he returned home at night and prepared to turn on the lights, he pressed the switch a total of $$12$$ times, but the light still didn't turn on. It turned out that there was a power outage. Can you guess what the light will be like when the power comes back on?

4467.content: As shown in the figure, there are two islands at the intersection of two rivers, and there are seven bridges connecting these two islands and the riverbanks. The question is: Can a walker traverse all seven bridges without repeating any?

4468.content: In the figure below, each line represents a street, and the numbers on the lines indicate the kilometers of that street. The postal truck starts from the post office, needs to travel all the streets, and finally return to the post office. What is the shortest distance the postal truck will travel in kilometers?

4469.content: Can Grandma Li walk through all the paths in the street garden without repeating any and return to the starting point? If not, what route should she take to make the total distance the shortest? What is the shortest distance?

4470.content: In the figure below, there are $$6$$ points and $$8$$ line segments. A little beetle starts from point $$A$$ and must crawl to point $$F$$ along certain line segments. During its journey, the beetle can only move to the right, downward, or diagonally down to the right. How many different ways can the beetle walk?

4471.content: If you divide $$12$$ candies into $$3$$ piles with different quantities, with at least one in each pile, how many different ways can this be done?

4472.content: There are five types of gifts priced at $$2$$ yuan, $$5$$ yuan, $$8$$ yuan, $$11$$ yuan, and $$14$$ yuan, and five types of packaging boxes priced at $$3$$ yuan, $$5$$ yuan, $$7$$ yuan, $$9$$ yuan, and $$11$$ yuan. If one gift is paired with one packaging box, how many different total prices are there?

4473.content: In the figure below, there are $$6$$ points and $$8$$ line segments. A beetle starts from point $$A$$ and must crawl along certain line segments to reach point $$F$$ (it stops moving upon reaching point $$F$$). During its journey, it can pass through the same point or line segment at most $$1$$ time. How many different ways can the beetle reach point $$F$$?

4474.content: How many different ways are there to divide $$12$$ identical balls into $$3$$ piles?

4475.content: As shown in the figure, an ant starts from a vertex $$A$$ of a regular tetrahedron and must walk along the edges to visit all $$4$$ vertices without repeating any, then return to vertex $$A$$. How many different paths does the ant have?

4476.content: There are a total of twelve natural numbers from $$1$$ to $$12$$. How many different ways can $$26$$ be split into three different natural numbers among them?

4477.content: There are $$15$$ identical candies divided into $$3$$ piles of different quantities. How many different ways are there to divide them?

4478.content: How many ways can you split $$25$$ into the sum of $$7$$ different natural numbers? Please list the different representations.

4479.content: Xinhua Primary School arranges $$4$$ extracurricular activities each week, which include sports, arts, and technology. If each type of activity must occur at least once in a week, and the same type of activity cannot be scheduled consecutively, how many different arrangements are there?

4480.content: How many ways can you express $$7$$ as a sum of several (two or more) non-zero natural numbers?

4481.content: There are $$3$$ identical red balls, $$4$$ identical yellow balls, and $$5$$ identical white balls in the bag. If Xiao Ming randomly takes out $$6$$ balls, how many different possibilities are there for him to take out the balls?

4482.content: If $$8$$ identical rulers are distributed to $$3$$ children, with each child receiving at least one ruler, how many different distributions are there?

4483.content: In a table tennis match between A and B, the person who wins the first two games in a row is the winner; if no one wins the first two games in a row, then the person who wins three games first is the winner. How many possible outcomes are there from the start of the match until a winner is decided?

4484.content: A four-digit number, if separated by a comma between the hundred and ten places, can be written as two two-digit numbers $$(3162 \to 31,62)$$. If the two two-digit numbers have an integer multiple relationship, we call such a four-digit number a "clever number." Please select $$4$$ numbers from $$1$$, $$2$$, $$4$$, $$6$$, $$8$$ to form a four-digit number. How many "clever numbers" are there?

4485.content: For a sequence of numbers, if there are three digits $$abc$$ arranged in order, and either $$a > b$$ and $$c > b$$ or $$a < b$$ and $$c < b$$, we call it a turning point. For example, $$4321$$ has no turning points, $$1243$$ has one turning point, and $$1324$$ has two turning points. How many arrangements of $$1$$, $$2$$, $$3$$, and $$4$$ can be made such that the sequence has exactly two turning points?
4485.kc: 数字组数（规定数位大小）

4486.content: There are seven plates, each containing $$1$$, $$2$$, $$3$$, $$5$$, $$6$$, $$7$$, and $$9$$ pears respectively. If you want to take $$15$$ pears from these plates, and you can either take all the pears from a plate or none at all, how many different ways are there to choose?

4488.kc: 整数乘法巧算之提取公因数（普通型）

4491.kc: 整数乘法巧算之提取公因数（普通型）

4494.content: In the figure, some numbers are already filled in. The number in each remaining box equals the product of the leftmost number in the same row and the topmost number in the same column (for example, $$a=8\times 11=88$$). What is the sum of all the numbers filled in the empty boxes?

4495.content: This year, the father's age is $$6$$ times the son's age. In $$15$$ years, the father's age will be $$3$$ times the son's age. What is the son's age this year?

4496.content: Xiao Ying is $$2$$ years younger than Xiao Ming. This year, their ages sum up to half of the teacher's age. In $$16$$ years, their ages will sum up to the teacher's age. How old is Xiao Ying this year?

4497.content: A square with a side length of $$10$$ centimeters is cut horizontally $$3$$ times and vertically $$3$$ times, resulting in $$16$$ small rectangles. What is the total perimeter of these $$16$$ small rectangles in centimeters?

4498.content: Given a rectangle with a length of $$15$$ and a width of $$9$$, if the long side is cut $$2$$ times and the short side is cut $$1$$ time, what is the total perimeter of $$6$$ small rectangles?

4499.content: A large rectangle is divided into $$16$$ smaller rectangles, and the perimeter of $$4$$ of them is already marked. What is the perimeter of the large rectangle in centimeters?
4499.kc: 长方形正方形组合图形周长

4500.content: If you use scissors to cut a rectangular piece of paper with a perimeter of $$36$$ centimeters, making $$2$$ cuts vertically and $$2$$ cuts horizontally, what is the sum of the perimeters of the $$9$$ new rectangles in centimeters?

4501.content: A vegetable plot, shaped as shown in the figure, has $$a = b = 30$$ meters and $$c = 12$$ meters. What is the perimeter of this plot in meters?
4501.kc: 楼梯型不规则图形求周长

4502.content: Can $$12$$ trees be arranged in $$6$$ rows with $$4$$ trees in each row?

4503.content: What is the number of intersection points that cannot occur if a straight line is added to the figure below?

4504.content: The $$5$$ points in the figure can form $$6$$ lines. If we add one more point to the figure, how many possible scenarios are there for forming new lines?

4505.content: In the same plane, how many straight lines can be determined by any given $$9$$ points at most?

4506.content: How many regions can $$13$$ straight lines at most divide the plane into?

4507.content: Given $$20$$ points in the same plane, what is the maximum number of lines that can be determined? How many intersection points can a maximum of $$20$$ lines in the same plane have?

4508.content: If $$4$$ straight lines are drawn on a plane, what is the maximum number of regions the plane can be divided into? If $$20$$ straight lines are drawn, what is the maximum number of regions that can be formed?

4509.content: A certain fleet bought some new tires. Xiao Ming counted and found that if all $$2$$ front tires of each vehicle were replaced, there would still be $$20$$ tires left; if all $$4$$ tires of each vehicle were replaced, there would only be $$6$$ tires left. Question: How many vehicles are there in the fleet?

4510.content: A merchant needs camels to carry goods across the desert. If $$2$$ camels carry $$4$$ boxes each, the remaining camels carry $$2$$ boxes each, and there are $$4$$ boxes left; if $$1$$ camel carries $$6$$ boxes and the remaining camels carry $$4$$ boxes each, then $$3$$ camels will have no goods to carry. How many camels are there in total?

4511.content: The National Day is approaching, and the Young Pioneers of Xueersi School are setting up flowers. If each person sets up $$6$$ pots of flowers, there are $$3$$ pots left unarranged; if $$2$$ of them each set up $$5$$ pots, and the rest each set up $$7$$ pots, the flowers are just enough to be arranged. How many Young Pioneers participated in the flower arrangement activity, and how many pots of flowers are there in total?
4511.kc: 盈亏基本类型盈亏问题

4512.content: The teacher gives the new students score cards, and each person gets the same amount. If each student receives $$10$$ cards, there are $$30$$ cards short; if each student receives $$8$$ cards, there are still $$8$$ cards short. How many students are there in total, and how many score cards are there?

4513.content: The students of the Young Pioneers at Happy Elementary School are holding a meeting in the conference room. If $$3$$ people sit on each bench, there will be $$7$$ people left over. If $$7$$ people sit on each bench, there will be $$3$$ benches extra. How many Young Pioneers are attending the meeting?

4514.content: Teacher Li bought a basket of oranges. If all of them are distributed to the children in the big class, each child receives $$3$$ oranges, leaving $$5$$ oranges remaining. If all of them are distributed to the children in the small class, each child receives $$2$$ oranges, leaving $$8$$ oranges remaining. It is known that there is $$1$$ more child in the small class than in the big class. How many oranges are there in the basket?
4514.kc: 盈亏基本类型盈亏问题

4515.content: There are several red and white balls in a box. If you take out $$1$$ red ball and $$1$$ white ball each time, when there are no more red balls left, there are still $$50$$ white balls remaining; if you take away $$1$$ red ball and $$3$$ white balls each time, when there are no more white balls left, there are still $$50$$ red balls remaining. How many red balls are there in the box in total?
4515.kc: 盈亏基本类型盈亏问题

4516.content: If the students of Experimental Elementary School take a bus for the spring outing, and each bus seats $$60$$ people, then $$15$$ people cannot get on the bus; if each bus accommodates $$5$$ more people, there will be exactly one extra bus. How many students are there in total? How many buses are there in total?

4517.content: Xiao Ming's mother took a sum of money to buy meat. If she buys $$10$$ kilograms of beef, she will still be short $$6$$ yuan. If she buys $$12$$ kilograms of pork, she will have $$4$$ yuan left. It is known that beef is $$3$$ yuan more expensive per kilogram than pork. How much money did Xiao Ming's mother bring?

4518.content: The fruit store uses a batch of kiwis and cantaloupes to prepare fruit gift boxes. If every $$5$$ kiwis and $$3$$ cantaloupes are packed into one box, there are $$4$$ kiwis left over and exactly enough cantaloupes. If $$7$$ kiwis and $$3$$ cantaloupes are packed into one box, there are $$12$$ cantaloupes left over and exactly enough kiwis. How many kiwis are there, and how many cantaloupes are there?
4518.kc: 盈亏基本类型盈亏问题

4519.content: On March $$12$$, Arbor Day, the students of Class One in Grade Three went to plant trees. If $$3$$ of them each plant $$2$$ trees, and the remaining students each plant $$6$$ trees, they will just finish planting all the seedlings. If the number of students is doubled, then each person planting $$2$$ trees will still leave $$8$$ trees unplanted. How many students participated in the tree planting, and how many trees need to be planted in total?

4520.content: The school organized a group of teachers and students to attend a conference in another city and reserved some rooms in advance. If each room accommodates $$3$$ people, then $$20$$ people do not have a place to stay; if each room accommodates $$6$$ people, the remaining $$2$$ people can each have a room. If each room accommodates $$10$$ people, how many rooms can be left empty?

4521.content: The Ministry of Health conducted a survey on $$120$$ types of food to see if they contain vitamins $$A$$, $$C$$, and $$E$$. The results are as follows: there are $$62$$ types containing vitamin $$A$$, $$90$$ types containing vitamin $$C$$, and $$68$$ types containing vitamin $$E$$. There are $$48$$ types containing both vitamins $$A$$ and $$C$$, $$36$$ types containing both vitamins $$A$$ and $$E$$, $$50$$ types containing both vitamins $$C$$ and $$E$$, and $$25$$ types containing all three vitamins. How many types of food contain only vitamin $$A$$?

4522.content: There are $$100$$ lights numbered from $$1$$ to $$100$$, all initially turned on in a row. In the first round, the lights numbered with multiples of $$3$$ are switched off, and in the second round, the lights numbered with multiples of $$5$$ are switched off. How many lights remain on?

4523.content: In the third grade, there are three extracurricular activity groups: sports, music, and calligraphy, with the number of participants being $$54$$, $$46$$, and $$36$$ respectively. There are $$4$$ people participating in both the sports group and the music group, $$7$$ people in both the sports group and the calligraphy group, and $$10$$ people in both the music group and the calligraphy group. There are $$2$$ people participating in all three groups. How many people are there in total participating in extracurricular activities in the third grade?

4524.content: Two barrels of oil, A and B, weigh a total of $$240$$ kilograms. The first time, the same amount of oil is poured from barrel A into barrel B. The second time, the same amount of oil is poured from barrel B back into barrel A. At this point, both barrels contain the same amount of oil. How many kilograms of oil were originally in barrel A and how many kilograms were originally in barrel B?

4525.content: In a chess competition held by the school, it is required that each pair of contestants plays one match. If there are a total of $$105$$ matches in the competition, how many people participated in the chess competition?

4526.content: In a round-robin tournament with $$6$$ teams, each pair of teams plays one match. If the match ends in a draw, each team gets $$1$$ point; otherwise, the winning team gets $$3$$ points and the losing team gets $$0$$ points. After the matches, it was found that there were $$2$$ draws. What is the total score of the six teams?

4527.content: In a knowledge competition, there are $$60$$ students participating. Among them, the average score of the top $$10$$ students is $$10$$ points higher than the average score of all the students in this competition. What is the average score of the remaining $$50$$ students compared to the average score of all the students in this competition?

4528.content: Uncle Zhang went to the bank to withdraw money. The first time he withdrew half of his savings plus $$5$$ yuan, the second time he withdrew half of what was left plus $$10$$ yuan, and finally, he had $$125$$ yuan remaining. How much money did he originally have?

4529.content: When Xiao Mahu was calculating a division problem, he mistakenly read the divisor $$26$$ as $$62$$, resulting in a quotient of $$15$$ and a remainder of $$32$$. What is the correct quotient?

4530.content: The average of the four numbers $$A$$, $$B$$, $$C$$, and $$D$$ is $$38$$; the average of $$A$$ and $$B$$ is $$42$$; the average of the three numbers $$B$$, $$C$$, and $$D$$ is $$36$$. What is $$B$$?

4531.content: In a single elimination table tennis competition, a total of $$16$$ athletes entered the finals. If each match eliminates one player, how many matches need to be played to determine the champion?

4532.content: The amount of rice in the granary is twice the amount of flour. If each truck carries $$3$$ tons of flour, there are $$5$$ tons of flour left; if each truck carries $$7$$ tons of rice, it just finishes transporting the rice. How many tons of rice and flour are there in the granary?

4533.content: There are a total of $$123$$ birds on three trees. If $$4$$ birds fly from the first tree to the second tree, and $$5$$ birds fly from the second tree to the third tree, then the number of birds on the three trees will be equal. How many birds were originally on the first tree, how many birds were originally on the second tree, and how many birds were originally on the third tree?

4534.content: Weier distributes mosquito-repellent stickers to Class 2 of Grade 4. If each person receives $$4$$ stickers, there will be $$28$$ stickers left over; if $$4$$ people each receive $$6$$ stickers, and $$6$$ people each receive $$4$$ stickers, then the remaining people each receive $$5$$ stickers, and all the stickers will be distributed exactly. How many people are there in Class 2 of Grade 4, and how many mosquito-repellent stickers are there in total?

4535.content: In a round-robin football tournament with four teams: A, B, C, and D, each team plays a match against every other team. A win earns $$2$$ points, a loss earns $$0$$ points, and a draw gives each team $$1$$ point. Now, A has earned $$5$$ points and B has earned $$1$$ point, and it is known that C only drew with D. What is the final score of D?

4536.content: Li Ming and Zhang Liang take turns typing a manuscript. Li Ming types $$15$$ pages a day, and Zhang Liang types $$10$$ pages a day. They worked for $$25$$ days in total, averaging $$12$$ pages per day. How many days did Li Ming type, and how many days did Zhang Liang type?

4537.content: In a cage, there are chickens and rabbits. There are $$4$$ more chickens than rabbits, and the total number of legs of the rabbits and chickens is $$32$$. How many chickens are there, and how many rabbits are there?

4538.content: In a cage with chickens and rabbits, there are $$26$$ more rabbits than chickens, and there are a total of $$254$$ feet. How many chickens are there, and how many rabbits are there?

4539.content: Monsters University has large dormitories and small dormitories. The large dormitory can accommodate $$6$$ people, and the small dormitory can accommodate $$4$$ people. In total, they can accommodate $$172$$ people. Now, if the large dormitories and small dormitories are swapped, with all large dormitories becoming small dormitories and all small dormitories becoming large dormitories, they can accommodate $$198$$ people. How many large dormitories and small dormitories were there originally?

If each worker plants an equal number of trees each day, and no one takes leave in the following days, how many more days will it take to complete the task?

What is the total score of the six teams after all the matches are completed?

There are $$18$$ participants who compete in both Go and Chinese chess, $$10$$ participants who compete in both Go and international chess, and $$9$$ participants who compete in both Chinese chess and international chess. Among them, $$5$$ participants compete in all three chess competitions. How many people participated in the chess competitions in total?

As shown in the diagram, there are five residential buildings: $$A$$, $$B$$, $$C$$, $$D$$, and $$E$$, each with the same number of residents. Now, to minimize the total distance from the five buildings to the bus station, where should the station be located? (Fill in the uppercase letter.)

How many kilometers should the car travel per hour? In fact, after traveling half of the distance, the car broke down and stopped for $$1$$ hour. If the car wants to arrive at point B on time, how many kilometers per hour should it travel for the remaining half of the distance?

If each student makes the same number of flowers each day and no one will be reassigned in the following days, how many more days will it take to complete the task?

If the inlet pipe is opened alone, it can fill the empty tank in $$8$$ hours; if the drainage pipe is opened alone, it can empty the full tank in $$6$$ hours. How many hours will it take to empty the full tank when both pipes are opened together?

Now there is a batch of goods that requires $$5$$ large trucks and $$15$$ small trucks to be transported in $$4$$ hours.
