If you close your eyes and take beads out, how many beads (at least $$3$$) must you take out at once to ensure that there are at least $$5$$ beads of $$3$$ different colors?

4779.content: A deck of playing cards has a total of $$54$$ cards, including $$2$$ jokers, and there are $$13$$ cards each of spades, hearts, clubs, and diamonds. (1) How many cards must be drawn at least to ensure that two different suits are drawn?

4780.content: How many cards must be drawn to guarantee that at least two different suits are obtained?

4781.content: There are $$9$$ yellow socks, $$7$$ green socks, $$4$$ white socks, $$2$$ red socks, and $$1$$ black sock. Eddie closes his eyes and feels the socks: (1) How many socks must he touch at least to ensure he has a matching pair?

4782.content: Eddie has $$9$$ yellow socks, $$7$$ green socks, $$4$$ white socks, $$2$$ red socks, and $$1$$ black sock. If he closes his eyes and feels the socks, how many socks does he need to touch at least to ensure he can make $$2$$ pairs of socks?

4783.content: There are three colors of chopsticks in the pocket, with $$10$$ of each color. How many must be taken at least to ensure that all three colors are included?

4784.content: There are $$10$$ chopsticks of each of three different colors in the pocket. How many must be taken at least to ensure that there are $$2$$ pairs of chopsticks of the same color?

4785.content: The pigeon farm has $$70$$ pigeons. After the pigeons fly back into the cage, at least one cage contains $$8$$ pigeons. What is the maximum number of pigeon cages the farm can have?

4786.content: There are $$4$$ red balls, $$7$$ yellow balls, and $$8$$ black balls in a pocket. To ensure that there are $$6$$ balls of the same color among the drawn balls, what is the minimum number of balls that must be drawn?

4787.content: Among any $$99$$ people, at least two people have the same gender.

4788.content: Answer the following questions: (1) A restaurant has $$40$$ signature dishes. Eddie has eaten $$15$$ of them, Vira has eaten $$9$$ of them, and there are $$4$$ dishes that both of them have eaten. How many signature dishes have neither of them eaten?

4789.content: Answer the following question: (2) There are $$50$$ students in the third grade going to the cafeteria for lunch. The cafeteria prepared many dishes, with $$26$$ choosing tomato scrambled eggs and $$21$$ choosing braised pork. There are $$17$$ people who chose neither of these two dishes. How many people chose both dishes?

4790.content: Complete the following questions: (1) Class Three (Class 1) has $$55$$ students participating in the sports meeting, and each student participates in at least one of the races: running or skipping. It is known that $$36$$ students participate in running, and $$38$$ students participate in skipping. How many students only participate in skipping?

4791.content: Complete the following questions: (2) Class Three (Grade 2) has $$50$$ students, some can ride bicycles, some can swim, $$35$$ students can ride bicycles, and $$15$$ students can do both. There are students who cannot do either. How many students can swim?

4792.content: How many natural numbers between $$1$$ and $$100$$ cannot be divided by $$2$$ or $$3$$?

4793.content: The school has $$90$$ teachers, among which $$66$$ teachers like drinking tea, $$42$$ teachers like drinking coffee, and the number of people who like both beverages is exactly $$3$$ times the number of people who do not like either beverage. What is the minimum number of teachers in the school who like at least one of the two beverages?
4793.kc: 以文字题形式运用方程解应用题

4794.content: In a survey of $$100$$ people, $$28$$ people read magazine $$A$$; $$30$$ people read magazine $$B$$; $$42$$ people read magazine $$C$$; $$8$$ people read both magazines $$A$$ and $$B$$; $$10$$ people read both magazines $$A$$ and $$C$$; $$5$$ people read both magazines $$B$$ and $$C$$; and $$3$$ people read all three magazines. How many people did not read any of the three magazines?

4795.content: On a sunny and pleasant day, $$11$$ students agreed to go on a picnic, and each person brought food. Among them, $$6$$ people brought hamburgers, $$6$$ people brought drumsticks, and $$4$$ people brought cheesecake. There are $$3$$ people who brought both hamburgers and drumsticks, and $$1$$ person who brought both drumsticks and cheesecake. $$2$$ people brought both hamburgers and cheesecake, and there are people who brought all three types of food.

4796.content: The Spring Calligraphy, Art, and Instrument Classes at the Youth Palace are enrolling students. The Calligraphy Class has enrolled $$29$$ students, the Art Class has enrolled $$28$$ students, and the Instrument Class has enrolled $$27$$ students. Among these students, $$13$$ have enrolled in both Calligraphy and Art, $$12$$ in both Calligraphy and Instruments, $$11$$ in both Art and Instruments, and $$5$$ have enrolled in all three subjects. How many students are enrolled in only one subject?

4797.content: In physical education class, $$60$$ students stood in a line facing the teacher. At the teacher's command, they counted off from left to right: $$1$$, $$2$$, $$3$$, …, $$60$$. Then, the teacher asked the students whose numbers were multiples of $$4$$ to turn around, followed by those whose numbers were multiples of $$5$$, and finally, those whose numbers were multiples of $$6$$. How many students are now facing the teacher?

4798.content: On a long stick, there are three types of scale lines. The first type divides the stick into ten equal parts; the second type divides the stick into twelve equal parts; and the third type divides the stick into fifteen equal parts. If the stick is sawed along each scale line, how many pieces is the stick cut into in total?

4799.content: In a self-picking orchard, the number of people who only pick raspberries is twice the number of people who only pick plums; the number of people who pick strawberries, raspberries, and plums is $$3$$ more than the number of people who only pick plums; the number of people who only pick strawberries is $$4$$ more than the number of people who picked both raspberries and strawberries but did not pick plums; $$50$$ people did not pick strawberries; $$11$$ people picked both raspberries and plums but did not pick strawberries; a total of $$60$$ people picked plums. If the total number of people participating in fruit picking is $$100$$, how many people picked all three types of fruit?

4800.content: There are $$46$$ students in Class One of the fourth grade participating in three extracurricular groups: math, Chinese, and art. Among them, $$24$$ students are in the math group, $$20$$ students are in the Chinese group, $$10$$ students are in both the math and Chinese groups, $$6$$ students are in both the math and art groups, $$6$$ students are in both the art and Chinese groups, and $$3$$ students are in all three groups. How many students are participating in the art group?

4801.content: In the fourth grade of Fangcaodi Primary School, there are $58$ students learning piano, $43$ students learning painting, and $37$ students learning both piano and painting. How many students learn only piano and how many students learn only painting?

4802.content: How many natural numbers from $$1$$ to $$120$$ are neither multiples of $$3$$ nor multiples of $$5$$?

4803.content: (1) A book has a total of $$60$$ pages. How many digits were used in the page numbers from $$1$$ to $$60$$?
4803.kc: 数字与页码的对应问题

4804.content: A book has a total of $$150$$ pages. How many digits were used for the page numbers from $$1$$ to $$150$$?
4804.kc: 数字与页码的对应问题

4805.content: (1) A novel requires $$105$$ digits for its page numbers when printed. How many pages does this book have?

4806.content: The total number of pages in a book is how many if encoding the book used a total of $$225$$ digits?

4807.content: (1) If a book has a total of $$120$$ pages, how many digits are used in the page numbers from $$1$$ to $$120$$?

4808.content: (2) A total of $$333$$ digits were used to number the pages of a book. How many pages does this book have?

4809.content: Arrange natural numbers in increasing order without gaps to form a large number: $$123456789101112\cdots$$. Question: What is the digit in the $$500$$th position from the left?

4810.content: A book has a total of $$520$$ pages. How many times is the digit "0" used in the page numbers from $$1$$ to $$520$$?

4811.content: When numbering the pages of a book, a total of $$41$$ digits "$$6$$" were used. What is the minimum number of pages the book could have, and what is the maximum number of pages?

4812.content: A book has a total of $$500$$ pages, how many pages contain the number “$$4$$”?

4813.content: The page numbers of a storybook originally used $$195$$ digits, and then $$15$$ more pages were added. How many more digits need to be added?

4814.content: When printing a book, page numbers need to be assigned, and this book uses a total of $$1992$$ digits. How many pages in this book contain the digit "$$2$$"?

4815.content: (1) Sixteen basketball teams compete according to the following single-elimination tournament rules: they are divided into eight groups to compete against each other, resulting in eight teams advancing, then four teams are determined... and finally, a champion is decided. How many matches were played in total?

4816.content: In the class, four students are participating in a checkers competition, and each pair of students will play one game. The winner of each game earns $$2$$ points, both players earn $$1$$ point in case of a tie, and the loser earns $$0$$ points. (3) Given that students A, B, and C scored $$3$$ points, $$4$$ points, and $$4$$ points respectively, and that C had no ties, A had some wins, and B had ties, what is D's score?

4817.content: In a Chinese chess competition, there are three possible outcomes: winning earns $$2$$ points, a draw earns $$1$$ point, and losing earns $$0$$ points. Now six people are competing in a round-robin tournament. The scores of five of the players are known to be $$7$$, $$6$$, $$5$$, $$4$$, and $$3$$. What is the score of the last person?

4818.content: Four soccer teams are playing a round-robin tournament, with each pair of teams playing one match. If the match ends in a tie, each team gets $$1$$ point; otherwise, the winning team gets $$3$$ points and the losing team gets $$0$$ points. (1) What is the minimum total score for the four teams, and what is the maximum total score?

4819.content: Four students participated in the Go competition in the district. Each pair of players has to play one match. The rules state that winning a match earns $$2$$ points, a draw earns $$1$$ point, and losing earns $$0$$ points. If everyone ends up with different total scores, and the first place did not win all their matches, what is the maximum number of drawn matches possible?

4820.content: The school is holding a volleyball competition with a total of $$8$$ teams participating. If a single-elimination tournament format is used, how many matches will be played in total? If a round-robin tournament format is used, how many matches will be played in total?

4821.content: Five people, $$A$$, $$B$$, $$C$$, $$D$$, and $$E$$, participated in a table tennis competition, with each pair of individuals competing against each other. The winner receives $$2$$ points, the loser receives no points, and there are no draws. Given the results: $$A$$ and $$E$$ are tied for first place; $$B$$ is in third place; $$C$$ and $$D$$ are tied for fourth place, what is the score of $$B$$?

4822.content: Football teams $$A$$, $$B$$, $$C$$, $$D$$, and $$E$$ are competing in a single round-robin tournament (each pair of teams plays one match). The winning team gets $$3$$ points, the losing team gets $$0$$ points, and in case of a draw, each team gets $$1$$ point. If the total points for teams $$A$$, $$B$$, $$C$$, and $$D$$ are $$1$$, $$4$$, $$7$$, and $$8$$ respectively, what is the maximum and minimum points that team $$E$$ can obtain?

4823.content: There are fourteen basketball teams competing under the single-elimination tournament rules, and a champion will be determined. How many matches were played in total? If they compete under the round-robin tournament rules, how many matches will be played in total?

4824.content: In the sixth grade, six classes held a competition, where each class competes against every other class once. A win earns $$2$$ points, a tie earns $$1$$ point, and a loss earns $$0$$ points. After the competition, it is known that the champion class 6(1) scored $$7$$ points, lost one match, and won how many matches?

4825.content: Four football teams are competing in a round-robin tournament, with each pair of teams playing one match. If the match ends in a draw, each team earns $$1$$ point; otherwise, the winning team gets $$3$$ points and the losing team gets $$0$$ points. Given that Team A, Team B, and Team C scored $$7$$ points, $$4$$ points, and $$4$$ points respectively, how many points did Team D score? How many matches ended in a draw in total? ( )

4826.content: Some oranges are distributed to several people. Each person receives $$5$$ oranges and there are still $$10$$ oranges left; if the number of people is increased to $$3$$ times, each person receives $$2$$ oranges but there are still $$8$$ oranges short. How many oranges are there in total?

4827.content: Use a long rope to measure the depth of a well. If the rope is folded in half, it is $$5$$ meters longer; if the rope is folded into three parts, it is $$4$$ meters shorter. What is the length of the rope in meters, and what is the depth of the well in meters? (The length at the fold is negligible, and each fold is considered to be of equal length.)
4827.kc: 盈亏基本类型盈亏问题

4828.content: There is a dry well, and a rope is used to measure the depth of the well. When the rope is folded in half and lowered to the bottom of the well, one end of the rope is $$9$$ meters above the well opening; when the rope is folded into thirds and lowered to the bottom of the well, one end of the rope is $$2$$ meters above the well opening. What is the length of the rope in meters, and how deep is the well in meters?

4829.content: Eddie calculated that if he walks $$80$$ meters per minute, he will arrive at school $$6$$ minutes early; if he walks $$50$$ meters per minute, he will be $$3$$ minutes late. What is the distance from Eddie's home to school in meters?
4829.kc: 盈亏基本类型盈亏问题

4830.content: Master Wang processes a batch of parts, producing $$20$$ each day, and can finish $$1$$ day early. After working for $$4$$ days, due to improvements in technology, he can produce $$5$$ more each day, resulting in finishing $$3$$ days early. How many parts are in this batch?
4830.kc: 盈亏基本类型盈亏问题

4831.content: Box A contains only $$5$$ jiao coins, box B contains only $$2$$ jiao coins, the amount of money in box A is $$1.50$$ yuan more than that in box B, and box B has $$24$$ more coins than box A. How many coins are there in total in boxes A and B?

4832.content: Masters A and B need to process a batch of parts. If they process $$40$$ parts per hour, they will finish $$2$$ hours later than planned; if they process $$35$$ parts per hour, they will finish $$3$$ hours later than planned. How many parts are in this batch?

4833.content: In a basketball team of five people, the average height of four players is $$182$$ centimeters. The height of the fifth player is $$8$$ centimeters shorter than the average height of the whole team. What is the height of this player in centimeters?

4834.content: There are $$4$$ numbers, their average is $$32$$, the average of the first $$3$$ numbers is $$29$$, and the average of the last $$2$$ numbers is $$35$$. What is the third number?

4835.content: First, input a number into the computer, and it will perform the following operations according to the given instructions: if the input number is even, divide it by $$2$$; if the input number is odd, add $$3$$ to it. After performing such operations $$3$$ times, the result is $$27$$. What could the original input number be?

4836.content: Two oil barrels, A and B, each contain $$15$$ kilograms of oil. After selling $$14$$ kilograms of oil, the salesperson redistributed the oil between the two barrels. First, they poured some oil from barrel A into barrel B, increasing the amount of oil in barrel B by $$5$$ kilograms. Then, they poured some oil back from barrel B into barrel A, doubling the amount of oil in barrel A. At this point, the amount of oil in barrel A is exactly $$7$$ times that in barrel B. How many kilograms of oil were originally sold from barrel A and how many kilograms from barrel B?

4837.content: There are $$26$$ bricks, and two brothers are competing to pick them up. The younger brother goes first and just finishes arranging the bricks when the older brother arrives. The older brother sees that the younger brother has taken too many, so he takes half of what the younger brother picked for himself. The younger brother feels capable and then takes half from the older brother. The older brother thinks he has taken too little, so the younger brother has to give him $$5$$ more bricks. In the end, the older brother has $$2$$ more bricks than the younger brother. How many bricks did the younger brother initially plan to pick?

4838.content: There are three piles of apples: A, B, and C, totaling $$96$$ apples. In the first step, an amount of apples equal to the number in pile B is taken from pile A and added to pile B. In the second step, an amount of apples equal to the number in pile C is taken from pile B and added to pile C. In the third step, an amount of apples equal to the remaining number in pile A is taken from pile C and added back to pile A. At this point, the number of apples in all three piles is equal. How many apples were originally in pile A, pile B, and pile C?

4839.content: A, B, and C each have a different number of bricks. A takes out a portion of his bricks to give to B and C, doubling the number of bricks for both; then B also takes out a portion of bricks to give to A and C, doubling the number of bricks for both; next, C takes out a portion of bricks to give to A and B, doubling the number of bricks for both. At this time, all three have 48 bricks each. How many bricks did A originally have, how many bricks did B originally have, and how many bricks did C originally have?

4840.content: When Eddie was doing a subtraction problem, he mistakenly wrote the $$3$$ in the units place of the minuend as $$5$$, the $$6$$ in the tens place as $$0$$, and the $$7$$ in the hundreds place of the subtrahend as $$2$$. The difference obtained this way is $$1994$$. What should the correct difference be?

4841.content: At the beginning of the school year, the students received textbooks. Xiao Tang received $$20$$ books, Xiao Li received $$6$$ books, and Xiao Gang also received some books, but it is unknown how many. At this time, the teacher asked Xiao Tang to give Xiao Li $$4$$ books and gave Xiao Gang some books. After that, the number of books they each had became the same. How many books did Xiao Gang originally have?

4842.content: Xiao Mahu miscalculated "$$\square \times (100+1)$$" as "$$\square \times 100 + 1$$", resulting in a value that is $$6$$ less than the correct answer. What is the correct answer?
4842.kc: 抄错数得出结果，求正确的

4843.content: First, write a two-digit number $$11$$, then write the sum of these two digits $$2$$ at the right end of $$11$$ to get $$112$$. Next, write the sum of the last two digits $$1$$ and $$2$$ which is $$3$$, resulting in $$1123$$. Using this method, obtain a number with $$2018$$ digits $$112358134711\ldots$$. What is the $$2018$$th digit?

4844.content: First, write a two-digit number $$11$$, then write the sum of these two digits $$2$$ to the right of $$11$$, resulting in $$112$$. Next, write the sum of the last two digits $$1$$ and $$2$$, which is $$3$$, resulting in $$1123$$. Using the above method, obtain an integer with $$2018$$ digits $$112358134711\ldots$$. What is the sum of the digits of this integer?

4845.content: Observe the following equations and answer the question: What is $${{2}^{10}}$$?

4846.content: Observe the following equations and answer the question: What is the unit digit of $${{2}^{100}}$$?

4847.content: Observe the following calculations and answer the question: What is the unit digit of $${{2}^{2018}}$$?

4849.content: January 1, 2021, is what day of the week?

4850.content: What day of the week is May 1, 2021?

4851.content: What day of the week is May 1, 2024, if October 7, 2020, is a Wednesday?

4852.content: If January 1, 2012, is a Sunday, then what day of the week is May 1, 2020?

4853.content: October 1, 2019, is the 70th National Day, and that day is exactly Tuesday. What day of the week was October 1, 1949?

4854.content: Complete the following questions: A certain month has $$31$$ days, with $$4$$ Tuesdays and $$4$$ Fridays. What day of the week is the $$20$$th of that month?

4855.content: If Xiao Xin goes to exercise for the first time on Monday, and after each session he waits for an incrementally increasing number of days (1 day after the first session, 2 days after the second session, 3 days after the third session, and so on), what day of the week will it be when Xiao Xin goes for the 10th time?

4856.content: There are $$2018$$ students lined up in a row, following these counting rules: If a student calls out a single-digit number, the next student must call out the sum of that number and $$9$$; if a student calls out a two-digit number, the next student must call out the sum of the unit digit of that number and $$6$$. If the first student calls out $$1$$, what number will the last student call out?

4857.content: As shown in the figure, the text in each row of the table repeats in a cycle: the first row is the "Riemann Hypothesis" with $$4$$ Chinese characters repeating, the second row is the "Poincaré Conjecture" with $$5$$ Chinese characters repeating, and the third row is the "Goldbach Conjecture" with $$6$$ Chinese characters repeating. Which $$3$$ Chinese characters appear in the $$200$$th column from top to bottom?

4858.content: April 1, 2020, is a Wednesday, what day of the week is August 20, 2019?

4859.content: $$100$$ students line up from left to right, and then they count off from left to right according to a rule: the first student says $$1$$, and then starting from the second student, each student multiplies the number reported by the previous student by $$7$$ and reports the units digit of the product. What does the $$100$$th student say?
4859.kc: 求第几个数是多少问题

4860.content: In the zoo, there are a total of $$55$$ ostriches and zebras living on the same grassland. The number of legs of the ostriches is $$14$$ more than that of the zebras. How many zebras are there, and how many ostriches are there?

4861.content: Answer the following question: The distance between point $$A$$ and point $$B$$ is $$4800$$ meters. If person A walks $$60$$ meters per minute, how many minutes does it take for person A to walk from $$A$$ to $$B$$?

4862.content: Answer the following question: Cities $$A$$ and $$B$$ are $$300$$ kilometers apart. A car was originally planned to travel from city $$A$$ to city $$B$$ in $$6$$ hours. How many kilometers should the car travel on average per hour?

4863.content: Solve the following problem: A car travels $$150$$ kilometers in $$3$$ hours. At this speed, how many hours will it take to travel $$500$$ kilometers?

4864.content: At a walking speed of $$20$$ meters per minute, how many minutes does Dakuan need to walk $$100$$ meters?

4865.content: Da Kuan walks $$20$$ meters per minute. If Da Kuan briskly walks $$300$$ meters in $$3$$ minutes, what is the average distance he covers per minute during this brisk walk?

4866.content: How many meters can Da Kuan walk in $$3$$ minutes if he walks $$20$$ meters per minute?

4867.content: Eddie and Weir set off from the base together to visit Max Forest Park. The speed of the car on the way there was $$80$$ kilometers per hour, and it took $$3$$ hours to reach the destination. If the speed of the car on the way back is $$120$$ kilometers per hour, how many hours will it take to return to the base after leaving the forest park?

4868.content: Eddie and Veer set off from the base together to visit Max Forest Park. On the way there, the car's speed was $$80$$ km/h, and it took $$3$$ hours to reach the destination. On the way back, it started to rain lightly, and the car took $$6$$ hours to return to the base. What was the speed of the car in km/h on the way back?

4869.content: The distance between Point A and Point B is $$3000$$ meters. The doctor plans to ride a bicycle for $$20$$ minutes to reach Point B. Just as he is about to start, the bicycle breaks down, causing a delay of $$5$$ minutes. If he wants to arrive at Point B on time, how many meters should he ride per minute?

4870.content: The distance between locations A and B is $$200$$ kilometers. Wei Er first took $$15$$ hours to walk $$120$$ kilometers. After taking a break, how many more hours does she need to reach location B at the same speed?

4871.content: According to the requirements, complete the following questions. If $$5$$ workers can produce $$80$$ parts in $$2$$ hours, how many parts can $$15$$ workers produce in $$6$$ hours?

4872.content: Complete the following questions as required. If $$5$$ workers can produce $$80$$ parts in $$2$$ hours, how many parts can $$4$$ workers produce in $$7$$ hours?

4873.content: According to the requirements, complete the following questions. If $$3$$ monkeys eat $$40$$ peaches in $$2$$ days, how many peaches do $$8$$ monkeys eat in $$9$$ days?

4874.content: The engineering team originally planned to use $$60$$ people for $$5$$ days to complete a $$4800$$ meter long road. In reality, they increased the workforce by $$40$$ people at the start, and each person actually repaired $$8$$ meters more per day than originally planned. How many days will it actually take to complete the road?

4875.content: The aquarium prepared $$230$$ kilograms of fish for the $$8$$ seals. In the first two days, the $$8$$ seals ate a total of $$80$$ kilograms of fish. After two days, $$2$$ of the seals were taken away. If each seal eats the same amount of fish each day, how many days can the remaining fish feed the seals that are left?

4876.content: Five workers need to process $$735$$ parts. In the first $$2$$ days, they have processed $$135$$ parts. It is known that one worker was absent for $$1$$ day during these $$2$$ days. If each worker processes an equal number of parts each day and no one else takes leave in the following days, how many more days will it take to complete the task?

4877.content: The factory needs to complete the assembly of a batch of tape recorders, and has already assembled $$635$$ units. If they assemble $$2$$ more units each day than before, they will need $$40$$ days to complete it, but on the last day, they will assemble $$5$$ fewer units. If they continue to work at the original efficiency, they will need to work an extra $$3$$ days. How many tape recorders does this workshop need to assemble in total?

4878.content: It is known that $$3$$ exemplary workers and $$6$$ ordinary workers can produce $$360$$ parts in $$4$$ hours. Now there is a batch of production tasks that requires $$6$$ exemplary workers and $$12$$ ordinary workers to complete in $$10$$ hours. If they work for $$3$$ hours and then $$1$$ exemplary worker and $$2$$ ordinary workers arrive, how many hours can they finish the task ahead of schedule?

4879.content: A deep-sea ship has a total of $$30$$ crew members, and the fresh water on board can supply all crew members for $$40$$ days. After the ship leaves port for $$10$$ days, it rescues $$15$$ stranded foreign sailors at sea. If each person uses the same amount of fresh water each day, how many more days can the remaining fresh water supply the people on the ship?

4880.content: How many rectangles (including squares) are there in the figure?

4881.content: $$20$$ nails form a $$4 \times 5$$ grid. Using $$4$$ of these nails as vertices, how many different squares can be formed with rubber bands?

4882.content: Please identify the pattern for each term in the following expressions and fill in the blanks: (2) The $$1$$st term is $$2$$, the $$2$$nd term is $$4$$, the $$3$$rd term is $$8$$, the $$4$$th term is $$16$$, $$ \cdots $$ what is the $$n$$th term?

4883.content: In the figure, quadrilateral $$ABCD$$ is a right trapezoid, which is divided into two identical small right trapezoids and one parallelogram. It is known that the length of $$CD$$ is $$5$$, the length of $$AB$$ is $$15$$, and the area of trapezoid $$ABCD$$ is a multiple of the area of parallelogram $$DCFM$$. What is the multiple?

4884.content: An ant is at point $$A$$ on a square grid paper, and it wants to go to point $$B$$ along the grid lines to play, but it doesn't know which route is the shortest. Kids, can you find a different shortest route for it?

4885.content: If the little bee can only enter a larger room from a smaller room, how many ways can the little bee go from room $$1$$ to room $$7$$?

4886.content: The phrase "I love learning and thinking" in the figure has a different way of reading.

4887.content: As shown in the figure, starting from point $$A$$ to point $$B$$, how many different shortest routes are there?

4888.content: As shown in the figure, there is a chess piece that needs to move from the bottom left corner to the top right corner. Each step can only move one square to the right, up, or diagonally up to the right. How many different ways are there to move?

4889.content: A bee starts from point $$A$$ and returns to point $$B$$. Each time it can only crawl to the right neighboring hive and cannot move backwards. How many ways are there to return home?

4890.content: In a chess match between person $$A$$ and person $$B$$, there are no draws, and the first person to win three more games than the other wins the match. The number of little white rabbits that like to eat carrots is $$2$$ times the number of those that like to eat cabbage, while the number of little white rabbits that do not like to eat cabbage is $$3$$ times the number of those that do not like to eat carrots. Among them, there is one little white rabbit that likes to eat both carrots and cabbage.

5015.content: Three explorers set out together to explore the primeval forest. On the way, they found the journey quite boring, so they gathered to play cards. In the third round, A and C won again, causing the money in both of their bags to double once more. As a result, each of the three explorers won two rounds and lost one round, and in the end, all three had exactly the same amount of money. Careful A counted the money in his bag and found that he lost $$100$$ yuan. What amount of money did A start with, what amount did B start with, and what amount did C start with?

5458.content: It is known that Dad is $$6$$ years older than Mom. Two years ago, the sum of Dad and Mom's ages was $$7$$ times that of their son. Three years later, the sum of Dad and Mom's ages will be $$5$$ times that of their son plus $$9$$ years. How old was Mom two years ago?

5459.content: A says to B: "When my age is the same as your current age, you were only $$5$$ years old." B says to A: "When my age is the same as your current age, you will be $$50$$ years old." What are A's current age and B's current age?

5460.content: As shown in the figure, a large square is formed by using $$6$$ identical small rectangles, and the perimeter of the large square is $$48$$ centimeters. What is the perimeter of the small rectangle in centimeters?

5461.content: As shown in the figure, there are $$4$$ paths with a width of $$1$$ meter constructed in a square flower bed with a side length of $$8$$ meters (the shaded part in the figure). What is the area of the flower bed (the unshaded part) in square meters?

5462.content: As shown in the figure, if the lengths of two adjacent sides of a square are each increased by $$2$$ centimeters, the area increases by $$40$$ square centimeters. What is the perimeter of the original square in centimeters?

5463.content: In the same plane, how many straight lines can be determined by any $$4$$ points? Try to draw it. What is your answer?

5464.content: There are a total of $$6$$ straight lines and $$11$$ intersection points in the figure. If $$1$$ straight line is removed, the number of intersection points decreases by $$5$$. Which numbered straight line is removed?

5465.content: In the figure, there are $$5$$ points that can draw $$6$$ straight lines. If another point is added to the figure, how many different lines can you think of that can be added?

5466.content: The teacher distributes candies to the students. If each person receives $$9$$ candies, there are $$2$$ candies short; if each person receives $$11$$ candies, there are $$14$$ candies short. How many students are there in total, and how many candies did the teacher prepare?

5467.content: The teacher distributes candies to the students. If each person receives $$4$$ candies, there are $$17$$ left; if each person receives $$7$$ candies, there are $$10$$ candies short. How many students are there in total, and how many candies did the teacher prepare?
5467.kc: 盈亏基本类型盈亏问题

5468.content: The Monkey King distributes peaches to the little monkeys. If he gives each little monkey $$4$$ peaches, he will have $$5$$ peaches left over; if he gives each little monkey $$5$$ peaches, he will be short of $$4$$ peaches. How many little monkeys are there in total, and how many peaches did the Monkey King prepare?
5468.kc: 盈亏基本类型盈亏问题

5469.content: There are some envelopes and sheets of paper on the desk. If each letter uses $$2$$ sheets of paper, there are $$20$$ sheets of paper left after using all the envelopes; if each letter uses $$3$$ sheets of paper, there are $$10$$ envelopes left after using all the paper. How many sheets of paper and how many envelopes are there on the desk?

5470.content: The coach distributed some badminton shuttlecocks to several athletes. Each person received $$5$$ shuttlecocks, with $$10$$ left over; if the number of people tripled and each person wanted $$2$$ shuttlecocks, there would be $$8$$ shuttlecocks short. How many shuttlecocks did the coach prepare in total?

5471.content: The Olympic venues implement waste classification. Five garbage bins are placed in each location, labeled from left to right as: batteries, plastics, waste paper, aluminum cans, and non-recyclable. Now, you need to dye the five garbage bins in one of the three colors: red, green, or blue, with the requirement that adjacent bins must be different colors, and the bin for recycling waste paper cannot be dyed red. How many coloring methods are there in total?

5472.content: There are $$10$$ stops between Beijing and Guangzhou, of which only two are major stops (not including Beijing and Guangzhou). Vehicles departing from the major stops can provide sleeping berths, so how many different sleeping berth tickets should the railway bureau prepare?

5473.content: The digital clock shows the time from $$00:00:00$$ to $$23:59:59$$, and it changes every $$1$$ second. During a day, how many moments are there when the sequence of numbers can be read the same from left to right and from right to left?

5475.content: There are four types of calculation devices: Device A: multiplies the input number by $$5$$; Device B: adds $$3$$ to the input number; Device C: divides the input number by $$4$$; Device D: subtracts $$6$$ from the input number. These devices can be connected, for example, if Device A is connected to Device B, it is written as $$A\bullet B$$. If the input is $$4$$, the result is $$23$$; if Device B is connected to Device A, written as $$B\bullet A$$, and the input is $$4$$, the result is $$35$$. What is the result when the devices $$A\bullet C\bullet D$$ are connected with an input of $$28$$?

5478.content: It is known that the 5th term of an arithmetic sequence is $$34$$ and the 15th term is $$104$$. What is the 10th term of this arithmetic sequence?

5479.content: An arithmetic sequence has a total of $5$ numbers and a sum of $45$. What is the third number in this arithmetic sequence?

5480.content: In a certain school, there are $$162$$ fifth-grade students who want to go boating. It is known that a large boat that can accommodate $$7$$ people costs $$100$$ yuan each, and a small boat that can accommodate $$5$$ people costs $$75$$ yuan each. What is the minimum amount of money that these $$162$$ students need to spend to ensure everyone gets on a boat?

5481.content: There are five lathes in the workshop that are malfunctioning simultaneously. The repair times for the first to the fifth lathe are $$8$$ minutes, $$20$$ minutes, $$7$$ minutes, $$15$$ minutes, and $$10$$ minutes respectively. How should the two repairmen, who have the same work efficiency, be arranged to minimize the total time from the start of repairs to the end of repairs? What is the shortest time in minutes?

5482.content: A natural gas station (represented by point $$O$$) needs to install gas pipelines to the seven residential areas $$A$$ to $$G$$ located on a circular line. The distances between each pair of residential areas are shown in the figure below (unit: kilometers). There are two specifications for the pipelines: the thick pipe can supply gas to all $$7$$ residential areas at a cost of $$8000$$ yuan per kilometer, while the thin pipe can only supply gas to one residential area at a cost of $$3000$$ yuan per kilometer. The connection point between the thick and thin pipes must be within the residential areas. How should these two types of pipelines be combined to minimize costs? What is the minimum cost in yuan?

5483.content: As shown in the figure: The numbers marked on the left side of each row and the top side of each column represent the number of consecutive black squares in that row or column. Can you, children, use these numbers to mark all the black squares?

5484.content: As shown in the figure: the numbers marked on the left of each row and above each column represent the number of consecutive black squares in that row or column. Can you, children, mark all the black squares based on these numbers?

5485.content: As shown in the figure: The numbers marked on the left of each row and at the top of each column represent the number of consecutive black squares in that row or column. Can you, children, use these numbers to mark all the black squares?

5486.content: As shown in the figure: The numbers marked on the left side of each row and the top side of each column represent the number of consecutive black squares in that row or column. Can you label all the black squares based on these numbers?

5487.content: As shown in the figure: The numbers marked on the left of each row and above each column represent the number of consecutive black squares in that row or column. Can you, kids, mark all the black squares based on these numbers?

5488.content: In a certain school, there are a total of $$123$$ students in the third grade, and they all subscribed to one or more of the following four publications: "Mathematics World," "Math Enthusiast," "Elementary School Math Newspaper," and "Intellectual World" (up to $$4$$ can be subscribed to). Is there at least one student whose subscribed publications are exactly the same as another student's?

5489.content: A deck of cards has $$54$$ cards. How many cards must be drawn to ensure that there are at least $$2$$ clubs and $$3$$ hearts?

5490.content: In a pocket, there are several red, yellow, and blue balls. Xiao Congming and a few other children are playing a game, and each person can randomly take out $$2$$ balls from the pocket. No matter how they choose, there will always be two children who have taken out balls of the same color. What is the minimum number of children playing the game?

5491.content: In the pocket, there are some balls of the same size and shape: there are $$8$$ red balls, $$12$$ yellow balls, and $$15$$ white balls. How many balls must be taken to ensure that there are at least $$3$$ balls of one color and at least $$7$$ balls of another color?

5492.content: The kindergarten bought many plastic toys of cows, horses, sheep, and dogs. Each child can choose two toys of different types, but not the same. How many children must go to ensure that at least two of them have the same combination of toys?

5493.content: In a certain school, there are $$55$$ students participating in a competition. It is known that if the participants are divided into four groups, there will definitely be one group with more than $$2$$ girls. It is also known that among any $$10$$ participants, there must be at least one boy. What is the number of boys participating in the competition?

5494.content: There are $$4$$ different brands of basketballs, each with $$10$$ balls. How many balls must one blindly pick to ensure that there are at least $$4$$ balls of the same brand?

5495.content: In a certain math and English test, all participants' scores are natural numbers, with the highest score being $$198$$ and the lowest score being $$169$$. No one scored $$193$$, $$185$$, or $$177$$, and at least $$6$$ people scored the same score. What is the minimum number of participants in the test?

5496.content: If Xiao Ming walks $$40$$ meters per minute from home to school, he will be late by $$2$$ minutes; if he walks $$50$$ meters per minute, he will arrive $$4$$ minutes early. How many meters is it from Xiao Ming's home to school?

5497.content: There are $$10$$ students (one is the captain, and $$9$$ are team members) who formed a team to participate in a math competition and won first place. The organizing committee decided to award each team member $$200$$ yuan as a bonus, and the captain received $$90$$ yuan more than the average bonus received by the $$10$$ players. What is the bonus received by the captain?

5498.content: In a test, the average score of boys is $$2$$ points higher than the overall average score, while the average score of girls is $$1$$ point lower than the overall average score. The total score of boys is $$942$$ points, and the total score of girls is $$1800$$ points. How many boys are there?

5499.content: Xiao Bai and Xiao Hua saw a magical worm that doubles in size every hour. If it can grow to $$20$$ centimeters in $$1$$ day, how many hours does it take for the worm to grow to $$5$$ centimeters?

5500.content: The shepherd drives a flock of sheep across $$10$$ rivers. Each time they cross a river, one-third of the sheep fall into the river, and he retrieves $$3$$ each time. In the end, there are $$9$$ sheep left. How many sheep were there in total before crossing the rivers?

5501.content: Da Mao, Er Mao, and San Mao share $$48$$ apples, and each person's amount of apples equals their age in $$2$$ years. If San Mao gives half of his apples to Da Mao and Er Mao, then Er Mao splits half of his remaining apples with Da Mao and San Mao, and finally, Da Mao splits half of his remaining apples with Er Mao and San Mao, and at this point, each person has the same number of apples, what are the current ages of Da Mao, Er Mao, and San Mao?

5502.content: A and B each have some pieces of candy, and A has fewer pieces of candy than B. In each operation, the person with more candy gives some to the person with less candy, doubling the amount of candy the latter has. After $$2017$$ such operations, A has $$10$$ pieces of candy, and B has $$8$$ pieces of candy. What were the original amounts of candy for both of them? How many pieces of candy did A originally have, and how many pieces of candy did B originally have?

5503.content: What is the unit digit of $$3 \times 13 \times 23 \times 33 \times \ldots \times 2013$$?

5504.content: There are five lamps $$A$$, $$B$$, $$C$$, $$D$$, and $$E$$, each equipped with a pull switch. Initially, lamps $$B$$, $$D$$, and $$E$$ are on. A child pulls the switches in the order of $$A$$, $$B$$, $$C$$, $$D$$, and $$E$$ a total of $$104$$ times. Which lamps are on at this time?

5505.content: If Xiao Xin goes to exercise for the first time on Monday, and after each session he waits for an incrementally increasing number of days (1 day after the first session, 2 days after the second session, 3 days after the third session, and so on), what day of the week will it be when Xiao Xin goes for the 10th time?

5506.content: In the figure below, there are $$16$$ chairs arranged in a circle, numbered from $$1$$ to $$16$$. Now, a person starts from chair $$1$$ and moves clockwise $$328$$ steps, then counterclockwise $$485$$ steps, then clockwise $$485$$ steps, then counterclockwise $$328$$ steps, and finally moves clockwise $$136$$ steps. Which chair does he end up at?

5507.content: Xiao Ming's birthday is Tuesday, July 1, 1997. What day of the week will it be when he turns twenty-two on July 1, 2019?

5508.content: Boss Wang purchased a batch of clothing, which includes three styles: A, B, and C. Each set of style A costs $$80$$ yuan, each set of style B costs $$50$$ yuan, and each set of style C costs $$20$$ yuan. Boss Wang purchased a total of $$47$$ sets of clothing, spending a total of $$2440$$ yuan. It is known that the number of sets of style B purchased is twice that of style C. How many sets of style A, style B, and style C did Boss Wang purchase?

5509.content: Lele Department Store entrusted a moving station to transport $$100$$ vases. Both parties agreed on a shipping fee of $$1$$ per vase, but if any vase is damaged, not only is the shipping fee not paid for that vase, but there is also a compensation of $$1$$ for each broken vase. As a result, the moving station received a total shipping fee of $$92$$. How many vases were broken during the transportation?

5510.content: There are two types of camels: the single-humped camel with one hump on its back, and the double-humped camel with two humps on its back. The single-humped camel is taller and has longer legs, capable of walking and running in the desert; the double-humped camel has short, thick legs, making it more suitable for walking on gravel and snow. There is a group of camels with a total of $$23$$ humps and $$60$$ legs. How many camels are there in total, and how many of them are double-humped camels?

5511.content: A document takes $$12$$ hours for A to type alone and $$20$$ hours for B to type alone. Now, after A types alone for a certain number of hours, B finishes it because of some matters, and together they took $$14$$ hours. How many hours did A type?

5512.content: In a certain class, there were $$10$$ instances of students finishing in the top three during the sports meeting. It is known that the first place earns $$9$$ points, the second place earns $$5$$ points, and the third place earns $$2$$ points, while other placements do not earn points. The class scored a total of $$64$$ points. What is the maximum number of instances for which students could have placed first?

5513.content: In a forest on planet $$X$$, there lives a group of rabbits, among which are some rare mutant rabbits. It is known that ordinary rabbits have one head and four legs, while mutant rabbits have three heads and two legs. Given that all the rabbits together have $$53$$ heads and $$102$$ legs, how many rabbits (including mutant rabbits) are there in total?

5514.content: Three big monks and five little monks can eat $$12$$ buns in one day. How many buns can nine big monks and fifteen little monks eat in one day, and how many buns can twelve big monks and twenty little monks eat in three days?

5515.content: A construction team plans to complete a canal in $$30$$ days. After $$18$$ people worked for $$12$$ days, they finished half of the project. At this rate, how many more people need to be added to finish the project $$9$$ days early?

5516.content: Jia starts from point $$A$$ and walks towards $$B$$ at a constant speed. Meanwhile, Yi and Bing start from point $$B$$ and walk towards $$A$$ at a constant speed. Jia and Yi meet at point $$C$$ along the way. When Jia meets Bing, Yi just arrives at $$A$$. When Jia reaches $$B$$, Bing also just arrives at $$A$$. If Jia starts $$5$$ minutes late, then the distance from the meeting point of Jia and Yi to point $$C$$ is $$160$$ meters. What is Jia's speed in meters per minute?

5517.content: The figure below is a square made up of $$8$$ rectangles each measuring $$2$$ cm by $$1$$ cm. Starting from point $$A$$ and moving along the grid lines to point $$B$$, without taking any repeated paths, what is the maximum distance in centimeters that can be traveled?

5519.kc: 整数利用积/商不变性质

5520.content: The symbol “$$\odot $$” defines a new operation. It is known that $$1\odot 4=5$$; $$2\odot 3=7$$; $$4\odot 1=17$$; $$3\odot 2=11$$; $$\ldots \ldots $$ (2) What is $$(1\odot 10)\odot 10$$, and what is $$1\odot (10\odot 10)$$?

5521.content: $$30$$ students are lined up in a row from shortest to tallest, with the height difference between any two adjacent students being the same. The sum of the heights of the first $$10$$ students is $$1250$$ centimeters, and the sum of the heights of the first $$20$$ students is $$2650$$ centimeters. What is the total height of these $$30$$ students in centimeters?

5522.content: In a math exam, there are only $$20$$ questions. For each correct answer, you get $$5$$ points, and for each incorrect answer or unanswered question, you lose $$3$$ points. Wei Er did not pass this time, but she found that if she had one less incorrect answer, she would just pass. How many questions did she answer correctly?

5523.content: Now there are six beasts with four legs and four birds with two legs. There are seventy-six heads above and forty-six legs below. How many birds and beasts are there? (From "Sun Zi's Calculus")

5524.content: As shown in the figure, the diamond-shaped paper pieces are arranged in a pattern according to a rule. From the figure, it is known that the first pattern has $$5$$ diamond-shaped paper pieces; the second pattern has $$9$$ diamond-shaped paper pieces; the third pattern has $$13$$ diamond-shaped paper pieces. Following this rule, how many diamond-shaped paper pieces are there in the sixth pattern?

5542.content: The diagram shows a $$5\times 5$$ area with $$5$$ trees. Now, it is required to set up tents on the empty spaces without planting trees, and the tents must be placed next to the trees. Any two tents cannot occupy adjacent squares, and the number of tents in each row is indicated on the far right, while the number of tents in each column is shown at the bottom. In which row is the tent in the first column located?

5543.content: A page in the middle of a book was torn out, and the sum of the page numbers of the remaining pages is $$5027$$. What are the two page numbers on the torn page? (Fill in from smallest to largest)

5544.content: In quadrilateral $$ABCD$$, point $$E$$ is the midpoint of side $$AB$$, and point $$F$$ is the midpoint of side $$CD$$. Given that the area of quadrilateral $$ABCD$$ is $$96$$ square centimeters, what is the area of the shaded part in square centimeters?

5545.content: In the figure, a large square and a small square have side lengths of $$4$$ cm and $$3$$ cm respectively. What is the area of the shaded part in square centimeters?

5546.content: [Thinking Expansion] There is an arithmetic sequence whose sum of the first $$7$$ terms is $$105$$ and the first term is $$3$$. What is the common difference?

5547.content: The value of A is $$42.62$$, and B is $$4.1$$ more than A. What is the value of B?

5548.content: 【Thinking Extension】As shown in the figure, the area of triangle $$ABC$$ is $$600$$ square centimeters, point $$D$$ is the midpoint of $$BC$$, and $$ED$$ is $$2$$ times that of $$AE$$. What is the area of triangle $$ABE$$ in square centimeters?
5548.kc: 等高模型正用一次应用

5549.content: 【Thinking Expansion】Eddie, Weier, and Dakuan agreed to play at the amusement park, which has a total of $$50$$ attractions. It is known that Eddie participated in $$42$$ attractions, Weier participated in $$35$$ attractions, and Dakuan participated in $$31$$ attractions. What is the minimum number of attractions that Eddie, Weier, and Dakuan all participated in?

5550.content: Perform the division in vertical format: $$420 \div 5$$ = $$540 \div 3$$ = ?

5551.content: Doctor, Eddie, and Weier are passing the ball to each other, starting with the Doctor. After $$4$$ passes, the ball reaches Eddie's hands. How many different passing methods are there?

5552.content: There is a sequence of numbers arranged in the order of $$385161713851617138516171\cdots \cdots$$. Please answer the following: (1) What is the $$50$$th digit? (2) How many times does "$$1$$" appear among these $$50$$ digits? (3) What is the sum of these $$50$$ digits?

5553.content: Given that $$7 \times 11 \times 13 = 1001$$, calculate the values of the following expressions: (1) What is $$7 \times 9 \times 11 \times 13$$? (2) What is $$14 \times 22 \times 26$$?

5554.content: Is the sum of the expression $$1+3+5+7+9$$ odd or even?

5555.content: The following is a calendar for January $$2020$$. Answer the questions and summarize the patterns: (1) How many days are there from January $$1$$, $$2020$$ to January $$22$$, $$2020$$? (2) How many days are there from January $$5$$, $$2020$$ to January $$15$$, $$2020$$? (3) How many days are there from January $$5$$, $$2020$$ to February $$10$$, $$2020$$?
5555.kc: 长方形数表中日期周期

5556.content: October 1, 2020, is a Thursday. What day of the week will it be on the 25th day from this date?

5557.content: Doctor is conducting an experiment and records the water temperature at regular intervals, with the results shown in the table below: Temperature change statistics when heating water. Heating time (minutes) $$0$$ $$2$$ $$4$$ $$6$$ $$8$$ $$10$$ $$12$$ Water temperature ($${}^\circ \text{C}$$) $$26$$ $$32$$ $$50$$ $$70$$ $$85$$ $$90$$ $$100$$ Based on the data in the table, answer the following questions: (1) What is the water temperature before heating in $${}^\circ \text{C}$$? (2) After heating for $$10$$ minutes, what is the water temperature in $${}^\circ \text{C}$$? (3) How many minutes did it take to heat the water from $$50{}^\circ \text{C}$$ to $$85{}^\circ \text{C}$$? (4) Estimate the water temperature after heating for how many minutes to reach approximately $$60{}^\circ \text{C}$$?

5558.content: Class Two needs to select a park for the "June 1st" Children's Day outing. The voting results of the whole class are shown in the figure. (1) Complete the statistical table: Park Name: People's Park, Zoo, Botanical Garden, Water Park; Number of People: (2) How many people are there in Class Two in total?

5559.content: There are a total of $$36$$ rabbits in two cages. If $$8$$ rabbits are taken from the first cage and put into the second cage, the number of rabbits in both cages will be the same. How many rabbits are in the first cage, and how many are in the second cage?

5560.content: Given that the diagonals of quadrilateral $$ABCD$$ are perpendicular to each other and the area of the quadrilateral is $$80$$ square centimeters, with $$AC=10$$ centimeters, what is the length of $$BD$$ in centimeters?
5560.kc: 两条对角线垂直的四边形的面积求法

5561.content: As shown in the figure, a large rectangle is divided into $$9$$ smaller rectangles, among which $$3$$ small rectangles have areas shown in the figure (unit: square centimeters). (1) Can the small rectangle with an area of $$45$$ and the small rectangle with an area of $$20$$ be combined into a large rectangle by translation? (2) What is the area of the rectangle represented by "☆" in square centimeters?

5562.content: Wang Fang and Li Hua walked away from the same place at the same time after training in the evening. Wang Fang walks $$64$$ meters per minute, and Li Hua walks $$75$$ meters per minute. Wang Fang reaches home after $$20$$ minutes, while Li Hua reaches home after a total of $$25$$ minutes. How far apart are their homes?

5563.content: Two cars, A and B, start from the same place and drive in opposite directions. Car A travels at a speed of $$100$$ kilometers per hour, while Car B travels at a speed of $$120$$ kilometers per hour. After $$3$$ hours, how far apart are cars A and B? $$100 + 120 \times 3 = 460$$ (kilometers).

5578.content: A book has a total of $$16$$ pages. How many digits are used in the page numbers from $$1$$ to $$16$$?

5579.content: In a car dealership, there are $$65$$ cars, of which $$45$$ have air conditioning, $$30$$ have high-end audio systems, and $$12$$ have both air conditioning and high-end audio systems. How many cars have neither air conditioning nor high-end audio systems?

5580.content: In Class Four, among the boys, there are $$16$$ who like basketball, $$21$$ who like soccer, $$7$$ who like volleyball, $$10$$ who like both basketball and soccer, $$3$$ who like both basketball and volleyball, $$4$$ who like both soccer and volleyball, $$3$$ who like all three sports, and $$5$$ who do not like any of the three sports. How many boys are there in Class Four?

5581.content: In Class 6 (Class $$5$$) of Hongqi Primary School, there are $$15$$ people, and at least some of them were born in the same month.

5582.content: When placing $$7$$ kittens into $$3$$ cages, no matter how they are distributed, how many kittens will always be in at least one cage?

How many people do not have any of these three hobbies?

5594.content: Xiao Su and Xiao Feng are playing roller skating together. They set off from home at the same time. Xiao Su's speed is $$40$$ meters/minute, and Xiao Feng's speed is $$50$$ meters/minute. On the way, Xiao Su accidentally fell and was delayed for $$5$$ minutes before continuing forward. After a while, they met. It is known that Xiao Feng took $$30$$ minutes from home to meet. What is the distance between Xiao Su and Xiao Feng's homes in meters?

5595.content: Beibei and Huahuan drove towards each other from two cities that are $$600$$ kilometers apart and met after $$5$$ hours. Beibei's car travels $$20$$ kilometers per hour more than Huahuan's car. What is the speed of Huahuan's car in kilometers per hour?

5596.content: Xiao Ming went to a park $$400$$ meters away from home to walk the dog. After finishing, he was about to go home when his mom set off from home to the park. Xiao Ming's speed is $$10$$ meters/minute, his mom's speed is $$15$$ meters/minute, and the dog's speed is $$30$$ meters/minute. After the dog meets the mom, it continuously runs back and forth between Xiao Ming and his mom at the same speed. When Xiao Ming meets his mom, how many meters has the dog run in total?

5597.content: The distance between points $$A$$ and $$B$$ is $$400$$ kilometers. Cars A and B start from both locations and drive towards each other at the same time, with Car A traveling at $$35$$ kilometers per hour and Car B at $$45$$ kilometers per hour. A pigeon starts flying towards Car B at a speed of $$50$$ kilometers per hour at the same time as Car A departs. The pigeon flies to meet Car B, then turns back to fly towards Car A, meets Car A, and then flies back towards Car B, continuing this back-and-forth flight. How far does the pigeon fly when the two cars meet?

5598.content: A and B are traveling towards each other from two locations that are $$794$$ kilometers apart. A travels at $$52$$ kilometers per hour, and B travels at $$42$$ kilometers per hour. A has traveled $$416$$ kilometers when they meet. How many hours earlier did B depart than A?

How many peach trees, pear trees, and apple trees are there respectively?

5624.content: Four teams A, B, C, and D are competing in a soccer match, and each team must play one match against the other three teams. According to the rules: the winning team of each match gets $$3$$ points; the losing team gets $$0$$ points; if both teams draw, each team gets $$1$$ point. It is known that: (1) the total score of these four teams over three matches is four consecutive odd numbers; (2) Team B ranks first in total score; (3) Team D has exactly two matches that ended in a draw, one of which was against Team C. Based on the above conditions, which team ranks fourth in total score?

5625.content: In a basketball team of six people, the average height of all members is $$150$$ centimeters. The average height of four team members is $$2$$ centimeters lower than the team's average height. What is the average height of the other two team members?

5626.content: In several exams, the average score of the whole class is $$90$$ points, the average score of the boys is $$88$$ points, and the average score of the girls is $$95$$ points. Given that there are $$20$$ boys, how many girls are there?

If it can only move forward and cannot go backward, and it cannot crawl along the same edge twice, what is the maximum distance it can crawl in decimeters?

5628.content: In the figure, circles represent rooms, solid lines represent above-ground passages, and dashed lines represent underground passages. Initially, a police officer and a thief are in two different rooms. Each time, the police officer moves from his room to an adjacent room along the above-ground passage; at the same time, the thief moves from his room to an adjacent room along the underground passage. If the police officer and the thief do not meet in any room after moving $$3$$ times, how many different ways can they walk?

5629.content: Once upon a time, there was a kingdom where the king and the general both loved horse racing. They agreed to hold a race. Each of them would bring four horses, categorized into first, second, third, and fourth places; and these eight horses, from fastest to slowest, are the king's first horse, the general's first horse, the king's second horse, the general's second horse, the king's third horse, the general's third horse, the king's fourth horse, and the general's fourth horse. If the king's horses race in the order of first, second, third, and fourth, how can the general arrange the order of his horses to ensure that he wins at least two races?

5630.content: In the figure, $$ABCDEF$$ is a regular hexagon. A frog starts at vertex $$A$$ and can jump to one of the two adjacent vertices each time. If it reaches point $$D$$ within $$4$$ jumps, it stops jumping (for example: $$A-B-C-D$$); if it cannot reach point $$D$$ within $$4$$ jumps, it will stop jumping after $$4$$ jumps as well (for example: $$A-B-C-B-A$$). How many different jumping methods are possible for the frog from the start to the stop?

5633.content: There are three granaries, A, B, and C, which together store a total of $$1700$$ tons of rice. Granary A has $$900$$ tons less than the combined amount of granaries B and C, and granary B has $$300$$ tons more than granary C. How many tons of rice does granary B store?

5634.content: A certain school plans to plant a total of $$240$$ trees, including poplar trees, willow trees, and locust trees. It is known that the number of poplar trees is $$3$$ times that of willow trees plus $$8$$, and the number of locust trees is $$2$$ times that of poplar trees minus $$14$$. How many poplar trees, willow trees, and locust trees were originally planned to be planted?

5635.content: The school's library bookshelf has a batch of books on its upper and lower shelves. If there are $$8$$ fewer books on the upper shelf, the number of books on both shelves would be the same. If there are $$8$$ fewer books on the lower shelf, the number of books on the upper shelf would be twice that of the lower shelf. What was the original number of books on the upper shelf and the lower shelf?

If he plants a certain number of magical trees on the first day, the number of trees planted on the second day is $$2$$ times the number planted on the first day plus $$2$$ trees, and the number of trees planted on the third day is $$3$$ times the number planted on the first day plus $$3$$ trees. After planting on the third day (before the night passes), all the magical trees together yield $$277$$ magical fruits. How many magical trees did he plant on the first day?

5638.content: There are two candles of different thicknesses but the same length. (4) How much did the whole first elementary school donate in total?

Dad is $$36$$ years older than Xiao Ming, and this year dad's age is $$4$$ times Xiao Ming's age. How old is dad this year?

5697.content: The number of积分 cards that A has is $$7$$ times that of B. After A gives B $$24$$ cards, they have the same amount. How many cards did A originally have?

5699.content: Li Bai went to buy wine with a pot, he encountered a shop and drank double, saw flowers and drank eight taels. After encountering the shop and the flowers three times, he drank all the wine in the pot. How much wine was originally in the pot?

5700.content: There are a total of $$27$$ birds on three trees. If $$2$$ birds fly from the first tree to the second tree, $$3$$ birds fly from the second tree to the third tree, and $$4$$ birds fly from the third tree to the first tree, then there are the same number of birds on each tree. How many birds were originally on each tree?

5701.content: Three people, A, B, and C, went fishing together. They put the fish they caught into a basket and then lay down to rest, eventually falling asleep. A woke up first and divided the fish in the basket into $$3$$ equal parts, finding that there was $$1$$ fish left over. He threw the extra fish back into the river and took one part of the fish home. B then woke up and divided the remaining fish in the basket into $$3$$ equal parts, also finding $$1$$ fish left over. He threw that extra fish back into the river and took one part of the fish home. Finally, C woke up and divided the fish in the basket into $$3$$ equal parts, also finding $$1$$ fish left over. What is the minimum number of fish that the three of them caught?

5702.content: The storage originally had a certain number of tons of coal. In the first shipment, half of the original coal was taken out, in the second shipment, $$150$$ tons were brought in, and in the third shipment, $$50$$ tons were taken out. As a result, there are $$300$$ tons left. How many tons of coal did the storage originally have?

5703.content: Xiao Bai and Xiao Hua saw a magical worm that doubles in size every hour. If it grows to $$20$$ centimeters in one day, how many hours does it take for the worm to grow to $$5$$ centimeters?

5704.content: How many triangles are there in the figure?

5705.content: As shown in the figure, starting from $$A$$ and walking to $$B$$ along the direction of the arrows, how many routes are there from $$A$$ to $$B$$?

5706.content: As shown in the figure, Si Si leaves home to go to school at Xue Er Si, and on the way, he passes by the commercial street for lunch. How many shortest routes can he choose?

5707.content: As shown in the figure, starting from point $$A$$ to point $$D$$ along the line segment, and must pass through point $$B$$, but cannot go through point $$C$$, how many shortest routes are there from point $$A$$ to point $$D$$?

5708.content: In the warm-up exercise before class, an athlete trains for a long-distance run. He runs $$150$$ meters per minute in the first half of the distance and $$100$$ meters per minute in the second half. What is his average speed during the entire long-distance run in meters per minute?

5709.content: [Pre-class Warm-up 1] Person A and Person B start from point A at the same time and walk in opposite directions. Person A walks at a speed of $$7$$ meters per second, while Person B walks at a speed of $$4$$ meters per second. After half an hour, how far apart are the two people?

5710.content: There is a $$7 \times 7$$ square matrix as shown. According to the pattern, if the matrix is developed into a $$99 \times 99$$ square matrix, which letter will be in the bottom right corner?

5711.content: There are two piles of coal. The weight of the first pile is $$5$$ times the weight of the second pile. After using $$36$$ tons from the first pile and $$4$$ tons from the second pile, the remaining weight of the first pile is $$3$$ times that of the second pile. How many tons did the first pile originally have, and how many tons did the second pile originally have?

5712.content: Qingqing has to cross a small hill from home to school. She walks uphill at a speed of $$50$$ meters per minute, and her downhill speed is $$20$$ meters per minute faster than her uphill speed. The distance from home to school is $$2800$$ meters, and it takes her $$50$$ minutes to go to school. How many minutes does it take to return home from school?

5713.content: The distance from the school to the cinema is $$4930$$ meters. Person A and Person B are running towards each other; Person A runs $$40$$ meters per minute, and Person B runs $$50$$ meters per minute. During the run, Person A's shoelaces came undone, and he stopped for $$1$$ minute, while Person B stopped for $$5$$ minutes to chat with an acquaintance. How many minutes does it take from the start until the two meet?

5714.content: Grandpa and Grandma are walking hand in hand in the park. They start from point $$A$$ and walk forward $$4$$ meters, then turn right $$90$$ degrees and walk another $$4$$ meters, then turn right $$90$$ degrees and walk $$4$$ meters, and so on, continuously repeating this pattern. After they have walked $$2004$$ meters, how far are they from the starting point $$A$$?

5715.content: In a certain chicken farm, the number of hens is $$6$$ times the number of roosters. Later, both the roosters and the hens each increased by $$60$$, and the number of hens became $$4$$ times the number of roosters. How many chickens were originally raised on the farm?

5716.content: Arrange $$108$$, $$1008$$, $$10008$$, $$100008$$, $$\cdots $$, and $$100\cdots 08$$ in sequence to form a natural number $$108100810008100008\cdots 100\cdots 08$$ that can be divided by $$81$$. What is the minimum sum of the digits of this number?

5720.content: Fill in the blanks. (1) The perimeter of a square is $$36$$ meters, what is the length of a side of this square in meters, and what is the area of this square in square meters? (2) The area of a rectangle is $$40$$ square meters, the length is $$8$$ meters, what is the width in meters, and what is the perimeter of this rectangle in meters?

5721.content: In the supermarket beverage promotion, the promoter found that if $$3$$ bottles of black tea and $$8$$ bottles of green tea are bundled together, they exactly use up all the beverages, and the number of green tea bottles is $$2$$ times the number of black tea bottles plus $$80$$ bottles. How many bottles of black tea are there, and how many bottles of green tea are there?

5722.content: There are three trucks, $$A$$, $$B$$, and $$C$$. The cargo in truck $$C$$ is half of that in truck $$B$$, truck $$B$$ has $$180$$ grams less cargo than truck $$A$$, and the cargo in truck $$A$$ is four times that in truck $$C$$. How many kilograms of cargo do trucks $$A$$ and $$B$$ have in total?

5723.content: Rhinos, antelopes, and peacocks have a total of $$26$$ heads, $$80$$ legs, and $$20$$ horns. It is known that rhinos have $$4$$ legs and $$1$$ horn, antelopes have $$4$$ legs and $$2$$ horns, and peacocks have $$2$$ legs and no horns. How many rhinos, antelopes, and peacocks are there?

5724.content: In mythology, there are $$3$$ types of creatures: phoenix, heavenly horse, and angel. Among them, the phoenix has $$2$$ wings and $$2$$ legs, the heavenly horse has $$2$$ wings and $$4$$ legs, and the angel has $$6$$ wings and $$2$$ legs. Now, there are a total of $$20$$ creatures, $$80$$ wings, and $$52$$ legs. How many phoenixes, heavenly horses, and angels are there?

5727.content: There are $$16$$ nails nailed to the board, arranged in a square formation of four rows and four columns. How many different squares can be formed using rubber bands?

5733.content: A certain elementary school held a sports meeting, and the students lined up in a $$7 \times 7$$ square formation to participate in a group exercise performance. If one row and one column are removed from this square formation, how many students need to be reduced?

5734.content: At the end of the month, the boss calculates the salaries for everyone. If each person receives $$1000$$ yuan, there is an excess of $$10000$$ yuan; if each person receives $$1500$$ yuan, there is a deficit of $$5000$$ yuan. (1) What is the total difference in distribution between the two salary methods in yuan? (2) How many employees are there in the company, and how much money has the boss prepared to pay salaries?

How many students from school A are participating, how many students from school B are participating, how many students from school C are participating, and how many students from school D are participating?

When Dad's age is $$3$$ times that of the older brother, the younger sister is $$9$$ years old; when the older brother's age is $$2$$ times that of the younger sister, Dad is $$34$$ years old. How old is the older brother, how old is the younger sister, and how old is Dad now?

6238.content: When Dad is celebrating his $$50$$th birthday, the younger brother says: "When I grow up to the age of my older brother, the sum of our ages at that time will equal Dad's age then." How old is the older brother this year?

6240.content: Fifth-grade students are divided into two teams to participate in the school's radio exercise competition. The number of people in Team A exactly fills the hollow part of the square formation. How many people are there in total participating in the radio exercise competition from the fifth grade?

After the matches are completed, what is the maximum possible difference in points between the third-ranked team and the fourth-ranked team, when the scores are arranged from highest to lowest?

6243.content: Four soccer teams play a round-robin tournament. It is stipulated that a win earns $$3$$ points, a draw earns $$1$$ point, and a loss earns $$0$$ points. One team has never won but ranks first. Do you think this is possible? If it is possible, please give an example of when this situation can occur. If it is not possible, please explain your reasoning.

6244.content: As shown in the figure, fill in the numbers from $$1$$ to $$12$$ in the table below, with the requirement that the number in the right cell is greater than the number in the left cell, and the number in the upper cell is greater than the number in the lower cell. How many ways can this be done?

How many meters did it travel in total?

6275.content: How many different natural numbers without repeating digits can be formed using the digits $$1$$, $$2$$, and $$3$$?

6276.content:
The doctor is teaching Eddie and Vera, introducing the concept of "turning."  
Doctor: "For a sequence of numbers, if there are three numbers $$abc$$ in order, and either $$a > b$$ and $$c > b$$ or $$a < b$$ and $$c < b$$, we say that a turn has occurred."  
Eddie: "I understand, for example, $$4321$$ has no turns, while $$1243$$ has one turn."  
Vera: "That's right, and for example, $$1324$$ has two turns."  
Doctor: "Excellent! It seems you both have a solid understanding. Now I want to test you. If we arrange $$1$$, $$2$$, $$3$$, and $$4$$ in a line, how many arrangements can create exactly two turns?"
6276.kc: 数字组数（规定数位大小）

6277.content: In the following equation, different Chinese characters represent different digits, while the same characters represent the same digit. If "巧 + 解 + 数 + 字 + 谜 = 30", what five-digit number does "巧解数字谜" represent?

6278.content: The fruit store mixes $$2$$ kilograms of crispy candy and $$3$$ kilograms of fruit candy to make a mixed candy. It is known that crispy candy sells for $$16$$ yuan per kilogram, and fruit candy sells for $$6$$ yuan per kilogram. What should the mixed candy be sold for per kilogram?

6279.content: The doctor wants to make a wooden stool. He first sawed a piece of wood into $$4$$ sections, which took $$12$$ minutes. If he wants to saw another piece of wood into $$8$$ sections, how many minutes will it take? (Assuming the doctor spends the same amount of time for each cut)

A line segment $$AF$$ divides this parallelogram into two parts, and their areas differ by $$18$$ square centimeters. What is the area of trapezoid $$ABCF$$ in square centimeters?

6281.content: $$A$$, $$B$$, $$C$$, and $$D$$ represent people from China, Japan, the United States, and France, respectively. Each person has one job. It is known that: (1) $$A$$ is a doctor and is Chinese; (2) $$B$$ is a teacher and is French; (3) $$C$$ has a different profession than the Japanese person; (4) $$D$$ cannot practice medicine. What nationality is $$B$$?

It is known that: (1) $$A$$ is a doctor and is Chinese; (2) $$B$$ is a teacher and is French; (3) $$C$$ has a different occupation than the Japanese person; (4) $$D$$ cannot practice medicine. What is $$A$$?

6283.content: $$A$$, $$B$$, $$C$$, and $$D$$ represent people from China, Japan, the United States, and France respectively, and each person has $$1$$ occupation. It is known that: (1) $$A$$ is a doctor and is Chinese; (2) $$B$$ is a teacher and is French; (3) $$C$$ has a different occupation from the Japanese; (4) $$D$$ cannot practice medicine. 6311.content: 【Warm-up 1】"Journey to the West" is one of the four great classical novels of China, describing the story of Sun Wukong, Zhu Bajie, and Sha Heshang protecting Tang Seng on his westward journey to obtain scriptures, enduring 81 hardships, defeating demons along the way, and ultimately acquiring the true scripture. After one month, the shrimp read a total of $$48$$ books, and the crab read a total of $$32$$ books. They have read $$12$$ books in common. How many books did they actually read in total?

The old tree says, "For every number of days the small tree grows, the big tree grows the same number of weeks; for every number of months the small tree grows, I grow the same number of years. Together we are $$1000$$ years old." What are the ages of the old tree, the big tree, and the small tree this year?

How old is Xiao Zhi this year? If dad is six years older than mom, then three years ago, dad's age was ten times Xiao Zhi's age.

6331.content: The two brothers both think that only they grow older by one year each year while others do not grow up. One day, the older brother said to the younger brother, "In $$3$$ years, my age will be twice yours." The younger brother said, "That's not right, in $$3$$ years I will be the same age as you." At that time, how old was the older brother and how old was the younger brother?

6332.content: The sum of the current ages of Dad, older brother, and younger sister is $$64$$ years. When Dad's age is $$3$$ times that of the older brother, the younger sister is $$9$$ years old; when the older brother's age is $$2$$ times that of the younger sister, Dad is $$34$$ years old. What are the current ages of Dad, the older brother, and the younger sister?
6332.kc: 以年龄问题形式运用方程解应用题

6335.content: In the kindergarten, $$378$$ children are arranged in several circles (one circle inside another) to play games. It is known that there are $$22$$ people in the innermost circle and $$62$$ people in the outermost circle.
