6336.content: There is a series of $$11$$ numbers, with the middle number being the largest. Counting backwards from the middle number, each number is $$2$$ less than the previous one; counting forwards from the middle number, each number is $$3$$ less than the previous one. Given that the total sum of these $$11$$ numbers is $$200$$, what is the middle number?

6337.content: The magician performs a trick. At the beginning, there are $$3$$ ping pong balls in the box on the table. The first time, he takes out $$1$$ ball, turns it into $$3$$ balls, and puts them all back in the box; the second time, he takes out $$2$$ balls, turns each ball into $$3$$ balls, and puts them all back in the box... By the tenth time, he takes out $$10$$ balls, turns each ball into $$3$$ balls, and puts them all back in the box. Can you calculate how many ping pong balls are now in the box?

6338.content: In the third-grade class's final math exam, the scores of the top $$10$$ students form an arithmetic sequence. It is known that the full score is $$100$$ points, each student's score is an integer, and the total score of the students ranked $$3$$, $$4$$, $$5$$, and $$6$$ is $$354$$ points. It is also known that Xiao Yue scored $$96$$ points. What score did the student ranked $$10$$ obtain?

6339.content: The sixth term of an arithmetic sequence is $$17$$, and the sum of the first $$5$$ terms is $$40$$. What is the sum of the first $$18$$ terms?

6340.content: For the sequence $$4$$, $$7$$, $$10$$, $$13$$, $$16$$, $$19$$, $$\cdots$$, what is the $$10$$th number? If $$49$$ is the $$n$$th number of this sequence, what is $$n$$? What is the difference between the $$100$$th number and the $$50$$th number?

6341.content: Using red and green small square tiles to cover a square wall: starting from the outside, the outermost layer is red tiles, the second layer is green tiles, the third layer is red tiles, the fourth layer is green tiles... Continuing this way, a total of $$400$$ tiles were used. Which color of tile is more on this wall? How many tiles do the two colors differ by?

6342.content: $$120$$ chess pieces are arranged in a three-layer hollow square formation, with each side of the innermost layer having how many chess pieces?

6343.content: A group of soldiers forms a three-layer hollow square formation, which leaves out $$16$$ people; if one more layer of people is added to the hollow part, there will be $$28$$ people short. How many soldiers are there in total? If they change to a solid square formation, how many people should be on each side?

If one row is added both horizontally and vertically to form a slightly larger solid square, then $$26$$ people are missing. How many students are there in the fourth grade of Xiwang Primary School?

How many kilograms of oil were originally sold from barrel A and how many kilograms were sold from barrel B?

What is the product of the numbers in these two circles?

It is known that there are $$2$$ fewer classes in the third grade than in the fourth grade. (1) How many first aid kits are distributed among the two extra classes in the fourth grade? (2) How many classes are there in the third and fourth grades respectively, and how many first aid kits are there in total? (Fill in the blanks in order.)

If the average score of all students in the kindergarten is $$85$$, and the number of students in the senior class is twice that of the junior class, how many students are there in the middle class?

7649.content: Eddie went to the stationery store to buy stationery for the teacher. The unit prices of the stationery are as follows: automatic pencils are $$4$$ yuan each, pencil cases are $$26$$ yuan each, fountain pens are $$45$$ yuan each, and backpacks are $$128$$ yuan each. If Eddie wants to buy $$32$$ pencils, $$24$$ pencil cases, $$65$$ fountain pens, and $$9$$ backpacks, how much money will Eddie spend?

7650.content: On Sunday, the Young Pioneers helped clean the windows of the nursing home. Xiao Hua cleaned $$7$$ panes, Xiao Hong and Xiao Gang worked together to clean $$13$$ panes, and Xiao Fang cleaned $$4$$ panes. How many panes did each person clean on average?

7651.content: In the future primary school, Class 5 of Grade 3, Group 1 has $$3$$ boys and $$5$$ girls. It is known that in a rope skipping competition, the average score of the girls is $$98$$ points and the average score of the boys is $$90$$ points. What is the average score of this group of students?
